and not pay it back."}, {"time": 383425, "text": "Paul went to war with Argentina."}, {"time": 385896, "text": "I am not inventing."}, {"time": 388014, "text": "This is big. This was huge."}, {"time": 389607, "text": "This was bigger than Tyson vs Holyfield,"}, {"time": 392270, "text": "Ali vs Foreman."}, {"time": 393661, "text": "This was man vs country."}, {"time": 395726, "text": "Paul Singer started going around the world
trying to seize up Argentinian assets."}, {"time": 400497, "text": "At one point, he tried to seize
an Argentinian navy vessel"}, {"time": 405186, "text": "off the coast of Ghana."}, {"time": 406464, "text": "He tried to take over a 350-foot ship"}, {"time": 409924, "text": "while big navy officers
with big guns were on the ship."}, {"time": 413866, "text": "He got the police in Ghana
to show up with a crane"}, {"time": 417424, "text": "and threaten to board the ship,"}, {"time": 418927, "text": "and it wasn't until
the navy officers drew their weapons"}, {"time": 423463, "text": "that they called off the operation."}, {"time": 425770, "text": "That's what I call turning up the heat."}, {"time": 428382, "text": "Now, you may say"}, {"time": 430479, "text": "Paul lost the battle."}, {"time": 432797, "text": "And I'll say, Paul won the war,"}, {"time": 434392, "text": "because Paul didn't get paid one time,"}, {"time": 436256, "text": "he got paid 20 times
his original investment."}, {"time": 440831, "text": "Then you have Barry Rosenstein."}, {"time": 442377, "text": "His fund, Jana Partners,"}, {"time": 443690, "text": "started stealth-mode buying up
stock in Whole Foods,"}, {"time": 446169, "text": "at a time when Whole Foods was struggling."}, {"time": 448596, "text": "They got to eight percent, came out,"}, {"time": 450520, "text": "and pushed Whole Foods
to sell itself to Amazon,"}, {"time": 453300, "text": "and not because Barry wanted
same-day delivery of his organic Doritos."}, {"time": 457373, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 458998, "text": "He wanted to make some money."}, {"time": 461008, "text": "Now, the CEO of Whole Foods,
John Mackey, and the board"}, {"time": 463822, "text": "did not want to sell themselves to Amazon,"}, {"time": 468054, "text": "because that would be
the prime example of selling out."}, {"time": 471275, "text": "But in the end, they caved."}, {"time": 473879, "text": "Why? Because Barry turned up the heat,"}, {"time": 476481, "text": "and he made 300 million
dollars in the process."}, {"time": 479777, "text": "And he did not leave
a very nice impression on John."}, {"time": 483605, "text": "You're not going to see
John and Barry just hugging it out"}, {"time": 486387, "text": "at the Whole Foods café."}, {"time": 488765, "text": "Let's take a very different example now:"}, {"time": 491524, "text": "the Chicago Teachers' Pension Fund,"}, {"time": 494829, "text": "a $10 billion conscious investor."}, {"time": 497915, "text": "They recently came out hard
against private prisons in the US,"}, {"time": 500870, "text": "and good for them."}, {"time": 502259, "text": "As a new parent, I tell you,
I am troubled by devastating images"}, {"time": 505348, "text": "of young children being ripped
out of the arms of their parents"}, {"time": 508877, "text": "at the US border"}, {"time": 510085, "text": "and being placed in private
detention facilities that did too little"}, {"time": 513595, "text": "to help the kids maintain
contact with their parents."}, {"time": 517600, "text": "So what did the Chicago teachers do?"}, {"time": 520459, "text": "Did they get management to make changes?"}, {"time": 523279, "text": "Did they turn up the heat?"}, {"time": 524568, "text": "Did they look management
in the eye and say,"}, {"time": 526711, "text": ""This is no way to run a business."}, {"time": 529044, "text": "There's a different way
to do things. Let me show you"?"}, {"time": 531693, "text": "No. They just sold their stock."}, {"time": 535972, "text": "Selling did nothing."}, {"time": 537452, "text": "It's not like management
woke up the next day"}, {"time": 539853, "text": "and had an epiphany and said,"}, {"time": 541330, "text": ""Gosh, the teachers sold their stock.
We'd better be nice to the kids.""}, {"time": 544850, "text": "No. That didn't happen."}, {"time": 546971, "text": "And despite a decade
of several high-profile divestitures"}, {"time": 550976, "text": "in private prison stock in the US,"}, {"time": 552784, "text": "the stock has continued to climb."}, {"time": 554513, "text": "The stock over that same period
has outperformed the market."}, {"time": 559941, "text": "And the biggest issue is,"}, {"time": 561221, "text": "we went from a set of conscious
investors owning the stock"}, {"time": 564842, "text": "to it potentially being owned by investors
who don't care about these issues"}, {"time": 569632, "text": "and don't care what you think
about these issues."}, {"time": 572423, "text": "And this is my issue
with conscious investors."}, {"time": 575018, "text": "Their MO is to divest"}, {"time": 577175, "text": "or divert money into ESG-focused funds."}, {"time": 580887, "text": "You can't divest your way
to a greener world."}, {"time": 585261, "text": "You can divest your way
to a greener portfolio,"}, {"time": 587603, "text": "not to a greener world."}, {"time": 590722, "text": "So what's it going to take?"}, {"time": 592079, "text": "What's it going to take
to flip the script,"}, {"time": 594154, "text": "to get conscious investors to go
from divesting to engaging,"}, {"time": 597030, "text": "to go from talking about engaging
to actually working with management"}, {"time": 600532, "text": "to make changes that will improve
their ESG performance?"}, {"time": 605478, "text": "Because there's a lot suggesting
they should and they could."}, {"time": 608400, "text": "They should, given the clear correlation
between ESG performance"}, {"time": 611497, "text": "and financial performance."}, {"time": 613877, "text": "They could because the activists
have shown us they could."}, {"time": 617529, "text": "A shareholder can drive
change in a company."}, {"time": 619717, "text": "The difference is, Paul and Barry
do what they do to make money."}, {"time": 624433, "text": "The conscious investors would do it
to improve society and the environment"}, {"time": 629556, "text": "and make money in the process"}, {"time": 631333, "text": "and do it a little more
collaboratively and constructively."}, {"time": 635245, "text": "And they have the backing
of the some of the largest investors."}, {"time": 638274, "text": "Vanguard and BlackRock --
together, they manage trillions."}, {"time": 641287, "text": "They've been increasingly vocal
about the importance of ESG."}, {"time": 645542, "text": "The CEO of BlackRock has been
increasingly vocal in his annual letters"}, {"time": 649550, "text": "about this issue."}, {"time": 651512, "text": "Even Jana Partners, the same OGs
that John called "greedy bastards,""}, {"time": 656306, "text": "recently co-wrote an open letter
to the board of Apple,"}, {"time": 658995, "text": "saying, "Hey, your smartphones
are addictive for children."}, {"time": 662969, "text": "Fix it.""}, {"time": 664813, "text": "Apple is working on it."}, {"time": 667983, "text": "So what it's going to take
is some pressure."}, {"time": 670744, "text": "It's going to take some pressure
on conscious investors"}, {"time": 673373, "text": "to, in turn, put some pressure
on management"}, {"time": 676224, "text": "to make changes that will improve
the environment and society."}, {"time": 681520, "text": "And where do they start?"}, {"time": 682700, "text": "They start by picking an issue
that matters to them"}, {"time": 685535, "text": "and taking a stand on it."}, {"time": 687376, "text": "Take a stand on an issue
that lines up with your purpose:"}, {"time": 691313, "text": "water preservation,
labor rights, diversity."}, {"time": 693982, "text": "As long as it lines up
with your purpose, you are golden."}, {"time": 697393, "text": "And the biggest unlock?"}, {"time": 699052, "text": "Get the senior-most investment
professionals focused on this."}, {"time": 704590, "text": "Today, when an activist
shows up to a campaign,"}, {"time": 706892, "text": "it's the senior investment professional
talking to the CEO and the board"}, {"time": 710375, "text": "and everyone hears about it."}, {"time": 711849, "text": "When a conscious investor shows up
to talk about an ESG issue,"}, {"time": 715420, "text": "it's some junior person
in the risk department"}, {"time": 717885, "text": "talking to some junior person
in the investor relations department,"}, {"time": 721079, "text": "and nobody hears about it,
and that needs to change."}, {"time": 723657, "text": "And it's not some massive leap."}, {"time": 725314, "text": "Today, when a company
underperforms financially,"}, {"time": 727709, "text": "who is on the hook?"}, {"time": 728901, "text": "The senior investment professional."}, {"time": 730595, "text": "So what do they do?"}, {"time": 731777, "text": "They drop everything
and work with management,"}, {"time": 734006, "text": "collaboratively and constructively,"}, {"time": 735742, "text": "to make changes to improve
the company's financial performance."}, {"time": 739270, "text": "The same should be true when the company
underperforms on ESG issues."}, {"time": 742959, "text": "And yes, that requires standardization
on how we measure ESG,"}, {"time": 746721, "text": "but we're on it."}, {"time": 749201, "text": "So folks, here's my call to action:"}, {"time": 751766, "text": "it's your money."}, {"time": 753362, "text": "It's your pension fund,"}, {"time": 754895, "text": "it's your sovereign wealth fund."}, {"time": 756748, "text": "it's your university's endowment."}, {"time": 758419, "text": "It's your money."}, {"time": 759795, "text": "And it's your right to have your money
managed in line with your values."}, {"time": 763910, "text": "So use your voice"}, {"time": 765803, "text": "and trust that it matters."}, {"time": 767902, "text": "It was your voice that got the investors
more conscious in the first place."}, {"time": 771759, "text": "You protested for years,"}, {"time": 773708, "text": "because you didn't feel right
about your money being invested"}, {"time": 776658, "text": "in companies whose values
don't line up with yours."}, {"time": 779466, "text": "It's time to use that voice again."}, {"time": 781373, "text": "But this time, instead of
pushing them to divest,"}, {"time": 783715, "text": "push them to engage, truly engage,
truly work with management"}, {"time": 787273, "text": "to make changes that will improve
their ESG performance."}, {"time": 792449, "text": "You made them aware of the issues."}, {"time": 794548, "text": "You can now focus them on fixing them."}, {"time": 797074, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 798661, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: daniel_kraft_the_pharmacy_of_the_future_personalized_pills_3d_printed_at_home
speaker: Daniel Kraft
title: The pharmacy of the future? Personalized pills, 3D printed at home
transcript:
[{"time": 1560, "text": "We live in a medication nation."}, {"time": 4440, "text": "Four point five billion drug prescriptions
will be prescribed by doctors like me"}, {"time": 9520, "text": "this year, in the United States alone."}, {"time": 11360, "text": "That's 15 for every man, woman and child."}, {"time": 13800, "text": "And for most of us,"}, {"time": 15040, "text": "our experience with this medication
is often confusing number of pills,"}, {"time": 18600, "text": "instructions, side effects,
one-size-fits-all dosing,"}, {"time": 22240, "text": "which all too often
we aren't taking as prescribed."}, {"time": 24720, "text": "And this comes at tremendous expense,"}, {"time": 26760, "text": "costing us our time,
our money and our health."}, {"time": 29680, "text": "And in our now exponential,
connected, data-driven age,"}, {"time": 32600, "text": "I think we can and we must do better."}, {"time": 35880, "text": "So let's take a dive
at some of the challenges we have"}, {"time": 39040, "text": "and some potential solutions."}, {"time": 42120, "text": "Let's start with the fact"}, {"time": 43400, "text": "that many drugs don't work
for those who are prescribed to them."}, {"time": 46680, "text": "The top 10 grossing drugs
in the United States this year,"}, {"time": 51320, "text": "they only benefit one in four
to one in 23 of who take them."}, {"time": 54960, "text": "That's great if you're number one,
but what about everybody else?"}, {"time": 59000, "text": "And what's worse, drugs,
when they sometimes don't work,"}, {"time": 62080, "text": "can still cause side effects."}, {"time": 63520, "text": "Take aspirin -- about one in four of us"}, {"time": 65440, "text": "who take aspirin to reduce
our risk of cardiovascular disease,"}, {"time": 68400, "text": "are unknowingly aspirin-resistant."}, {"time": 70400, "text": "And still have the same risks
of gastrointestinal bleeds"}, {"time": 73400, "text": "that kill thousands every year."}, {"time": 76040, "text": "It's adverse drug reactions like these"}, {"time": 79040, "text": "that are, by some estimates,
the number four leading cause of death"}, {"time": 82240, "text": "in the United States."}, {"time": 83480, "text": "My own grandfather passed away"}, {"time": 84960, "text": "after a single dose of antibiotic
caused his kidneys to fail."}, {"time": 88000, "text": "Now, adverse drug reactions
and side effects"}, {"time": 91000, "text": "are often tied to challenges in dosing."}, {"time": 94040, "text": "I trained in pediatrics -- little people,
internal medicine -- big people,"}, {"time": 97800, "text": "so one night I might have been
on call in the NICU,"}, {"time": 100240, "text": "carefully dosing
to the fraction of a milligram,"}, {"time": 102520, "text": "a medication for a NICU baby."}, {"time": 103960, "text": "The next night --
on call in the emergency room,"}, {"time": 106240, "text": "treating a 400-pound lineman
or a frail nursing-home patient,"}, {"time": 109800, "text": "who, by most accounts, usually
would get the same dose of medications"}, {"time": 113720, "text": "from the formulary."}, {"time": 115040, "text": "Which would mean, most of the time
I would be underdosing the lineman,"}, {"time": 118400, "text": "and overdosing the nursing-home patient."}, {"time": 121440, "text": "And beyond age and weight,"}, {"time": 122840, "text": "we tend to ignore differences
in sex and race in dosing."}, {"time": 126680, "text": "Now, beyond this, we know
we have a massive challenge"}, {"time": 130880, "text": "with noncompliance or low adherence."}, {"time": 133120, "text": "Many of us who need
to take our medications"}, {"time": 135240, "text": "aren't taking them
or are taking them incorrectly."}, {"time": 138080, "text": "You know, 40 percent
of adults in the US over 65"}, {"time": 140800, "text": "are on five or more
prescription medications."}, {"time": 143280, "text": "Sometimes 15 or more."}, {"time": 144640, "text": "And even small improvements in adherence
can dramatically save dollars and lives."}, {"time": 151440, "text": "So, as we think into the future,"}, {"time": 154520, "text": "you think that where we are today,"}, {"time": 156320, "text": "as we often hear about smart,
personalized, targeted drugs,"}, {"time": 160320, "text": "Internet of Things, gene therapy, AI,"}, {"time": 162240, "text": "that we'd already arrived
in this era of precision medicine."}, {"time": 165080, "text": "In reality, we still live in an age"}, {"time": 166800, "text": "of empiric, trial-and-error
imprecision medicine."}, {"time": 169800, "text": "I think we can do better."}, {"time": 171120, "text": "What if we could reimagine ways
to help make your medicine-taking easier?"}, {"time": 175520, "text": "To get the right doses
and combinations to match you?"}, {"time": 179160, "text": "What if we could move beyond
today's literal cutting edge"}, {"time": 181880, "text": "of pill cutters and fax machines,"}, {"time": 184680, "text": "to an era where we could have
better outcomes, lower costs,"}, {"time": 187520, "text": "saving lives and space
in your medicine cabinet?"}, {"time": 191440, "text": "Well, I think part of the solution
is all the emerging ways"}, {"time": 194280, "text": "that we can measure and connect
our health care information."}, {"time": 197800, "text": "Today, we pretty much live
in a reactive, sick-care world,"}, {"time": 200880, "text": "siloed information that doesn't flow."}, {"time": 203160, "text": "We have the potential to move
into more continuous, real-time"}, {"time": 206160, "text": "proactive world of true health care."}, {"time": 208440, "text": "And part of that starts with
the emerging world of quantified self,"}, {"time": 211640, "text": "we can measure so much
of our physiology and behaviors today,"}, {"time": 214920, "text": "and often it's siloed
on our phones and scales,"}, {"time": 217160, "text": "but it's starting to connect
to our clinicians, our caregivers,"}, {"time": 220160, "text": "so they can better optimize prevention,
diagnostics and therapy."}, {"time": 224840, "text": "And when we can do that,
we can do some interesting things."}, {"time": 227760, "text": "Take, for example, hypertension."}, {"time": 229840, "text": "It's the number one risk factor
for early death and morbidity worldwide."}, {"time": 233680, "text": "Half of adult Americans,
on approximation, have hypertension,"}, {"time": 237000, "text": "less than half have it well-controlled."}, {"time": 239040, "text": "It's often because it takes two
or three different classes of medications,"}, {"time": 242541, "text": "it's tough to do adherence and adjust
your blood pressure medications."}, {"time": 245880, "text": "We have 500 preventable deaths
from noncontrolled hypertension"}, {"time": 248880, "text": "in the US, every day."}, {"time": 250920, "text": "But now we're in the era
of connected blood pressure cuffs --"}, {"time": 253802, "text": "the FDA just approved
a blood pressure cuff"}, {"time": 255880, "text": "that can go into your watch."}, {"time": 257560, "text": "There are now prototypes of cuffless
radar-based blood pressure devices"}, {"time": 261079, "text": "that can continuously stream
your blood pressure."}, {"time": 263760, "text": "So, in the future, I could --"}, {"time": 265240, "text": "instead of spot-checking
my blood pressure in the clinic,"}, {"time": 267931, "text": "my doctor could see
my real-time numbers and my trends,"}, {"time": 270531, "text": "and adjust them as necessary,"}, {"time": 272720, "text": "with the help of a blood pressure
dosing algorithm,"}, {"time": 275160, "text": "or using the Internet of Things."}, {"time": 277520, "text": "Now, technology today can do even more."}, {"time": 280920, "text": "My smartwatch, already today,
has an EKG built in,"}, {"time": 283320, "text": "that can be read
by artificial intelligence."}, {"time": 286680, "text": "I'm wearing a small, Band-Aid-sized patch,"}, {"time": 289640, "text": "that is live-streaming
my vital signs right now."}, {"time": 291920, "text": "Let's take a look."}, {"time": 293160, "text": "They're actually a little
concerning at the moment."}, {"time": 295600, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 297920, "text": "Now, it's not just my real-time vitals"}, {"time": 300360, "text": "that can be seen
by my medical team or myself,"}, {"time": 302560, "text": "it could be my retrospective data,"}, {"time": 304280, "text": "and again, that'd be used to modify
dosing and medication going forward."}, {"time": 308280, "text": "Even my weight can be super-quantified."}, {"time": 310720, "text": "My weight, now my shape,
how much body mass, fat,"}, {"time": 315640, "text": "muscle mass I might have,"}, {"time": 316920, "text": "and use that to optimize
my prevention or therapy."}, {"time": 320800, "text": "And it's not just for the tech-savvy."}, {"time": 322640, "text": "Now, MIT engineers have modified wi-fi"}, {"time": 325800, "text": "so we can seamlessly
connect and collect our vital signs,"}, {"time": 329280, "text": "from our connected rings
and smart mattresses,"}, {"time": 331560, "text": "we can start to share
this digital exhaust, our digitome,"}, {"time": 334280, "text": "and even potentially crowdsource it,
sharing our health information,"}, {"time": 337520, "text": "just like we share
with our Google Maps and driving,"}, {"time": 340000, "text": "to improve our -- not our driving,
but our health experience globally."}, {"time": 344880, "text": "So, that's great."}, {"time": 346320, "text": "We can potentially now
collect this information."}, {"time": 348640, "text": "What if your labs
can go from the central lab"}, {"time": 352440, "text": "to your home, to your phone,
to even inside our bodies"}, {"time": 355000, "text": "to measure drug levels or other varieties?"}, {"time": 358040, "text": "And of course,
we're in the age of genomics."}, {"time": 360160, "text": "I've been sequenced,
it's just less than 1,000 dollars today."}, {"time": 363080, "text": "And I can start to understand
my pharmacogenomics --"}, {"time": 365560, "text": "how my genes impact
whether I need high dose, low dose,"}, {"time": 368200, "text": "or maybe a different
medication altogether."}, {"time": 370280, "text": "Let's imagine if your physician
or your pharmacist,"}, {"time": 373080, "text": "had this information
integrated into their workflow,"}, {"time": 375760, "text": "augmented with artificial intelligence,
AI, or as I like to refer to it, IA --"}, {"time": 379640, "text": "intelligence augmentation,"}, {"time": 381240, "text": "to leverage that information,"}, {"time": 382680, "text": "to understand of the 18,000
or more approved drugs,"}, {"time": 385280, "text": "which would be the right dose
and combination for you."}, {"time": 388640, "text": "So great, now maybe we can
optimize your drugs and your doses,"}, {"time": 391680, "text": "but the problem today is,
we're still using this amazing technology"}, {"time": 394847, "text": "to keep track of our drugs."}, {"time": 396760, "text": "And of course, these technologies evolve,"}, {"time": 399360, "text": "there's connected dispensers,
reminder apps,"}, {"time": 402520, "text": "smart pill bottle caps that can text
or tweet you or your mother"}, {"time": 405560, "text": "if you haven't taken your medications."}, {"time": 407440, "text": "PillPack was just acquired by Amazon,"}, {"time": 409280, "text": "so soon we may have same-day delivery
of our drugs, delivered by drone."}, {"time": 413800, "text": "So, all these things are possible today,"}, {"time": 416000, "text": "but we're still taking multiple pills."}, {"time": 417920, "text": "What if we can make it simpler?"}, {"time": 419440, "text": "I think one of the solutions
is to make better use of the polypill."}, {"time": 422640, "text": "A polypill is the integration of multiple
medications into a single pill."}, {"time": 426120, "text": "And we have these today in common,
over-the-counter cold and flu remedies."}, {"time": 429640, "text": "And there have been
prevention polypill studies done,"}, {"time": 432160, "text": "giving combinations
of statins, blood pressure, aspirin,"}, {"time": 434840, "text": "which in randomized studies
have been shown"}, {"time": 436920, "text": "to dramatically reduce risk,
compared to placebo."}, {"time": 439280, "text": "But these polypills weren't personalized,
they weren't optimized to the individual."}, {"time": 443240, "text": "What if we could optimize
your personalized polypill?"}, {"time": 445760, "text": "So it would be built for you,
based on you, it could adapt to you,"}, {"time": 449120, "text": "even every single day."}, {"time": 450920, "text": "Well, we're now in the era of 3D printing,
you can print personalized braces,"}, {"time": 454880, "text": "hearing aids, orthopedic devices,"}, {"time": 456520, "text": "even I've been scanned
and had my jeans tailored to fit to me."}, {"time": 460000, "text": "So this got me thinking,"}, {"time": 461320, "text": "what if we could 3D print
your personalized polypill?"}, {"time": 464840, "text": "So instead of taking
six medications, for example,"}, {"time": 467240, "text": "I could integrate them into one."}, {"time": 468960, "text": "So it would be easier to take,
improve adherence"}, {"time": 471320, "text": "and potentially, it could even
integrate in supplements,"}, {"time": 473964, "text": "like vitamin D or CoQ10."}, {"time": 477160, "text": "So with some help --
I call these "IntelliMeds" --"}, {"time": 480160, "text": "and with the help of my
IntelliMedicine engineering team,"}, {"time": 482880, "text": "we built the first
IntelliMedicine prototype printer."}, {"time": 485920, "text": "And here's how it works:"}, {"time": 487160, "text": "instead of full tablets,
we have small micromeds,"}, {"time": 489560, "text": "one or two milligrams each,"}, {"time": 491040, "text": "which are sorted and selected
based on the dose and combination"}, {"time": 494080, "text": "needed for an individual."}, {"time": 495720, "text": "And of course, these would be
doses and combinations"}, {"time": 498200, "text": "you could already take together,
FDA-approved drugs."}, {"time": 500680, "text": "We could change the pharmacokinetics"}, {"time": 502520, "text": "by professionally layering on different
elements to the individual micromeds."}, {"time": 507560, "text": "And when we hit print,"}, {"time": 509240, "text": "you print your combination of medications
that might be needed by you"}, {"time": 512520, "text": "on any individual day."}, {"time": 514280, "text": "And we'd start with, again, generic drugs
for the most common problems."}, {"time": 518200, "text": "About 90 percent of prescribed drugs today
are low-cost generics."}, {"time": 521880, "text": "And once we've printed the pill,
we can do some fun bells and whistles."}, {"time": 525240, "text": "We could print the name of the patient,"}, {"time": 527520, "text": "the date, the day of the week, a QR code."}, {"time": 530080, "text": "We could print different meds for tapering
for a patient on a steroid taper,"}, {"time": 534120, "text": "or tapering from pain medications."}, {"time": 536960, "text": "So, this is actually a look at our
prototype IntelliMedicine printer."}, {"time": 541960, "text": "See, unveil it here."}, {"time": 543960, "text": "It has about 16 different silos,"}, {"time": 546920, "text": "each containing individual micromeds."}, {"time": 550680, "text": "And I can now adjust on the software
individual dosings."}, {"time": 554920, "text": "And when I do that,
the robotic arm will adjust"}, {"time": 558400, "text": "the height of these spansules
and the micromeds will release."}, {"time": 561520, "text": "I can now --"}, {"time": 563080, "text": "The automated process
would rotate and cycle through,"}, {"time": 565600, "text": "to make sure the micromeds are loaded."}, {"time": 567480, "text": "And when I hit print,"}, {"time": 569280, "text": "these will all fall through the device,"}, {"time": 571720, "text": "I now pull out my
personalized printed polypill,"}, {"time": 575360, "text": "with the doses
and medications meant for me."}, {"time": 579360, "text": "And we can take a look,
if you look back to the slides,"}, {"time": 582000, "text": "you can see the whole process,
we can see the drug silos being selected,"}, {"time": 586000, "text": "the pills doing down the different silos,"}, {"time": 588000, "text": "and being collected
in the individual capsule."}, {"time": 590840, "text": "Now, this is great,"}, {"time": 592560, "text": "I can potentially
print my meds based on me,"}, {"time": 594640, "text": "instead of taking six pills."}, {"time": 596040, "text": "I can now be looking
at my individual dosing,"}, {"time": 599200, "text": "my smartwatch is looking
at my blood pressure,"}, {"time": 601400, "text": "I needed an adjustment
in my blood pressure medicines,"}, {"time": 604000, "text": "my coumadin level, my blood is too thin,"}, {"time": 606720, "text": "so I lower my micromed
dose of coumadin, a blood thinner."}, {"time": 610320, "text": "So, this could be
smartly adapted, day to day,"}, {"time": 612520, "text": "programmed by my physician
or cardiologist."}, {"time": 615200, "text": "And you can imagine that larger printers,
fast printers like this,"}, {"time": 618800, "text": "could be in your corner pharmacy,"}, {"time": 621560, "text": "in your doctor's office,
in a rural clinic."}, {"time": 623800, "text": "But it could eventually merge and shrink
to small ones, that could be in your home,"}, {"time": 627760, "text": "with integrated cartridges like this,
that are delivered by drone."}, {"time": 631160, "text": "Could print your personalized polypill,"}, {"time": 633240, "text": "each morning on your kitchen
or your bathroom cabinet."}, {"time": 636560, "text": "And this could evolve, I think,"}, {"time": 638400, "text": "into an incredible way to improve
adherence in medications across the globe."}, {"time": 642240, "text": "So, I hope we can reimagine
the future of medicine in new ways,"}, {"time": 646280, "text": "moving from polypharmacy,"}, {"time": 647840, "text": "one-size-fits-all,
low adherence, complications"}, {"time": 651320, "text": "to an era of personalized,
precise, on-demand medications,"}, {"time": 655400, "text": "that can take us
and individualize our own health"}, {"time": 658800, "text": "and health and medicine around the planet."}, {"time": 661520, "text": "Thank you very much."}, {"time": 662800, "text": "(Applause)"}, {"time": 669880, "text": "Host: Daniel, that's kind of awesome."}, {"time": 671960, "text": "Really cool."}, {"time": 673200, "text": "Question for you, though."}, {"time": 674600, "text": "How long is it until, say, that
nursing-home patient that you mentioned"}, {"time": 678160, "text": "is able to print
their pills in their home?"}, {"time": 680760, "text": "Daniel Kraft: Well, again,
this is just a prototype."}, {"time": 683560, "text": "We think that the regulatory route
be automated compounding,"}, {"time": 686720, "text": "and especially in nursing homes,
folks are taking multiple medications,"}, {"time": 689990, "text": "and they're often mixed up,"}, {"time": 691370, "text": "so it would be a perfect place
to start with these technologies."}, {"time": 694370, "text": "These aren't going to evolve and start
with printers on your bathroom counter."}, {"time": 698030, "text": "We need to be intelligent and smart
about how we roll these things out,"}, {"time": 701380, "text": "but realizing there's so many challenges
with dosing, adherence and precision,"}, {"time": 705090, "text": "and now that we have
all these amazing new technologies"}, {"time": 707680, "text": "that can integrate and be leveraged,
I think we need approaches like this
to really catalyze and foster"}, {"time": 709700, "text": "I think we need approaches like this
to really catalyze and foster"}, {"time": 712180, "text": "a true future of health and medicine."}, {"time": 714020, "text": "Host: Great, thank you.
DK: Thanks."}, {"time": 716360, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: kate_darling_why_we_have_an_emotional_connection_to_robots
speaker: Kate Darling
title: Why we have an emotional connection to robots
transcript:
[{"time": 1047, "text": "There was a day, about 10 years ago,"}, {"time": 3579, "text": "when I asked a friend to hold
a baby dinosaur robot upside down."}, {"time": 9889, "text": "It was this toy called a Pleo
that I had ordered,"}, {"time": 13359, "text": "and I was really excited about it
because I've always loved robots."}, {"time": 17784, "text": "And this one has really cool
technical features."}, {"time": 20087, "text": "It had motors and touch sensors"}, {"time": 22230, "text": "and it had an infrared camera."}, {"time": 24498, "text": "And one of the things it had
was a tilt sensor,"}, {"time": 27285, "text": "so it knew what direction it was facing."}, {"time": 30095, "text": "And when you held it upside down,"}, {"time": 32253, "text": "it would start to cry."}, {"time": 34527, "text": "And I thought this was super cool,
so I was showing it off to my friend,"}, {"time": 38047, "text": "and I said, "Oh, hold it up by the tail.
See what it does.""}, {"time": 43268, "text": "So we're watching
the theatrics of this robot"}, {"time": 46917, "text": "struggle and cry out."}, {"time": 50767, "text": "And after a few seconds,"}, {"time": 52838, "text": "it starts to bother me a little,"}, {"time": 55744, "text": "and I said, "OK, that's enough now."}, {"time": 59930, "text": "Let's put him back down.""}, {"time": 62259, "text": "And then I pet the robot
to make it stop crying."}, {"time": 66973, "text": "And that was kind of
a weird experience for me."}, {"time": 70084, "text": "For one thing, I wasn't the most
maternal person at the time."}, {"time": 74677, "text": "Although since then I've become
a mother, nine months ago,"}, {"time": 77432, "text": "and I've learned that babies also squirm
when you hold them upside down."}, {"time": 80889, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 83023, "text": "But my response to this robot
was also interesting"}, {"time": 85405, "text": "because I knew exactly
how this machine worked,"}, {"time": 89530, "text": "and yet I still felt
compelled to be kind to it."}, {"time": 94450, "text": "And that observation sparked a curiosity"}, {"time": 97181, "text": "that I've spent the past decade pursuing."}, {"time": 100911, "text": "Why did I comfort this robot?"}, {"time": 104228, "text": "And one of the things I discovered
was that my treatment of this machine"}, {"time": 107831, "text": "was more than just an awkward moment
in my living room,"}, {"time": 111556, "text": "that in a world where we're increasingly
integrating robots into our lives,"}, {"time": 117000, "text": "an instinct like that
might actually have consequences,"}, {"time": 121452, "text": "because the first thing that I discovered
is that it's not just me."}, {"time": 127249, "text": "In 2007, the Washington Post
reported that the United States military"}, {"time": 132075, "text": "was testing this robot
that defused land mines."}, {"time": 135329, "text": "And the way it worked
was it was shaped like a stick insect"}, {"time": 138265, "text": "and it would walk
around a minefield on its legs,"}, {"time": 140940, "text": "and every time it stepped on a mine,
one of the legs would blow up,"}, {"time": 144170, "text": "and it would continue on the other legs
to blow up more mines."}, {"time": 147251, "text": "And the colonel who was in charge
of this testing exercise"}, {"time": 151061, "text": "ends up calling it off,"}, {"time": 153203, "text": "because, he says, it's too inhumane"}, {"time": 155662, "text": "to watch this damaged robot
drag itself along the minefield."}, {"time": 162978, "text": "Now, what would cause
a hardened military officer"}, {"time": 166899, "text": "and someone like myself"}, {"time": 168966, "text": "to have this response to robots?"}, {"time": 171537, "text": "Well, of course, we're primed
by science fiction and pop culture"}, {"time": 174871, "text": "to really want to personify these things,"}, {"time": 177474, "text": "but it goes a little bit deeper than that."}, {"time": 180287, "text": "It turns out that we're biologically
hardwired to project intent and life"}, {"time": 185620, "text": "onto any movement in our physical space
that seems autonomous to us."}, {"time": 191214, "text": "So people will treat all sorts
of robots like they're alive."}, {"time": 194703, "text": "These bomb-disposal units get names."}, {"time": 197410, "text": "They get medals of honor."}, {"time": 199116, "text": "They've had funerals for them
with gun salutes."}, {"time": 202380, "text": "And research shows that we do this
even with very simple household robots,"}, {"time": 206237, "text": "like the Roomba vacuum cleaner."}, {"time": 208396, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 209711, "text": "It's just a disc that roams
around your floor to clean it,"}, {"time": 212824, "text": "but just the fact it's moving
around on its own"}, {"time": 215154, "text": "will cause people to name the Roomba"}, {"time": 217345, "text": "and feel bad for the Roomba
when it gets stuck under the couch."}, {"time": 220551, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 222440, "text": "And we can design robots
specifically to evoke this response,"}, {"time": 225804, "text": "using eyes and faces or movements"}, {"time": 229289, "text": "that people automatically,
subconsciously associate"}, {"time": 232572, "text": "with states of mind."}, {"time": 234616, "text": "And there's an entire body of research
called human-robot interaction"}, {"time": 237933, "text": "that really shows how well this works."}, {"time": 239783, "text": "So for example, researchers
at Stanford University found out"}, {"time": 242933, "text": "that it makes people really uncomfortable"}, {"time": 244958, "text": "when you ask them to touch
a robot's private parts."}, {"time": 247454, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 249598, "text": "So from this, but from many other studies,"}, {"time": 251645, "text": "we know, we know that people
respond to the cues given to them"}, {"time": 255892, "text": "by these lifelike machines,"}, {"time": 257938, "text": "even if they know that they're not real."}, {"time": 261654, "text": "Now, we're headed towards a world
where robots are everywhere."}, {"time": 265734, "text": "Robotic technology is moving out
from behind factory walls."}, {"time": 268823, "text": "It's entering workplaces, households."}, {"time": 271860, "text": "And as these machines that can sense
and make autonomous decisions and learn"}, {"time": 278093, "text": "enter into these shared spaces,"}, {"time": 280669, "text": "I think that maybe the best
analogy we have for this"}, {"time": 283189, "text": "is our relationship with animals."}, {"time": 285523, "text": "Thousands of years ago,
we started to domesticate animals,"}, {"time": 289435, "text": "and we trained them for work
and weaponry and companionship."}, {"time": 293504, "text": "And throughout history, we've treated
some animals like tools or like products,"}, {"time": 298513, "text": "and other animals,
we've treated with kindness"}, {"time": 300711, "text": "and we've given a place in society
as our companions."}, {"time": 303813, "text": "I think it's plausible we might start
to integrate robots in similar ways."}, {"time": 309484, "text": "And sure, animals are alive."}, {"time": 312604, "text": "Robots are not."}, {"time": 315626, "text": "And I can tell you,
from working with roboticists,"}, {"time": 318230, "text": "that we're pretty far away from developing
robots that can feel anything."}, {"time": 323072, "text": "But we feel for them,"}, {"time": 325835, "text": "and that matters,"}, {"time": 327066, "text": "because if we're trying to integrate
robots into these shared spaces,"}, {"time": 330717, "text": "we need to understand that people will
treat them differently than other devices,"}, {"time": 335369, "text": "and that in some cases,"}, {"time": 337237, "text": "for example, the case of a soldier
who becomes emotionally attached"}, {"time": 340433, "text": "to the robot that they work with,"}, {"time": 342504, "text": "that can be anything
from inefficient to dangerous."}, {"time": 346551, "text": "But in other cases,
it can actually be useful"}, {"time": 348713, "text": "to foster this emotional
connection to robots."}, {"time": 352184, "text": "We're already seeing some great use cases,"}, {"time": 354342, "text": "for example, robots working
with autistic children"}, {"time": 356970, "text": "to engage them in ways
that we haven't seen previously,"}, {"time": 360628, "text": "or robots working with teachers to engage
kids in learning with new results."}, {"time": 365433, "text": "And it's not just for kids."}, {"time": 367750, "text": "Early studies show that robots
can help doctors and patients"}, {"time": 370997, "text": "in health care settings."}, {"time": 373535, "text": "This is the PARO baby seal robot."}, {"time": 375369, "text": "It's used in nursing homes
and with dementia patients."}, {"time": 378678, "text": "It's been around for a while."}, {"time": 380272, "text": "And I remember, years ago,
being at a party"}, {"time": 383621, "text": "and telling someone about this robot,"}, {"time": 386216, "text": "and her response was,"}, {"time": 388366, "text": ""Oh my gosh."}, {"time": 390508, "text": "That's horrible."}, {"time": 393056, "text": "I can't believe we're giving people
robots instead of human care.""}, {"time": 398540, "text": "And this is a really common response,"}, {"time": 400439, "text": "and I think it's absolutely correct,"}, {"time": 402962, "text": "because that would be terrible."}, {"time": 405795, "text": "But in this case,
it's not what this robot replaces."}, {"time": 408858, "text": "What this robot replaces is animal therapy"}, {"time": 412002, "text": "in contexts where
we can't use real animals"}, {"time": 415224, "text": "but we can use robots,"}, {"time": 416416, "text": "because people will consistently treat
them more like an animal than a device."}, {"time": 423502, "text": "Acknowledging this emotional
connection to robots"}, {"time": 425906, "text": "can also help us anticipate challenges"}, {"time": 427899, "text": "as these devices move into more intimate
areas of people's lives."}, {"time": 432111, "text": "For example, is it OK
if your child's teddy bear robot"}, {"time": 435539, "text": "records private conversations?"}, {"time": 437800, "text": "Is it OK if your sex robot
has compelling in-app purchases?"}, {"time": 441887, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 443307, "text": "Because robots plus capitalism"}, {"time": 445832, "text": "equals questions around
consumer protection and privacy."}, {"time": 450549, "text": "And those aren't the only reasons"}, {"time": 452185, "text": "that our behavior around
these machines could matter."}, {"time": 456747, "text": "A few years after that first
initial experience I had"}, {"time": 460041, "text": "with this baby dinosaur robot,"}, {"time": 462376, "text": "I did a workshop
with my friend Hannes Gassert."}, {"time": 464901, "text": "And we took five
of these baby dinosaur robots"}, {"time": 467822, "text": "and we gave them to five teams of people."}, {"time": 470299, "text": "And we had them name them"}, {"time": 472020, "text": "and play with them and interact with them
for about an hour."}, {"time": 476707, "text": "And then we unveiled
a hammer and a hatchet"}, {"time": 478937, "text": "and we told them to torture
and kill the robots."}, {"time": 481239, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 484857, "text": "And this turned out to be
a little more dramatic"}, {"time": 487175, "text": "than we expected it to be,"}, {"time": 488477, "text": "because none of the participants
would even so much as strike"}, {"time": 491573, "text": "these baby dinosaur robots,"}, {"time": 492904, "text": "so we had to improvise a little,
and at some point, we said,"}, {"time": 498078, "text": ""OK, you can save your team's robot
if you destroy another team's robot.""}, {"time": 502539, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 504839, "text": "And even that didn't work.
They couldn't do it."}, {"time": 507058, "text": "So finally, we said,"}, {"time": 508233, "text": ""We're going to destroy all of the robots"}, {"time": 510289, "text": "unless someone takes
a hatchet to one of them.""}, {"time": 513586, "text": "And this guy stood up,
and he took the hatchet,"}, {"time": 517189, "text": "and the whole room winced
as he brought the hatchet down"}, {"time": 519919, "text": "on the robot's neck,"}, {"time": 521723, "text": "and there was this half-joking,
half-serious moment of silence in the room"}, {"time": 528085, "text": "for this fallen robot."}, {"time": 529807, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 531237, "text": "So that was a really
interesting experience."}, {"time": 534955, "text": "Now, it wasn't a controlled
study, obviously,"}, {"time": 537438, "text": "but it did lead to some
later research that I did at MIT"}, {"time": 540312, "text": "with Palash Nandy and Cynthia Breazeal,"}, {"time": 542564, "text": "where we had people come into the lab
and smash these HEXBUGs"}, {"time": 546215, "text": "that move around in a really
lifelike way, like insects."}, {"time": 549326, "text": "So instead of choosing something cute
that people are drawn to,"}, {"time": 552484, "text": "we chose something more basic,"}, {"time": 554601, "text": "and what we found
was that high-empathy people"}, {"time": 558105, "text": "would hesitate more to hit the HEXBUGS."}, {"time": 561575, "text": "Now this is just a little study,"}, {"time": 563163, "text": "but it's part of a larger body of research"}, {"time": 565576, "text": "that is starting to indicate
that there may be a connection"}, {"time": 568544, "text": "between people's tendencies for empathy"}, {"time": 570941, "text": "and their behavior around robots."}, {"time": 573721, "text": "But my question for the coming era
of human-robot interaction"}, {"time": 577372, "text": "is not: "Do we empathize with robots?""}, {"time": 581211, "text": "It's: "Can robots change
people's empathy?""}, {"time": 585489, "text": "Is there reason to, for example,"}, {"time": 587800, "text": "prevent your child
from kicking a robotic dog,"}, {"time": 591228, "text": "not just out of respect for property,"}, {"time": 594166, "text": "but because the child might be
more likely to kick a real dog?"}, {"time": 598507, "text": "And again, it's not just kids."}, {"time": 601564, "text": "This is the violent video games question,
but it's on a completely new level"}, {"time": 605644, "text": "because of this visceral physicality
that we respond more intensely to"}, {"time": 610428, "text": "than to images on a screen."}, {"time": 613674, "text": "When we behave violently towards robots,"}, {"time": 616276, "text": "specifically robots
that are designed to mimic life,"}, {"time": 619420, "text": "is that a healthy outlet
for violent behavior"}, {"time": 623336, "text": "or is that training our cruelty muscles?"}, {"time": 627511, "text": "We don't know ..."}, {"time": 630622, "text": "But the answer to this question has
the potential to impact human behavior,"}, {"time": 634591, "text": "it has the potential
to impact social norms,"}, {"time": 637383, "text": "it has the potential to inspire rules
around what we can and can't do"}, {"time": 641256, "text": "with certain robots,"}, {"time": 642431, "text": "similar to our animal cruelty laws."}, {"time": 645228, "text": "Because even if robots can't feel,"}, {"time": 648116, "text": "our behavior towards them
might matter for us."}, {"time": 652889, "text": "And regardless of whether
we end up changing our rules,"}, {"time": 656926, "text": "robots might be able to help us
come to a new understanding of ourselves."}, {"time": 662276, "text": "Most of what I've learned
over the past 10 years"}, {"time": 664616, "text": "has not been about technology at all."}, {"time": 666878, "text": "It's been about human psychology"}, {"time": 669405, "text": "and empathy and how we relate to others."}, {"time": 673524, "text": "Because when a child is kind to a Roomba,"}, {"time": 677262, "text": "when a soldier tries to save
a robot on the battlefield,"}, {"time": 681301, "text": "or when a group of people refuses
to harm a robotic baby dinosaur,"}, {"time": 686248, "text": "those robots aren't just motors
and gears and algorithms."}, {"time": 690501, "text": "They're reflections of our own humanity."}, {"time": 693523, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 694698, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: kelly_richmond_pope_how_whistle_blowers_shape_history
speaker: Kelly Richmond Pope
title: How whistle-blowers shape history
transcript:
[{"time": 1520, "text": "How many of us have ever seen something,"}, {"time": 4320, "text": "thought that we should report it,
but decided not to?"}, {"time": 9120, "text": "And not that I need
to see a show of hands,"}, {"time": 11160, "text": "but I'm sure this has happened
to someone in this room before."}, {"time": 14240, "text": "In fact, when this question
was asked to a group of employees,"}, {"time": 17440, "text": "46 percent of them responded
by saying that they had seen something"}, {"time": 20960, "text": "and decided not to report it."}, {"time": 22600, "text": "So if you raised your hand,
or quietly raised your hand,"}, {"time": 25760, "text": "don't feel bad, you're not alone."}, {"time": 28080, "text": "This message of if you see something
to say something"}, {"time": 31480, "text": "is really all around us."}, {"time": 33280, "text": "Even when driving down the highway,
you see billboards like this,"}, {"time": 37000, "text": "encouraging us to report crime
without revealing ourselves."}, {"time": 40480, "text": "But I still feel like a lot of us
are really uncomfortable"}, {"time": 43240, "text": "coming forward in the name of the truth."}, {"time": 45440, "text": "I'm an accounting professor,
and I do fraud research."}, {"time": 48040, "text": "And in my class, I encourage my students
to come forward with information"}, {"time": 52240, "text": "if they see it."}, {"time": 53480, "text": "Or in other words, encouraging
my students to become whistle-blowers."}, {"time": 57240, "text": "But if I'm being completely
honest with myself,"}, {"time": 60320, "text": "I am really conflicted with this message
that I'm sending to my students."}, {"time": 63960, "text": "And here's why."}, {"time": 66000, "text": "Whistle-blowers are under attack."}, {"time": 69560, "text": "Headline after headline shows us this."}, {"time": 73960, "text": "Many people choose
not to become whistle-blowers"}, {"time": 76360, "text": "due to the fear of retaliation."}, {"time": 78640, "text": "From demotions to death threats,"}, {"time": 82360, "text": "to job loss --"}, {"time": 84280, "text": "perpetual job loss."}, {"time": 86160, "text": "Choosing to become a whistle-blower
is an uphill battle."}, {"time": 89560, "text": "Their loyalty becomes into question."}, {"time": 92000, "text": "Their motives, their trustworthiness."}, {"time": 95240, "text": "So how can I, as a professor
who really cares about her students"}, {"time": 99000, "text": "encourage them to become whistle-blowers,"}, {"time": 101120, "text": "when I know how the world
truly feels about them?"}, {"time": 104720, "text": "So, one day I was getting ready
for my annual whistle-blower lecture"}, {"time": 107960, "text": "with my students."}, {"time": 109200, "text": "And I was working
on an article for "Forbes,""}, {"time": 111360, "text": "entitled "Wells Fargo
and Millennial Whistle-blowing."}, {"time": 113880, "text": "What Do We Tell Them?""}, {"time": 115120, "text": "And as I was working on this piece
and reading about the case,"}, {"time": 118200, "text": "I became outraged."}, {"time": 119600, "text": "And what made me angry
was when I came to the fact and realized"}, {"time": 123760, "text": "that the employees
that tried to whistle-blow"}, {"time": 126440, "text": "were actually fired."}, {"time": 128160, "text": "And it really made me think"}, {"time": 129520, "text": "about the message
that I was sharing with my students."}, {"time": 132280, "text": "And it made me think: What if my students
had been Wells Fargo employees?"}, {"time": 137120, "text": "On the one hand, if they whistle-blew,
they would have gotten fired."}, {"time": 141280, "text": "But on the other hand,"}, {"time": 142640, "text": "if they didn't report
the frauds that they knew,"}, {"time": 145360, "text": "the way current regulation is written,"}, {"time": 147720, "text": "employees are held responsible"}, {"time": 150320, "text": "if they knew something
and didn't report it."}, {"time": 152640, "text": "So criminal prosecution is a real option."}, {"time": 155640, "text": "What's a person supposed to do
with those type of odds?"}, {"time": 158840, "text": "I of all people know
the valuable contributions"}, {"time": 162800, "text": "that whistle-blowers make."}, {"time": 164360, "text": "In fact, most frauds
are discovered by them."}, {"time": 167920, "text": "Forty two percent of frauds
are discovered by a whistle-blower"}, {"time": 170880, "text": "in comparison to other methods,"}, {"time": 172760, "text": "like measurement review
and external audit."}, {"time": 175360, "text": "And when you think
about some of the more classic"}, {"time": 177720, "text": "or historical fraud cases,"}, {"time": 179360, "text": "it always is around a whistle-blower."}, {"time": 182120, "text": "Think Watergate --
discovered by a whistle-blower."}, {"time": 184880, "text": "Think Enron -- discovered
by a whistle-blower."}, {"time": 187800, "text": "And who can forget about Bernard Madoff,
discovered by a whistle-blower?"}, {"time": 192400, "text": "It takes a tremendous amount of courage
to come forward in the name of the truth."}, {"time": 196880, "text": "But when we think
about the term whistle-blower,"}, {"time": 199600, "text": "we often think of some
very descriptive words:"}, {"time": 203280, "text": "rat,"}, {"time": 205360, "text": "snake,"}, {"time": 207200, "text": "traitor,"}, {"time": 208840, "text": "tattletale, weasel."}, {"time": 211240, "text": "And those are the nice words,
the ones I can say from the stage."}, {"time": 214840, "text": "And so when I'm not in class,"}, {"time": 216280, "text": "I go around the country
and I interview white-collar felons,"}, {"time": 219200, "text": "whistle-blowers and victims of fraud."}, {"time": 221240, "text": "Because really I'm trying to understand
what makes them tick"}, {"time": 224200, "text": "and to bring those experiences
back into the classroom."}, {"time": 227680, "text": "But it's my interviews with
whistle-blowers that really stick with me."}, {"time": 231560, "text": "And they stick with me,"}, {"time": 232800, "text": "because they make me question
my own courage."}, {"time": 235120, "text": "When given the opportunity,
would I actually speak up?"}, {"time": 239000, "text": "And so, this is a couple stories
that I want to share with you."}, {"time": 242000, "text": "This is Mary."}, {"time": 243240, "text": "Mary Willingham is the whistle-blower
from the University of North Carolina"}, {"time": 246960, "text": "at Chapel Hill, academic fraud case."}, {"time": 250160, "text": "And Mary was a learning specialist
at the university,"}, {"time": 253640, "text": "and she worked with students,
primarily student athletes."}, {"time": 256680, "text": "And what she noticed,
when she was working with students,"}, {"time": 259399, "text": "is they were turning in term papers"}, {"time": 262160, "text": "that seemed well beyond
their reading levels."}, {"time": 265280, "text": "She started to ask a couple of questions"}, {"time": 267240, "text": "and she found out
that there was a database"}, {"time": 269280, "text": "where the student athletes
could retrieve papers and turn them in."}, {"time": 272680, "text": "And then she found out
that some of her colleagues"}, {"time": 275160, "text": "were funneling students into fake classes,
just to keep them eligible to play."}, {"time": 281400, "text": "Now, when Mary found this out,
she was outraged."}, {"time": 284160, "text": "And so what she tried to do
was go to her direct supervisor."}, {"time": 287120, "text": "But they didn't do anything."}, {"time": 289000, "text": "And then Mary tried to go to some
internal university administrators."}, {"time": 292840, "text": "And they didn't do anything."}, {"time": 294480, "text": "So, what happens when nobody listens?"}, {"time": 296880, "text": "You blog."}, {"time": 298120, "text": "So Mary decided to develop a blog."}, {"time": 300000, "text": "Her blog went viral within 24 hours,"}, {"time": 302680, "text": "and she was contacted by a reporter."}, {"time": 305200, "text": "Now, when she was contacted
by this reporter,"}, {"time": 307520, "text": "her identity was known."}, {"time": 309320, "text": "She was exposed."}, {"time": 310680, "text": "And when she was exposed,
she received a demotion,"}, {"time": 314520, "text": "death threats, over collegiate sports."}, {"time": 318280, "text": "Mary didn't do anything wrong.
She didn't participate in the fraud."}, {"time": 322120, "text": "She really thought
that she was giving voice"}, {"time": 324360, "text": "to students that were voiceless."}, {"time": 326680, "text": "But her loyalty was questioned."}, {"time": 329080, "text": "Her trustworthiness and her motives."}, {"time": 333480, "text": "Now, whistle-blowing
doesn't always have to end"}, {"time": 336880, "text": "in demotions or death threats."}, {"time": 338600, "text": "Actually, in 2002, this was
the cover of "Time" magazine,"}, {"time": 342560, "text": "where we were actually honoring
three brave whistle-blowers"}, {"time": 345920, "text": "for their decision to come forward
in the name of the truth."}, {"time": 348880, "text": "And when you look at the research,"}, {"time": 350560, "text": "22 percent of whistle-blowers
actually report retaliation."}, {"time": 354160, "text": "So there is a huge population of people
that report and are not retaliated against"}, {"time": 359640, "text": "and that gives me hope."}, {"time": 362280, "text": "So this is Kathe."}, {"time": 363960, "text": "Kathe Swanson is a retired city clerk
from the city of Dixon."}, {"time": 368400, "text": "And one day, Kathe was doing her job,
just like she always did,"}, {"time": 372080, "text": "and she stumbled upon
a pretty interesting case."}, {"time": 375840, "text": "See, Kathe was at the end of the month,"}, {"time": 377720, "text": "and she was doing
her treasures report for the city,"}, {"time": 380520, "text": "and typically, her boss, Rita Crundwell,
gave her a list of accounts and said,"}, {"time": 384600, "text": ""Kathe, call the bank
and get these specific accounts.""}, {"time": 387600, "text": "And Kathe did her job."}, {"time": 389280, "text": "But this particular day,"}, {"time": 390680, "text": "Rita was out of town, and Kathe was busy."}, {"time": 393160, "text": "She picks up the phone, she calls the bank
and says, "Fax me all of the accounts.""}, {"time": 398360, "text": "And when she gets the fax,
she sees that there is an account"}, {"time": 401680, "text": "that has some withdrawals
and deposits in it"}, {"time": 403840, "text": "that she did not know about."}, {"time": 405320, "text": "It was an account controlled only by Rita."}, {"time": 408640, "text": "So Kathe looked at the information,
she reported it to her direct supervisor,"}, {"time": 412640, "text": "which was then-mayor Burke,"}, {"time": 414800, "text": "and this led into a huge investigation,
a six-month investigation."}, {"time": 419200, "text": "Come to find out, Kathe's boss,
Rita Crundwell, was embezzling money."}, {"time": 424240, "text": "Rita was embezzling 53 million dollars
over a 20-year period,"}, {"time": 429480, "text": "and Kathe just happened
to stumble upon it."}, {"time": 433080, "text": "Kathe is a hero."}, {"time": 436040, "text": "And actually, I had the opportunity"}, {"time": 437760, "text": "of interviewing Kathe for my documentary,
"All the Queen's Horses.""}, {"time": 441160, "text": "And Kathe wasn't seeking fame."}, {"time": 443520, "text": "In fact, she really didn't want
to talk to me for a really long time,"}, {"time": 447000, "text": "but through strategic stalking,
she ended up doing the interview."}, {"time": 450120, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 451280, "text": "But she was seeking fairness, not fame."}, {"time": 453520, "text": "And if it wasn't for Kathe,"}, {"time": 455160, "text": "who's to say this fraud
would have ever been discovered?"}, {"time": 459120, "text": "So, remember that "Forbes" article
I was talking about,"}, {"time": 461760, "text": "that I was working on before my lecture?"}, {"time": 463689, "text": "Well, I posted it and something
really fantastic happened."}, {"time": 467280, "text": "I started receiving emails
from whistle-blowers all over the world."}, {"time": 472000, "text": "And as I was receiving these emails
and responding back to them,"}, {"time": 475600, "text": "there was a common theme
in the message that I received,"}, {"time": 478280, "text": "and this is what it was:"}, {"time": 479520, "text": "they all said this, "I blew the whistle,
people really hate me now."}, {"time": 483920, "text": "I got fired, but guess what?"}, {"time": 486120, "text": "I would do it all over again if I could.""}, {"time": 489520, "text": "And so as I kept reading this message,
all these messages,"}, {"time": 492760, "text": "I wanted to think,
what could I share with my students?"}, {"time": 495600, "text": "And so, I pulled it all together
and this is what I learned."}, {"time": 499200, "text": "It's important for us to cultivate hope."}, {"time": 502320, "text": "Whistle-blowers are hopeful."}, {"time": 504280, "text": "Despite popular belief,"}, {"time": 505720, "text": "they're not all disgruntled employees
that have a beef with the company."}, {"time": 510040, "text": "Their hopefulness really is
what drives them to come forward."}, {"time": 514240, "text": "We also have to cultivate commitment."}, {"time": 516679, "text": "Whistle-blowers are committed."}, {"time": 518559, "text": "And it's that passion
to their organization"}, {"time": 521080, "text": "that makes them want to come forward."}, {"time": 523520, "text": "Whistle-blowers are humble."}, {"time": 525160, "text": "Again, they're not seeking fame,
but they are seeking fairness."}, {"time": 529240, "text": "And we need to continue
to cultivate bravery."}, {"time": 532120, "text": "Whistle-blowers are brave."}, {"time": 533720, "text": "Often, they underestimated"}, {"time": 537440, "text": "the impact whistle-blowing
had on their family,"}, {"time": 540080, "text": "but what they continue to comment on
is how hard it is to withhold the truth."}, {"time": 545960, "text": "With that, I want to leave you
with one additional name:"}, {"time": 548800, "text": "Peter Buxtun."}, {"time": 551160, "text": "Peter Buxtun was a 27-year-old
employee for the US Public Health Service."}, {"time": 557360, "text": "And he was hired to interview people"}, {"time": 561320, "text": "that had sexually transmitted diseases."}, {"time": 563720, "text": "And through the course of his work,"}, {"time": 565800, "text": "he noticed a clinical study
that was going on within the organization."}, {"time": 569760, "text": "And it was a study that was looking
at the progression of untreated syphilis."}, {"time": 573880, "text": "And so, there were
600 African American males"}, {"time": 576680, "text": "that were in this study."}, {"time": 577920, "text": "They were enticed into the study"}, {"time": 579520, "text": "through being given
free medical exams, burial insurance."}, {"time": 583480, "text": "And so, what happened
through the course of this study,"}, {"time": 587200, "text": "is penicillin was discovered
to help treat syphilis."}, {"time": 592120, "text": "And what Peter noticed was,"}, {"time": 594080, "text": "the participants in this study
were not given the penicillin"}, {"time": 598040, "text": "to treat their syphilis."}, {"time": 599560, "text": "And the participants didn't know."}, {"time": 601400, "text": "So similar to Mary, Peter tried to report
and talk to his internal supervisors,"}, {"time": 606600, "text": "but no one listened."}, {"time": 608360, "text": "And so Peter thought
this was completely unfair"}, {"time": 610800, "text": "and he tried to report again,"}, {"time": 612400, "text": "and finally talked to a reporter --
very similar to Mary."}, {"time": 616080, "text": "And in 1972, this was the front page
of the "New York Times":"}, {"time": 620400, "text": ""Syphilis Victims in US Study
Went Untreated for 40 Years.""}, {"time": 625640, "text": "This is known to us today
as the Tuskegee syphilis experiment."}, {"time": 630080, "text": "And Peter was the whistle-blower."}, {"time": 632320, "text": "What happened to the 600 men,
you may wonder, the 600 original men?"}, {"time": 636400, "text": "Twenty eight men died from syphilis."}, {"time": 639400, "text": "One hundred died
from syphilis complications,"}, {"time": 642560, "text": "forty wives were infected"}, {"time": 644440, "text": "and 10 children were born
with congenital syphilis."}, {"time": 647320, "text": "Who's to say what these numbers would be"}, {"time": 649680, "text": "if it wasn't for the brave,
courageous act of Peter?"}, {"time": 653800, "text": "We're all connected to Peter, actually."}, {"time": 656320, "text": "If you know anybody
that's in a clinical trial,"}, {"time": 658920, "text": "the reason why we have
informed consent today"}, {"time": 662120, "text": "is because of Peter's courageous act."}, {"time": 665400, "text": "So let me ask you a question."}, {"time": 666840, "text": "That original question,
a variation of the original question."}, {"time": 669760, "text": "How many of us have ever used the term"}, {"time": 672880, "text": "snitch, rat"}, {"time": 675880, "text": "tattletale,"}, {"time": 677480, "text": "snake,"}, {"time": 679160, "text": "weasel,"}, {"time": 680680, "text": "leak?"}, {"time": 682920, "text": "Anybody?"}, {"time": 687640, "text": "Before you get the urge to do that again,"}, {"time": 690720, "text": "I want you to think a little bit."}, {"time": 692560, "text": "It might be the Mary,
the Peter, the Kathes of the world."}, {"time": 697480, "text": "You might be the person
that could shape history,"}, {"time": 700440, "text": "or they could be the person
that shapes yours."}, {"time": 703000, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 704240, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: chip_conley_what_baby_boomers_can_learn_from_millennials_at_work_and_vice_versa
speaker: Chip Conley
title: What baby boomers can learn from millennials at work — and vice versa
transcript:
[{"time": 1037, "text": "It was my third day on the job
at a hot Silicon Valley start-up"}, {"time": 5442, "text": "in early 2013."}, {"time": 7766, "text": "I was twice the age
of the dozen engineers in the room."}, {"time": 12671, "text": "I'd been brought in to the company"}, {"time": 14395, "text": "because I was a seasoned
expert in my field,"}, {"time": 16698, "text": "but in this particular room,"}, {"time": 18356, "text": "I felt like a newbie amongst
the tech geniuses."}, {"time": 22242, "text": "I was listening to them talk"}, {"time": 25489, "text": "and thinking that the best thing
I could do was be invisible."}, {"time": 29087, "text": "And then suddenly, the 25-year-old
wizard leading the meeting stared at me"}, {"time": 33570, "text": "and asked, "If you shipped a feature
and no one used it,"}, {"time": 37736, "text": "did it really ship?""}, {"time": 39469, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 41987, "text": ""Ship a feature"?"}, {"time": 43915, "text": "In that moment, Chip knew
he was in deep ship."}, {"time": 47405, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 48436, "text": "I had no idea what he was talking about."}, {"time": 52184, "text": "I just sat there awkwardly,"}, {"time": 55634, "text": "and mercifully, he moved on
to someone else."}, {"time": 58005, "text": "I slid down in my chair,"}, {"time": 60027, "text": "and I couldn't wait
for that meeting to end."}, {"time": 63306, "text": "That was my introduction to Airbnb."}, {"time": 66907, "text": "I was asked and invited
by the three millennial cofounders"}, {"time": 70991, "text": "to join their company"}, {"time": 72173, "text": "to help them take
their fast-growing tech start-up"}, {"time": 74859, "text": "and turn it into a global
hospitality brand,"}, {"time": 77553, "text": "as well as to be the in-house
mentor for CEO Brian Chesky."}, {"time": 81858, "text": "Now, I'd spent from age 26 to 52
being a boutique hotel entrepreneur,"}, {"time": 86778, "text": "and so I guess I'd learned
a few things along the way"}, {"time": 89331, "text": "and accumulated
some hospitality knowledge."}, {"time": 91971, "text": "But after my first week,"}, {"time": 93821, "text": "I realized that the brave new
home-sharing world"}, {"time": 96776, "text": "didn't need much of my old-school
bricks-and-mortar hotel insights."}, {"time": 101926, "text": "A stark reality rocked me:"}, {"time": 104899, "text": "What do I have to offer?"}, {"time": 107929, "text": "I'd never been in a tech company before."}, {"time": 110434, "text": "Five and a half years ago, I had never
heard of the "sharing economy,""}, {"time": 115268, "text": "nor did I have an Uber
or Lyft app on my phone."}, {"time": 118534, "text": "This was not my natural habitat."}, {"time": 122179, "text": "So, I decided at that moment
that I could either run for the hills,"}, {"time": 126984, "text": "or cast judgment on these young geniuses,"}, {"time": 129455, "text": "or instead, turn the judgment
into curiosity"}, {"time": 132984, "text": "and actually see if I could match
my wise eyes with their fresh eyes."}, {"time": 137955, "text": "I fancied myself a modern Margaret Mead
amongst the millennials,"}, {"time": 143568, "text": "and I quickly learned that I had
as much to offer them"}, {"time": 147447, "text": "as they did to me."}, {"time": 149331, "text": "The more I've seen and learned
about our respective generations,"}, {"time": 154129, "text": "the more I realize that we often
don't trust each other enough"}, {"time": 158420, "text": "to actually share our respective wisdom."}, {"time": 161159, "text": "We may share a border,"}, {"time": 163434, "text": "but we don't necessarily trust
each other enough"}, {"time": 166102, "text": "to share that respective wisdom."}, {"time": 169654, "text": "I believe, looking at
the modern workplace,"}, {"time": 172958, "text": "that the trade agreement of our time"}, {"time": 176727, "text": "is opening up these intergenerational
pipelines of wisdom"}, {"time": 182122, "text": "so that we can all learn from each other."}, {"time": 185336, "text": "Almost 40 percent of us
in the United States"}, {"time": 189791, "text": "have a boss that's younger than us,"}, {"time": 192076, "text": "and that number is growing quickly."}, {"time": 195079, "text": "Power is cascading to the young
like never before"}, {"time": 198363, "text": "because of our increasing reliance on DQ:"}, {"time": 202103, "text": "digital intelligence."}, {"time": 204213, "text": "We're seeing young founders
of companies in their early 20s"}, {"time": 208048, "text": "scale them up to global giants
by the time they get to 30,"}, {"time": 212999, "text": "and yet, we expect
these young digital leaders"}, {"time": 216478, "text": "to somehow miraculously embody
the relationship wisdoms"}, {"time": 221635, "text": "we older workers
have had decades to learn."}, {"time": 225125, "text": "It's hard to microwave
your emotional intelligence."}, {"time": 229689, "text": "There's ample evidence that gender-
and ethnically diverse companies"}, {"time": 235451, "text": "are more effective."}, {"time": 237426, "text": "But what about age?"}, {"time": 239265, "text": "This is a very important question,
because for the first time ever,"}, {"time": 242909, "text": "we have five generations in the workplace
at the same time, unintentionally."}, {"time": 246759, "text": "Maybe it's time we got
a little more intentional"}, {"time": 249229, "text": "about how we work collectively."}, {"time": 251979, "text": "There have been a number
of European studies"}, {"time": 254756, "text": "that have shown that age-diverse teams
are more effective and successful."}, {"time": 260190, "text": "So why is that only eight percent
of the companies"}, {"time": 264391, "text": "that have a diversity
and inclusion program"}, {"time": 268486, "text": "have actually expanded that strategy"}, {"time": 270672, "text": "to include age as just as important
of a demographic as gender or race?"}, {"time": 276422, "text": "Maybe they didn't get the memo:"}, {"time": 278223, "text": "the world is getting older!"}, {"time": 280948, "text": "One of the paradoxes of our time"}, {"time": 282959, "text": "is that baby boomers are more vibrant
and healthy longer into life,"}, {"time": 288110, "text": "we're actually working later into life,"}, {"time": 290444, "text": "and yet we're feeling
less and less relevant."}, {"time": 293789, "text": "Some of us feel like a carton
of milk -- an old carton of milk --"}, {"time": 297628, "text": "with an expiration date stamped
on our wrinkled foreheads."}, {"time": 302092, "text": "For many of us in midlife,
this isn't just a feeling,"}, {"time": 304955, "text": "it is a harsh reality, when we suddenly
lose our job and the phone stops ringing."}, {"time": 310844, "text": "For many of us, justifiably, we worry
that people see our experience"}, {"time": 315800, "text": "as a liability, not an asset."}, {"time": 319688, "text": "You've heard of the old phrase --
or maybe the relatively new phrase --"}, {"time": 323643, "text": ""Sixty is the new forty, physically.""}, {"time": 326120, "text": "Right?"}, {"time": 327311, "text": "When it comes to power
in the workplace today,"}, {"time": 330897, "text": "30 is the new 50."}, {"time": 333797, "text": "All right, well, this is all
pretty exciting, right?"}, {"time": 336695, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 337789, "text": "Truthfully, power is moving
10 years younger."}, {"time": 341048, "text": "We're all going to live 10 years longer."}, {"time": 343307, "text": "Do the math."}, {"time": 344834, "text": "Society has created a new
20-year irrelevancy gap."}, {"time": 349325, "text": "Midlife used to be 45 to 65,"}, {"time": 351563, "text": "but I would suggest it now stretches
into a midlife marathon 40 years long,"}, {"time": 356284, "text": "from 35 to 75."}, {"time": 358607, "text": "But wait -- there is a bright spot."}, {"time": 360954, "text": "Why is it that we actually get smarter
and wiser about our humanity as we age?"}, {"time": 367560, "text": "Our physical peak may be our 20s,"}, {"time": 371640, "text": "our financial and salary peak
may be age 50,"}, {"time": 375538, "text": "but our emotional peak
is in midlife and beyond,"}, {"time": 379472, "text": "because we have developed pattern
recognition about ourselves and others."}, {"time": 384860, "text": "So how can we get companies
to tap into that wisdom"}, {"time": 388537, "text": "of the midlife folks,"}, {"time": 390881, "text": "just as they nurture their digital
young geniuses as well?"}, {"time": 395547, "text": "The most successful companies
today and in the future"}, {"time": 399105, "text": "will actually learn how to create
a powerful alchemy of the two."}, {"time": 402794, "text": "Here's how the alchemy
worked for me at Airbnb:"}, {"time": 405349, "text": "I was assigned a young, smart partner,"}, {"time": 408430, "text": "who helped me develop
a hospitality department."}, {"time": 411667, "text": "Early on, Laura Hughes could see
that I was a little lost in this habitat,"}, {"time": 416612, "text": "so she often sat
right next to me in meetings"}, {"time": 419226, "text": "so she could be my tech translator,"}, {"time": 421228, "text": "and I could write her notes and she
could tell me, "That's what that means.""}, {"time": 424890, "text": "Laura was 27 years old,"}, {"time": 426489, "text": "she'd worked for Google for four years"}, {"time": 428436, "text": "and then for a year and a half
at Airbnb when I met her."}, {"time": 432386, "text": "Like many of her millennial cohorts,"}, {"time": 435074, "text": "she had actually grown into
a managerial role"}, {"time": 439127, "text": "before she'd gotten any formal
leadership training."}, {"time": 442836, "text": "I don't care if you're
in the B-to-B world,"}, {"time": 445283, "text": "the B-to-C world, the C-to-C world
or the A-to-Z world,"}, {"time": 449248, "text": "business is fundamentally H-to-H:"}, {"time": 452740, "text": "human to human."}, {"time": 454709, "text": "And yet, Laura's approach to leadership"}, {"time": 457554, "text": "was really formed
in the technocratic world,"}, {"time": 460737, "text": "and it was purely metric driven."}, {"time": 463236, "text": "One of the things she said to me
in the first few months was,"}, {"time": 466198, "text": ""I love the fact that your
approach to leadership"}, {"time": 468548, "text": "is to create a compelling vision
that becomes a North Star for us.""}, {"time": 472782, "text": "Now, my fact knowledge,"}, {"time": 474531, "text": "as in, how many rooms a maid cleans
in an eight-hour shift,"}, {"time": 478512, "text": "might not be all that important
in a home-sharing world."}, {"time": 481912, "text": "My process knowledge
of "How do you get things done?""}, {"time": 486235, "text": "based upon understanding the underlying
motivations of everybody in the room,"}, {"time": 490961, "text": "was incredibly valuable,"}, {"time": 492739, "text": "in a company where most people didn't have
a lot of organizational experience."}, {"time": 498169, "text": "As I spent more time at Airbnb,"}, {"time": 500357, "text": "I realized it's possible
a new kind of elder was emerging"}, {"time": 504871, "text": "in the workplace."}, {"time": 506357, "text": "Not the elder of the past, who actually
was regarded with reverence."}, {"time": 511200, "text": "No, what is striking about the modern
elder is their relevance,"}, {"time": 516690, "text": "their ability to use timeless wisdom
and apply it to modern-day problems."}, {"time": 522788, "text": "Maybe it's time we actually valued wisdom
as much as we do disruption."}, {"time": 528615, "text": "And maybe it's time --
not just maybe, it is time --"}, {"time": 532275, "text": "for us to definitely reclaim
the word "elder""}, {"time": 535667, "text": "and give it a modern twist."}, {"time": 537964, "text": "The modern elder is as much an intern
as they are a mentor,"}, {"time": 541994, "text": "because they realize, in a world
that is changing so quickly,"}, {"time": 545870, "text": "their beginners' mind and their catalytic
curiosity is a life-affirming elixir,"}, {"time": 550827, "text": "not just for themselves
but for everyone around them."}, {"time": 553850, "text": "Intergenerational improv has been known
in music and the arts:"}, {"time": 558096, "text": "think Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga"}, {"time": 561710, "text": "or Wynton Marsalis
and the Young Stars of Jazz."}, {"time": 566050, "text": "This kind of riffing in the business world
is often called "mutual mentorship":"}, {"time": 573068, "text": "millennial DQ for Gen X and boomer EQ."}, {"time": 579562, "text": "I got to experience that kind of
intergenerational reciprocity with Laura"}, {"time": 585300, "text": "and our stellar data science team"}, {"time": 587190, "text": "when we were actually
remaking and evolving"}, {"time": 590018, "text": "the Airbnb peer-to-peer review system,"}, {"time": 592683, "text": "using Laura's analytical mind
and my human-centered intuition."}, {"time": 597975, "text": "With that perfect alchemy
of algorithm and people wisdom,"}, {"time": 603506, "text": "we were able to create
and instantaneous feedback loop"}, {"time": 607441, "text": "that helped our hosts better understand
the needs of our guests."}, {"time": 612758, "text": "High tech meets high touch."}, {"time": 616269, "text": "At Airbnb, I also learned
as a modern elder"}, {"time": 619710, "text": "that my role was to intern publicly
and mentor privately."}, {"time": 625312, "text": "Search engines are brilliant
at giving you an answer,"}, {"time": 629296, "text": "but a wise, sage guide can offer you
just the right question."}, {"time": 636272, "text": "Google does not understand,
at least not yet,"}, {"time": 638974, "text": "nuance like a finely attuned
