he had with employees,"}, {"time": 812587, "text": "whether in the hallway,
in the cafeteria or in meetings."}, {"time": 817064, "text": "And if he handled each touch point well,"}, {"time": 819766, "text": "he'd make employees feel valued."}, {"time": 823089, "text": "Another way that Doug
made employees feel valued"}, {"time": 826628, "text": "and showed them that
he was paying attention"}, {"time": 829048, "text": "is that he handwrote over 30,000
thank-you notes to employees."}, {"time": 834949, "text": "And this set an example for other leaders."}, {"time": 838456, "text": "Leaders have about 400
of these touch points a day."}, {"time": 842165, "text": "Most don't take long,
less than two minutes each."}, {"time": 845537, "text": "The key is to be agile and mindful
in each of these moments."}, {"time": 850933, "text": "Civility lifts people."}, {"time": 853179, "text": "We'll get people to give more
and function at their best"}, {"time": 856688, "text": "if we're civil."}, {"time": 858528, "text": "Incivility chips away at people
and their performance."}, {"time": 861699, "text": "It robs people of their potential,"}, {"time": 863984, "text": "even if they're just working around it."}, {"time": 867001, "text": "What I know from my research is that
when we have more civil environments,"}, {"time": 871313, "text": "we're more productive, creative,
helpful, happy and healthy."}, {"time": 877428, "text": "We can do better."}, {"time": 879479, "text": "Each one of us can be more mindful"}, {"time": 882511, "text": "and can take actions
to lift others up around us,"}, {"time": 886105, "text": "at work, at home, online,"}, {"time": 889417, "text": "in schools"}, {"time": 890605, "text": "and in our communities."}, {"time": 892943, "text": "In every interaction, think:"}, {"time": 895829, "text": "Who do you want to be?"}, {"time": 898419, "text": "Let's put an end to incivility bug"}, {"time": 900956, "text": "and start spreading civility."}, {"time": 903404, "text": "After all, it pays."}, {"time": 906219, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 907408, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: deandrea_salvador_how_we_can_make_energy_more_affordable_for_low_income_families
speaker: DeAndrea Salvador
title: How we can make energy more affordable for low-income families
transcript:
[{"time": 866, "text": "So, as a child,"}, {"time": 2364, "text": "I used to spend all of my time
at my great-grandmother's house."}, {"time": 5914, "text": "On hot, humid, summer days,
I would dash across the floor"}, {"time": 9141, "text": "and stick my face in front of
her only air conditioner."}, {"time": 12698, "text": "But I didn't realize
that that simple experience,"}, {"time": 15887, "text": "though brief,"}, {"time": 17435, "text": "was a privileged one in our community."}, {"time": 20533, "text": "Growing up, stories of next-door neighbors
having to set up fake energy accounts"}, {"time": 24714, "text": "or having to steal energy"}, {"time": 26376, "text": "seemed normal to me."}, {"time": 28460, "text": "During the winter, struggling to get warm,"}, {"time": 30575, "text": "my neighbors would have no choice
but to bypass the meter"}, {"time": 33455, "text": "after their heat was shut off,"}, {"time": 35373, "text": "just to keep their family
comfortable for one more day."}, {"time": 40073, "text": "These kinds of dangerous
incidents can take root"}, {"time": 42675, "text": "when people are faced
with impossible choices."}, {"time": 45772, "text": "In the US, the average American spends
three percent of their income on energy."}, {"time": 50483, "text": "In contrast, low-income
and rural populations"}, {"time": 53731, "text": "can spend 20, even 30 percent
of their income on energy."}, {"time": 58600, "text": "In 2015, this caused over
25 million people to skip meals"}, {"time": 63545, "text": "to provide power to their homes."}, {"time": 66230, "text": "This is when energy becomes a burden."}, {"time": 69173, "text": "But energy burdens are so much more
than just a number."}, {"time": 72673, "text": "They present impossible
and perilous choices:"}, {"time": 77377, "text": "Do you take your child
to get her flu medicine,"}, {"time": 79851, "text": "or do you feed her?"}, {"time": 82440, "text": "Or do you keep her warm?"}, {"time": 84503, "text": "It's an impossible choice,"}, {"time": 86293, "text": "and nearly every month,"}, {"time": 88208, "text": "seven million people choose
between medicine and energy."}, {"time": 93248, "text": "This exposes a much larger
and systemic issue."}, {"time": 96751, "text": "Families with high energy burdens
are disproportionately people of color,"}, {"time": 101026, "text": "who spend more per square foot
than their white counterparts."}, {"time": 104897, "text": "But it's also nurses, veterans
and even schoolteachers"}, {"time": 107857, "text": "who fall into the mass
of 37 million people a year"}, {"time": 111368, "text": "who are unable to afford energy
for their most basic needs."}, {"time": 115690, "text": "As a result, those with
high energy burdens"}, {"time": 117972, "text": "have a greater likelihood of conditions
like heart disease and asthma."}, {"time": 122561, "text": "Look -- given our rockets to Mars
and our pocket-sized AI,"}, {"time": 127845, "text": "we have the tools to address
these systemic inequities."}, {"time": 131411, "text": "The technology is here."}, {"time": 133621, "text": "Cost of renewables, insulation,
microgrids and smart home technology"}, {"time": 137542, "text": "are all decreasing."}, {"time": 139160, "text": "However, even as we approach cost parity,"}, {"time": 142292, "text": "the majority of those who own solar
earn much more than the average American."}, {"time": 148411, "text": "This is why, when I was 22,
I founded the nonprofit RETI."}, {"time": 152154, "text": "Our mission is to alleviate energy burdens
by working with communities,"}, {"time": 156907, "text": "utilities and government agencies alike"}, {"time": 159485, "text": "to provide equitable access
to clean energy,"}, {"time": 162385, "text": "energy efficiency and energy technology."}, {"time": 165555, "text": "But there's no one way to solve this."}, {"time": 169269, "text": "I believe in the power
of local communities,"}, {"time": 173837, "text": "in the transforming effect
of relationships."}, {"time": 177264, "text": "So we start by working directly
with the communities"}, {"time": 180504, "text": "that have the highest energy burdens."}, {"time": 182578, "text": "We host workshops
and events for communities"}, {"time": 184712, "text": "to learn about energy poverty,"}, {"time": 186183, "text": "and how making even small
updates to their homes"}, {"time": 188813, "text": "like better insulation for windows
and water heaters"}, {"time": 191423, "text": "can go a long way to maximize efficiency."}, {"time": 194232, "text": "We're connecting neighborhoods
to community solar"}, {"time": 197114, "text": "and spearheading community-led
smart home research"}, {"time": 199875, "text": "and installation programs"}, {"time": 201598, "text": "to help families bring down
their energy bills."}, {"time": 204445, "text": "We're even working directly
with elected officials,"}, {"time": 207019, "text": "advocating for more equitable pricing,"}, {"time": 209761, "text": "because to see this vision
of energy equity and resilience succeed,"}, {"time": 214923, "text": "we have to work together sustainably."}, {"time": 219054, "text": "Now, the US spends
over three billion a year"}, {"time": 221575, "text": "on energy bill payment assistance."}, {"time": 223810, "text": "And these programs do help
millions of people,"}, {"time": 226782, "text": "but they're only able to help
a fraction of those in need."}, {"time": 230052, "text": "In fact,"}, {"time": 231291, "text": "there is a 47-billion-dollar
home-energy affordability gap,"}, {"time": 237041, "text": "so assistance alone is not sustainable."}, {"time": 241194, "text": "But by building energy equity
and resilience into our communities,"}, {"time": 245487, "text": "we can assure fair and impartial access"}, {"time": 248411, "text": "to energy that is clean,
reliable and affordable."}, {"time": 251454, "text": "At scale, microgrid technology,
clean technology and energy efficiency"}, {"time": 256470, "text": "dramatically improve public health."}, {"time": 258974, "text": "And for those with high energy burdens,"}, {"time": 261406, "text": "it can help them reclaim
20 percent of their income --"}, {"time": 265049, "text": "20 percent of a person's income
who's struggling to make ends meet."}, {"time": 269001, "text": "This is life-changing."}, {"time": 271432, "text": "This is an opportunity
for families to use their energy savings"}, {"time": 276452, "text": "to sponsor their future."}, {"time": 279093, "text": "I think back to my great-grandmother
and her neighbors,"}, {"time": 283732, "text": "the impossible choices
that they had to make"}, {"time": 286988, "text": "and the effect it had
on our whole community."}, {"time": 289930, "text": "But this is not just about them."}, {"time": 292455, "text": "There are millions nationwide having
to make the same impossible choices today."}, {"time": 297889, "text": "And I know high energy burdens
are a tremendous barrier to overcome,"}, {"time": 302046, "text": "but through relationships
with communities and technology,"}, {"time": 306463, "text": "we have the paths to overcome them."}, {"time": 309164, "text": "And when we do,"}, {"time": 311183, "text": "we will all be more resilient."}, {"time": 313398, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 314573, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: liv_boeree_3_lessons_on_decision_making_from_a_poker_champion
speaker: Liv Boeree
title: 3 lessons on decision-making from a poker champion
transcript:
[{"time": 944, "text": "So I'm a professional poker player,"}, {"time": 3342, "text": "and today, I want to talk about
three things that the game has taught me"}, {"time": 8636, "text": "around decision-making
that I find apply to everyday life."}, {"time": 13061, "text": "Now the first of these things
is about luck."}, {"time": 15876, "text": "Now, like poker, life is also
a game of skill and luck,"}, {"time": 20738, "text": "and when it comes
to the biggest things we care about --"}, {"time": 23440, "text": "health, wealth and relationships --"}, {"time": 26241, "text": "these outcomes don't only depend
on the quality of our decision-making,"}, {"time": 30099, "text": "but also the roll of life's dice."}, {"time": 31868, "text": "For example, we can be
perfectly health-conscious"}, {"time": 34879, "text": "and still get unlucky
with something like cancer."}, {"time": 38273, "text": "Or we can smoke 20 a day
and live to a ripe old age,"}, {"time": 41416, "text": "and this kind of ambiguity
can make it hard for us to know"}, {"time": 44963, "text": "how good our strategies are, sometimes,"}, {"time": 47583, "text": "especially when we're
experiencing a lot of success."}, {"time": 51043, "text": "For example, back in 2010,"}, {"time": 52901, "text": "I won a really big poker tournament
known as the European Poker Tour."}, {"time": 56909, "text": "And because I'd only been playing
full-time for about a year,"}, {"time": 60275, "text": "when I won, I assumed
I must be rather brilliant."}, {"time": 64106, "text": "In fact, I thought I was so brilliant"}, {"time": 65972, "text": "that I not only got rather lazy
with studying the game,"}, {"time": 69440, "text": "but I also got more risky,"}, {"time": 71114, "text": "started playing in
the biggest tournaments I could"}, {"time": 74146, "text": "against the very best in the world."}, {"time": 76685, "text": "And then my profit graph went
from a thing of beauty"}, {"time": 80201, "text": "to something kind of sad,"}, {"time": 82637, "text": "with this worrying
downhill trend for a long time,"}, {"time": 85021, "text": "until I finally realized
that I was overestimating my skill level,"}, {"time": 88510, "text": "and got my act together."}, {"time": 90525, "text": "And this kind of reminds me
of what we've been seeing"}, {"time": 93066, "text": "in the cryptocurrency space,
at least in 2017,"}, {"time": 95836, "text": "where the only thing that's been going up
faster than the markets themselves"}, {"time": 99449, "text": "is the number of "senior
investment specialists""}, {"time": 101950, "text": "who have been appearing out of nowhere."}, {"time": 104362, "text": "Now I'm not saying it's not possible
to have a strategic edge,"}, {"time": 107352, "text": "but at the same time,
it's very easy to feel like a genius"}, {"time": 110456, "text": "when you're in a market
that's going up so fast"}, {"time": 112892, "text": "that even the worst strategies
are making a profit."}, {"time": 115322, "text": "So when we're experiencing success,"}, {"time": 117655, "text": "it's important to take a moment
to really ask ourselves"}, {"time": 120536, "text": "how much of it is truly down to us,"}, {"time": 123192, "text": "because our egos love to downplay
the luck factor when we're winning."}, {"time": 129058, "text": "Now, a second thing poker taught me"}, {"time": 131263, "text": "is the importance
of quantifying my thinking."}, {"time": 134630, "text": "When you're playing,
you can't just get away with going,"}, {"time": 137553, "text": ""Eh, they're probably bluffing.""}, {"time": 139256, "text": "That's just going to lose you
a bunch of money,"}, {"time": 141504, "text": "because poker is a game
of probabilities and precision,"}, {"time": 144727, "text": "and so you have to train yourself
to think in numbers."}, {"time": 148247, "text": "So now, whenever I catch myself"}, {"time": 150453, "text": "thinking vaguely about something
really important, like,"}, {"time": 154026, "text": ""It's unlikely I'll forget
what I want to say in my TED Talk,""}, {"time": 157275, "text": "I now try to estimate it numerically."}, {"time": 160819, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 161844, "text": "Trust me, it helps a lot
with the planning process."}, {"time": 164342, "text": "And the thing is, almost anything
that could possibly happen here today,"}, {"time": 167786, "text": "or at any point in the future,"}, {"time": 169365, "text": "can also be expressed
as a probability, too."}, {"time": 172333, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 175072, "text": "So now I also try to speak
in numbers as well."}, {"time": 178501, "text": "So if someone asks me,"}, {"time": 179676, "text": ""Hey, Liv, do you think you're going
to come along to that thing tonight?""}, {"time": 183215, "text": "instead of just saying to them,
"Yeah, probably,""}, {"time": 185556, "text": "I actually give them my best estimate --"}, {"time": 187408, "text": "say, 60 percent."}, {"time": 189274, "text": "Because -- I know that sounds
a little odd --"}, {"time": 191401, "text": "but the thing is, I ran a poll on Twitter"}, {"time": 194497, "text": "of what people understand
the word "probably" to mean,"}, {"time": 197085, "text": "and this was the spread of answers."}, {"time": 198857, "text": "Enormous!"}, {"time": 200032, "text": "So apparently, it's absolutely useless"}, {"time": 201889, "text": "at actually conveying
any real information."}, {"time": 204608, "text": "So if you guys catch yourselves
using these vague words,"}, {"time": 208273, "text": "like "probably" or "sometimes,""}, {"time": 211193, "text": "try, instead, using numbers,
because when we speak in numbers,"}, {"time": 214416, "text": "we know what lands
in the other person's brain."}, {"time": 218092, "text": "Now, the third thing I want
to touch on today is intuition."}, {"time": 223410, "text": "How often have you seen
these kinds of inspirational memes"}, {"time": 226950, "text": "in your Facebook feed?"}, {"time": 229018, "text": "[Always trust your gut feeling
and never second-guess.]"}, {"time": 231765, "text": "They're nice, right?"}, {"time": 233726, "text": "It's lovely. Yes. "Trust your soul.""}, {"time": 237030, "text": "Well, they're terrible advice."}, {"time": 239292, "text": "These are some of the best
poker players in the world right now."}, {"time": 242786, "text": "Do they look like people who live
purely off feelings and intuitions?"}, {"time": 247271, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 248296, "text": "Look at them!"}, {"time": 249969, "text": "Obviously, these guys
are about slow, careful analysis,"}, {"time": 254573, "text": "and that's because the game
has outgrown the days"}, {"time": 257104, "text": "where pure street smarts
and people-reading"}, {"time": 260136, "text": "can get you to the top."}, {"time": 261981, "text": "And that's because our intuitions
aren't nearly as perfect"}, {"time": 265307, "text": "as we'd like to believe."}, {"time": 266601, "text": "I mean, it'd be great,
whenever we're in a tough spot,"}, {"time": 269167, "text": "to just have an answer appear to us
from some magical source of inspiration."}, {"time": 273197, "text": "But in reality, our gut
is extremely vulnerable"}, {"time": 276619, "text": "to all kinds of wishful
thinking and biases."}, {"time": 280905, "text": "So then, what is our gut good for?"}, {"time": 283128, "text": "Well, all the studies I've read"}, {"time": 285224, "text": "conclude that it's best-suited
for everyday things"}, {"time": 289195, "text": "that we have lots
and lots of experience in,"}, {"time": 291608, "text": "like how we just know
that our friend is mad at us"}, {"time": 294362, "text": "before we've even said anything to them,"}, {"time": 296433, "text": "or whether we can fit our car
into a tight parking spot."}, {"time": 299609, "text": "But when it comes to the really big stuff,"}, {"time": 301721, "text": "like what's our career path going to be"}, {"time": 304269, "text": "or who should we marry,"}, {"time": 305975, "text": "why should we assume that our intuitions"}, {"time": 309524, "text": "are better calibrated for these
than slow, proper analysis?"}, {"time": 313250, "text": "I mean, they don't have
any data to be based off."}, {"time": 316528, "text": "So my third lesson is,
while we shouldn't ignore our intuitions,"}, {"time": 320330, "text": "we shouldn't overprivilege them either."}, {"time": 322727, "text": "And I'd like to summarize
these three lessons today"}, {"time": 325179, "text": "with my own set of memes,"}, {"time": 326831, "text": "with more of a poker-player twist."}, {"time": 329957, "text": ""Success is sweetest when you achieve it
across a large sample size.""}, {"time": 334116, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 335878, "text": ""Your gut is your friend
and so is a cost-benefit analysis."}, {"time": 340322, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 341579, "text": ""The future is unknown, but you can
damn well try and estimate it.""}, {"time": 346246, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 347421, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: isadora_kosofsky_intimate_photos_of_a_senior_love_triangle
speaker: Isadora Kosofsky
title: Intimate photos of a senior love triangle
transcript:
[{"time": 881, "text": "Jeanie, Will and Adina
are three senior citizens"}, {"time": 4556, "text": "connected by a special relationship."}, {"time": 7873, "text": "They view their bond as a shield
from the loneliness of aging."}, {"time": 12418, "text": "I first met them at a retirement
home in Los Angeles,"}, {"time": 15499, "text": "where I had been photographing
for three years."}, {"time": 18569, "text": "I saw as they approached
the gate one night,"}, {"time": 21268, "text": "and felt an immediate connection to them."}, {"time": 24522, "text": "Although I didn't know the details
of their love triangle,"}, {"time": 28458, "text": "I intuitively felt
that I had to find out who they were."}, {"time": 33379, "text": "Questioning a nurse
a day later, she said to me,"}, {"time": 37220, "text": ""Oh, you're talking about the threesome.""}, {"time": 40197, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 41402, "text": "I was intrigued."}, {"time": 42958, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 45727, "text": "The trio set out on a daily adventure
to coffee and doughnut shops,"}, {"time": 49847, "text": "bus stops and street corners."}, {"time": 52188, "text": "I soon learned that the purpose
of these outings was solace"}, {"time": 56157, "text": "and a search for meaning."}, {"time": 58038, "text": "The trio sought to combat their alienation"}, {"time": 61292, "text": "by literally integrating themselves
in public streets."}, {"time": 65480, "text": "Yet, even when arm in arm,
no one saw them."}, {"time": 70893, "text": "We often think that as we age,
we lose the desires held in our youth."}, {"time": 76085, "text": "Actually, as a teenage photojournalist
when I met the trio,"}, {"time": 80268, "text": "I saw their behavior as a mirror"}, {"time": 82698, "text": "to the fears of exclusion
and desires for intimacy"}, {"time": 86904, "text": "that I also carried."}, {"time": 89196, "text": "I related to their invisibility,"}, {"time": 91927, "text": "which pained me during my childhood"}, {"time": 94434, "text": "but has become my greatest asset
as an immersive documentarian,"}, {"time": 99530, "text": "because I can just fade into my empathy."}, {"time": 103498, "text": "As we walked down
the streets of Hollywood,"}, {"time": 105593, "text": "in a neighborhood of screenwriters,
actors and filmmakers,"}, {"time": 109085, "text": "the trio assumed the invisibility
that each senior does."}, {"time": 113800, "text": "I would ask myself,"}, {"time": 115704, "text": ""How is it that no one else
sees these three human beings?"}, {"time": 120300, "text": "Why is it that I am
the only one who sees them?""}, {"time": 124871, "text": "Years later, as I began to share
this work with the public,"}, {"time": 128514, "text": "I noticed that people are largely
uncomfortable with this story."}, {"time": 132736, "text": "Perhaps it is because the trio
doesn't assume conventional notions"}, {"time": 137339, "text": "associated with love,
romance or partnership."}, {"time": 141617, "text": "They were unseen in public
and shunned by their peers."}, {"time": 145898, "text": "They wanted to belong somewhere"}, {"time": 148342, "text": "but only seemed to belong with each other."}, {"time": 151445, "text": "I wanted to belong somewhere, too."}, {"time": 153919, "text": "And my camera has been a catalyst
for me to belong everywhere."}, {"time": 158744, "text": "But beyond challenging sociocultural
norms about the elderly,"}, {"time": 162641, "text": "the trio sheds light
on fear of remoteness."}, {"time": 166411, "text": "At the end of each day, they return
to their respective retirement homes."}, {"time": 171580, "text": "Under the surface of their aloneness,"}, {"time": 174438, "text": "there is a desire for community,
for their people."}, {"time": 179315, "text": "There was a sense that they were each
yearning for their tribe,"}, {"time": 183633, "text": "but that comfort comes with compromise,"}, {"time": 186569, "text": "because Will cannot commit to one woman."}, {"time": 190051, "text": "Sitting with Jeanie one day
in her apartment, she said to me,"}, {"time": 194043, "text": ""Sharing Will is a thorn in your side."}, {"time": 197432, "text": "A relationship between a man
and a woman is private."}, {"time": 201926, "text": "It is a couple, not a trio.""}, {"time": 205926, "text": "My process is to essentially
become the people I document"}, {"time": 209323, "text": "by spending years with them
as an observer-occupant,"}, {"time": 213196, "text": "to create a safe space,
to then become hidden in plain sight."}, {"time": 218315, "text": "I was about 17 when I met the trio,"}, {"time": 220879, "text": "and I shadowed them for four years."}, {"time": 223784, "text": "We actually see, in the breakdown
of social development,"}, {"time": 226998, "text": "that adolescence and old age
look strikingly alike,"}, {"time": 231402, "text": "because both are periods
of identity confusion."}, {"time": 235680, "text": "I identified with the women."}, {"time": 238220, "text": "But also with Will, who made me
aware of the divide in me."}, {"time": 243505, "text": "The schism that we each often have"}, {"time": 246737, "text": "about what we crave
and the actuality of our situation."}, {"time": 251847, "text": "Before shooting this series,"}, {"time": 253721, "text": "I was also in love with two different
people who knew about each other,"}, {"time": 257410, "text": "being the object over which they fought."}, {"time": 260411, "text": "But I also knew what it was like
to be at the base of the triangle,"}, {"time": 264427, "text": "like Jeanie or Adina,"}, {"time": 266173, "text": "asking myself,"}, {"time": 267855, "text": ""Why aren't I enough?""}, {"time": 271442, "text": "I would look through my viewfinder
and see three elderly figures,"}, {"time": 275411, "text": "and it became impossible to deny
that regardless of age,"}, {"time": 279816, "text": "we were each in pursuit of filling
the proverbial hole through other people."}, {"time": 286305, "text": "Perhaps the discomfort of looking
at Jeanie, Will and Adina's story"}, {"time": 290742, "text": "is truly a reminder
that even at the end of life,"}, {"time": 295831, "text": "we may never reach the fantasy
we have envisioned for ourselves."}, {"time": 301548, "text": "Thank you for listening."}, {"time": 302768, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: kym_worthy_what_happened_when_we_tested_thousands_of_abandoned_rape_kits_in_detroit
speaker: Kym Worthy
title: What happened when we tested thousands of abandoned rape kits in Detroit
transcript:
[{"time": 1000, "text": "In 2009, in August, my office
weathered two major scandals."}, {"time": 7800, "text": "The first was the arrest,
trying and conviction"}, {"time": 12880, "text": "and subsequent incarceration
of Detroit's very popular mayor."}, {"time": 17880, "text": "The second caused the Detroit
police department crime lab to be closed."}, {"time": 24800, "text": "I thought nothing else could go wrong."}, {"time": 29000, "text": "And then the phone rang."}, {"time": 30280, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 31680, "text": "It was the deputy chief
of my special victim's unit,"}, {"time": 35400, "text": "who was breathless
on the other end of the line."}, {"time": 38440, "text": "He said, "Boss, you are never
going to believe what I just saw.""}, {"time": 45000, "text": "I had a sinking feeling
in the pit of my stomach,"}, {"time": 47760, "text": "because I knew instinctively"}, {"time": 50560, "text": "that Detroit was getting ready
to suffer its third major scandal,"}, {"time": 55400, "text": "in just over one year."}, {"time": 59280, "text": "He told me that he had just visited what
he thought was an abandoned warehouse"}, {"time": 64319, "text": "where the Detroit police department
was storing evidence."}, {"time": 68000, "text": "Inside were 11,341 abandoned,"}, {"time": 74840, "text": "untested rape kits."}, {"time": 77440, "text": "Some of them went back to the 1980s."}, {"time": 81280, "text": "And some of them now
are over 40 years old."}, {"time": 85960, "text": "These kits were spilling out
of large, black garbage bags"}, {"time": 90480, "text": "and empty oil drums."}, {"time": 93440, "text": "Each kit represented a victim,"}, {"time": 96200, "text": "mostly a female,"}, {"time": 97680, "text": "that had suffered
a violent sexual assault."}, {"time": 101880, "text": "Each of them voluntarily endured
an hours-long rape kit process,"}, {"time": 108440, "text": "with the hopes that as a result of that
they would find their perpetrator."}, {"time": 113960, "text": "And unbeknownst
to all of them, all 11,341,"}, {"time": 119680, "text": "those kits were never tested."}, {"time": 123480, "text": "I cannot even begin to describe -- oh!"}, {"time": 126240, "text": "And by the way, before I move on,"}, {"time": 128120, "text": "in the interim of those 40 years,"}, {"time": 130440, "text": "those perpetrators were allowed
to continue to offend with impunity."}, {"time": 136640, "text": "I cannot tell you or describe to you
how outraged, mad and angry I was."}, {"time": 144520, "text": "I myself was a victim of sexual assault,"}, {"time": 147320, "text": "back many decades ago,
when I was in law school."}, {"time": 150720, "text": "I also am the mother of three girls,
a 21-year-old and nine-year-old twins."}, {"time": 157400, "text": "I was even more horrified to learn --
if I could be more horrified --"}, {"time": 162200, "text": "that the oldest of those kits --"}, {"time": 165240, "text": "one of the oldest of those kits --
belonged to an eight-year-old girl."}, {"time": 169400, "text": "I'm going to tell you her story,
but I'm going to call her Natasha."}, {"time": 173840, "text": "On January 2, 1990, Natasha was at home
and a man knocked on her door."}, {"time": 180200, "text": "This man was familiar
with her neighborhood"}, {"time": 182440, "text": "and was familiar with the comings
and goings of her family,"}, {"time": 185520, "text": "but Natasha did not know him."}, {"time": 188720, "text": "He told her that her grandmother,
the only mother that she had ever known,"}, {"time": 193640, "text": "had been in a terrible accident"}, {"time": 195560, "text": "and was laying on a couch
in his house, calling for her."}, {"time": 199720, "text": "Terrified that Natasha was going to lose
her grandmother, she went with him."}, {"time": 204720, "text": "But of course, we all know
her grandmother was not there."}, {"time": 207800, "text": "Once he had isolated Natasha,
who was eight years old,"}, {"time": 211760, "text": "he began to rape her violently."}, {"time": 214320, "text": "He raped her with his mouth,
his fingers and his penis."}, {"time": 218720, "text": "And he even forced his penis
into her mouth."}, {"time": 222880, "text": "When he was done,
he ordered Natasha to get dressed,"}, {"time": 226040, "text": "he got dressed himself,"}, {"time": 227720, "text": "and he put a blindfold across her head."}, {"time": 230400, "text": "And walked her to a factory area
on the edge of the neighborhood."}, {"time": 235120, "text": "He asked her if she knew --
he removed the blindfold,"}, {"time": 237680, "text": "and asked her if she knew
how to get home from there."}, {"time": 240200, "text": "And when she indicated that she did,
he let her go and he walked off."}, {"time": 244920, "text": "Natasha's rape was reported immediately,"}, {"time": 248400, "text": "and a rape kit was done."}, {"time": 250960, "text": "Now, the rape kit process
terrifies and traumatizes adult women."}, {"time": 257720, "text": "Can you imagine what it was like
for a little second-grader,"}, {"time": 261240, "text": "who still wore pigtails
and still believed in Santa Claus,"}, {"time": 264840, "text": "going through this exam?"}, {"time": 268200, "text": "Natasha's kit sat on the shelf
in that abandoned warehouse"}, {"time": 272160, "text": "for 26 years."}, {"time": 277520, "text": "Pamela, 19 years old --"}, {"time": 279880, "text": "I'll call her Pamela,
that's not her real name --"}, {"time": 282240, "text": "nineteen years old,
was walking down the street"}, {"time": 285000, "text": "after she had come
from visiting her boyfriend."}, {"time": 287760, "text": "She was grabbed from behind,"}, {"time": 290160, "text": "and she felt what she thought
was a gun, in her side."}, {"time": 294320, "text": "She was taken to an abandoned house,"}, {"time": 296760, "text": "to a bedroom in that house,
that was filled with trash."}, {"time": 301960, "text": "Every time she tried to resist,"}, {"time": 304960, "text": "he would hit her
about the face and the head."}, {"time": 309120, "text": "He violently raped her
on the floor of that bedroom"}, {"time": 313000, "text": "that was filled with garbage."}, {"time": 317640, "text": "When he was done,"}, {"time": 319440, "text": "he put on his clothes,"}, {"time": 321320, "text": "he stole her money,
and he just walked away."}, {"time": 327600, "text": "Pamela also reported her rape right away."}, {"time": 332280, "text": "She also had a rape kit done."}, {"time": 334200, "text": "And like Natasha's,
her kit sat on the shelf for 15 years."}, {"time": 340520, "text": "Now, criminals, like people
who raped Natasha and Pamela,"}, {"time": 345880, "text": "often leave their DNA at a crime scene."}, {"time": 348880, "text": "But for a rape victim,
their body is the crime scene."}, {"time": 354760, "text": "So many elect to go through this
hours-long rape kit process"}, {"time": 359000, "text": "that requires every inch and orifice
of a victim's body"}, {"time": 364880, "text": "to be combed, swabbed and photographed."}, {"time": 370360, "text": "All right after a violent sexual assault."}, {"time": 374800, "text": "The reason that most people do this,
who have a rape kit,"}, {"time": 377880, "text": "is because they want the forensic
scientists to study that rape kit."}, {"time": 381520, "text": "And hopefully come up
with a genetic profile"}, {"time": 384360, "text": "that will help identify their perpetrator."}, {"time": 387680, "text": "Once forensic scientists
come up with this genetic profile,"}, {"time": 390800, "text": "they enter it into CODIS,
hopefully have a match."}, {"time": 394600, "text": "CODIS is filled with DNA profiles
of people who are arrested"}, {"time": 399920, "text": "and/or convicted
of certain prescribed offenses."}, {"time": 404840, "text": "If in fact a profile is made
and entered into CODIS,"}, {"time": 407880, "text": "it can help identify a perpetrator
in the matter of minutes."}, {"time": 411760, "text": "CODIS stands for
Combined DNA Index System."}, {"time": 419160, "text": "Now, how did we get here?"}, {"time": 422560, "text": "Detroit had no money."}, {"time": 426240, "text": "It cost, at that time
that these kits were found,"}, {"time": 428600, "text": "up to 1,500 dollars per kit
to have it tested."}, {"time": 433600, "text": "So, you do the math
about how much that was going to cost."}, {"time": 436360, "text": "In addition to that,"}, {"time": 438640, "text": "within four years of these kits
being found in 2009,"}, {"time": 442440, "text": "Detroit would be the largest municipality
in the history of the United States"}, {"time": 447080, "text": "to declare bankruptcy."}, {"time": 449800, "text": "We didn't know what we were going to do."}, {"time": 451960, "text": "But not only that."}, {"time": 453200, "text": "As we began to study and investigate
how this possibly could have happened,"}, {"time": 457760, "text": "we discovered there were other issues
besides just financial ones."}, {"time": 462880, "text": "During the course of these decades
where these kits sat in that warehouse,"}, {"time": 468160, "text": "we discovered there had been
multiple changes of police leadership,"}, {"time": 472520, "text": "with different priorities
and different agendas."}, {"time": 475800, "text": "There was woefully inadequate training
for sex crimes officers"}, {"time": 480040, "text": "in the police department in general."}, {"time": 482640, "text": "They were chronically understaffed,"}, {"time": 485920, "text": "and they had other resource issues."}, {"time": 488120, "text": "And there was perpetual victim blaming"}, {"time": 493400, "text": "when these victims came
to report their crimes."}, {"time": 496960, "text": "That's the rape culture."}, {"time": 499360, "text": "And because of this victim blaming"}, {"time": 501840, "text": "of someone that had been
violently assaulted,"}, {"time": 504320, "text": "some of these victim were even ridiculed"}, {"time": 506680, "text": "into not continuing
to proceed with their case."}, {"time": 510600, "text": "The bottom line is,
that 11,341 rape kits sat on that shelf."}, {"time": 518440, "text": "I wanted transparency."}, {"time": 520320, "text": "I asked myself: How in the world
can we stop this from spreading?"}, {"time": 525600, "text": "I don't want to go through all this work
and five, 10 years down the line,"}, {"time": 529200, "text": "figure we have the same issue."}, {"time": 531440, "text": "At that time, police officers
had the sole discretion"}, {"time": 535120, "text": "about whether and when and if"}, {"time": 537760, "text": "they were going to submit
the rape kits for testing --"}, {"time": 540360, "text": "any rape kit in their
jurisdiction -- for testing."}, {"time": 542760, "text": "That had to change."}, {"time": 544000, "text": "We had to take that discretion
away from police officers,"}, {"time": 546720, "text": "and pass state laws"}, {"time": 548360, "text": "to ensure that every rape kit
released by the victim to law enforcement"}, {"time": 553080, "text": "is tested immediately."}, {"time": 556720, "text": "I also knew that there had to be
some kind of system"}, {"time": 559200, "text": "to keep everybody honest and to keep
everybody accountable, put in place,"}, {"time": 563240, "text": "where we knew where these
rape kits were, at any given time."}, {"time": 568280, "text": "The answer was simple."}, {"time": 570440, "text": "Think about all
of the hundreds of thousands"}, {"time": 574240, "text": "and perhaps millions of packages,"}, {"time": 576600, "text": "that are moved by
a logistics company every day."}, {"time": 581320, "text": "They are scanned and tracked,"}, {"time": 583680, "text": "and they know where they are,
at every bend and turn,"}, {"time": 586200, "text": "from the time that they're stored
in the warehouse,"}, {"time": 588640, "text": "until the time that that package arrives
on the purchaser's front steps."}, {"time": 594840, "text": "Why couldn't we do that for rape kits?"}, {"time": 597600, "text": "I had no desire to reinvent the wheel."}, {"time": 601040, "text": "So I contacted UPS."}, {"time": 604400, "text": "UPS, within two weeks -- two weeks --"}, {"time": 609040, "text": "of our first meeting with UPS,"}, {"time": 611440, "text": "they had come up with a major plan"}, {"time": 614560, "text": "where they involved
all the stakeholders --"}, {"time": 616640, "text": "the police officers, the prosecutors,
the medical facilities,"}, {"time": 619560, "text": "the forensic nurses, the hospitals,"}, {"time": 621880, "text": "the lab personnel
and the victim advocates,"}, {"time": 624600, "text": "could know where the rape kits were
at any given time."}, {"time": 628600, "text": "They sent a team of experts out"}, {"time": 631040, "text": "and fanned the Detroit area,
talked to all the stakeholders"}, {"time": 634080, "text": "and developed a plan,"}, {"time": 635720, "text": "and studied the life of a rape kit,"}, {"time": 637440, "text": "from the time the rape kit was collected,"}, {"time": 639960, "text": "through to the time
that it was tested in the lab"}, {"time": 642320, "text": "and returned to the police personnel."}, {"time": 644600, "text": "They also developed a web-based portal"}, {"time": 647800, "text": "that all the stakeholders could look into
and see where any given rape kit was"}, {"time": 651520, "text": "at any given time."}, {"time": 653320, "text": "UPS had the technology,"}, {"time": 655280, "text": "UPS knew how to use that technology
to solve our problem,"}, {"time": 658360, "text": "and we didn't."}, {"time": 661040, "text": "We launched -- we, we --"}, {"time": 663520, "text": "UPS and the prosecutor's office --"}, {"time": 665560, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 666800, "text": "launched this pilot program in Detroit."}, {"time": 670800, "text": "And we started this process
on January 28, 2015,"}, {"time": 676600, "text": "through to May 25 of 2016."}, {"time": 681080, "text": "And during that period of time --"}, {"time": 682720, "text": "remember, we're not dealing
with the ones we found,"}, {"time": 685160, "text": "because they'd already been stored --"}, {"time": 687000, "text": "we're dealing with any new kit
that came in as of January 28, 2015."}, {"time": 690720, "text": "And we knew where that rape kit was."}, {"time": 693640, "text": "For the 16 months of this project,
we didn't lose a single rape kit."}, {"time": 699360, "text": "Not a single one."}, {"time": 700600, "text": "We knew where they all were."}, {"time": 702080, "text": "(Applause)"}, {"time": 708520, "text": "This project went on
until the state of Michigan,"}, {"time": 711440, "text": "the elected officials in state government,"}, {"time": 713920, "text": "took notice of everything
that UPS was doing."}, {"time": 717040, "text": "And everything that my office was doing."}, {"time": 719000, "text": "And they decided that they
were going to use state funds"}, {"time": 722960, "text": "to develop a state-wide tracking system."}, {"time": 725600, "text": "Not in just Detroit,
but state-wide tracking system."}, {"time": 729520, "text": "Hopefully, that system
will be up and running soon."}, {"time": 732080, "text": "But I loved working with UPS."}, {"time": 734120, "text": "I loved their innovation,
I loved how fast they worked,"}, {"time": 737480, "text": "I loved their unorthodox approach to ideas
to solve an everyday, common problem,"}, {"time": 742040, "text": "whose solution should be simple."}, {"time": 746760, "text": "So, after working with them"}, {"time": 749680, "text": "I knew that even with one company,"}, {"time": 752200, "text": "working on one issue,"}, {"time": 754080, "text": "the progress that could be made."}, {"time": 757480, "text": "We've been at this now for nine years."}, {"time": 763360, "text": "And it was nine years ago"}, {"time": 766160, "text": "that we rescued those rape kits
from the warehouse."}, {"time": 770880, "text": "That warehouse has since been torn down."}, {"time": 774320, "text": "But all of the kits
have either been tested,"}, {"time": 777560, "text": "or are in the final stages
of being tested."}, {"time": 780680, "text": "We still have a lot of work to do"}, {"time": 782400, "text": "in terms of investigation
and prosecution of those cases,"}, {"time": 786640, "text": "but our rape kit issue,
in terms of testing, is done."}, {"time": 790680, "text": "As of June 28, 2018,"}, {"time": 794880, "text": "our CODIS hits have showed us
and identified 2,600 suspects."}, {"time": 801360, "text": "We have identified 861 serial rapists."}, {"time": 808800, "text": "Just within this project."}, {"time": 810080, "text": "That means 861 potential defendants"}, {"time": 814560, "text": "that have raped within the project
two or more times."}, {"time": 818160, "text": "And 50 to 75 of them
have raped 10 to 15 times a piece."}, {"time": 824840, "text": "In one city, in one state."}, {"time": 829160, "text": "Also, the CODIS results that we have"}, {"time": 832400, "text": "have tentacles to crime scenes,"}, {"time": 834280, "text": "have linkages in 40 states
in the United States."}, {"time": 838720, "text": "Forty of the 50 states have tentacles
to our crime testing of these rape kits."}, {"time": 844000, "text": "From Alaska to Florida"}, {"time": 846600, "text": "and from Maine to the most
southern parts of California."}, {"time": 850360, "text": "A sea to shining sea,
string of CODIS hits."}, {"time": 856840, "text": "Natasha is now 36 years old."}, {"time": 860720, "text": "When she heard about the work
that we were doing with the rape kits,"}, {"time": 865000, "text": "she contacted my office,
the Wayne County prosecutor's office."}, {"time": 868880, "text": "Her kit was eventually tested."}, {"time": 871080, "text": "And it had identified Paul Warwick."}, {"time": 874160, "text": "In the interim, Paul Warwick
had raped two more women."}, {"time": 878440, "text": "One in the state of Colorado."}, {"time": 881920, "text": "Paul Warwick is now serving a sentence
in the Michigan Department of Corrections,"}, {"time": 886920, "text": "in prison, of 15 to 40 years."}, {"time": 889600, "text": "(Applause)"}, {"time": 896480, "text": "Pamela's kit was also tested."}, {"time": 899280, "text": "And her kit led to the identification --
her CODIS hit on her kit --"}, {"time": 902720, "text": "led to the identification
of Bernard Peterson."}, {"time": 906400, "text": "In the interim, Bernard Peterson
raped 10 more women."}, {"time": 913920, "text": "Each of those women had a rape kit done."}, {"time": 917000, "text": "And each of those women's rape kits
sat on that shelf next to Pamela's."}, {"time": 922600, "text": "For a varying number of years."}, {"time": 926000, "text": "Bernard Peterson is now serving a sentence"}, {"time": 928600, "text": "in the Michigan Department of Corrections,"}, {"time": 930680, "text": "concurrently -- that means
at the same time --"}, {"time": 932880, "text": "of 60 to 90 years,
and 90 years to 125 years,"}, {"time": 937040, "text": "for the rapes that he committed."}, {"time": 938640, "text": "(Applause)"}, {"time": 944880, "text": "We still have a lot of work to be done."}, {"time": 948080, "text": "And we desperately need
the help of the private sector."}, {"time": 951480, "text": "We need the help of the tech industry."}, {"time": 953880, "text": "To help us develop -- not help us,
we want them to develop --"}, {"time": 957240, "text": "information management systems,"}, {"time": 959520, "text": "so we can all talk to each other"}, {"time": 961800, "text": "and stop these perpetrators"}, {"time": 963720, "text": "from raping and maiming
and killing with impunity."}, {"time": 967600, "text": "We also need help from those of you"}, {"time": 969560, "text": "with marketing
and advertisement backgrounds."}, {"time": 973320, "text": "We need you, desperately we need you,"}, {"time": 975800, "text": "to develop campaigns for our children
and other people to listen to,"}, {"time": 981080, "text": "so we can stop the culture,
change the culture of rape victims"}, {"time": 985400, "text": "being too afraid to come forward
because of what may happen to them."}, {"time": 992360, "text": "UPS was one company, as I said."}, {"time": 995640, "text": "They helped us with their innovation,"}, {"time": 997840, "text": "and they revolutionized the way
that we can track rape kits."}, {"time": 1002120, "text": "Every single aspect
of our lives is tracked."}, {"time": 1006320, "text": "Every like, every mood,"}, {"time": 1009240, "text": "shopping history,
browsing history, reading history,"}, {"time": 1013000, "text": "our entire web history
is tracked these days."}, {"time": 1018240, "text": "What if we could track the activities
and the comings and goings"}, {"time": 1023520, "text": "of criminals who commit crimes?"}, {"time": 1025359, "text": "Just like people track
every aspect of our lives."}, {"time": 1029040, "text": "In 2015, the Obama White House"}, {"time": 1033480, "text": "and the US Department of Justice"}, {"time": 1036119, "text": "put the number of untested,
abandoned rape kits at 400,000,"}, {"time": 1041160, "text": "across this country."}, {"time": 1042640, "text": "Four hundred thousand."}, {"time": 1044319, "text": "That's a national pandemic."}, {"time": 1047280, "text": "We know where a lot of those kits are."}, {"time": 1049520, "text": "Our testing showed"}, {"time": 1051240, "text": "that women were raped waiting
in their cars, waiting for friends,"}, {"time": 1056600, "text": "on their way to work,
on their way from work,"}, {"time": 1060160, "text": "at gas stations, at shopping malls."}, {"time": 1063680, "text": "And even one of the first
cases that we did"}, {"time": 1065920, "text": "when these rape kits
were starting to be tested,"}, {"time": 1068400, "text": "was a man who came into the window"}, {"time": 1070640, "text": "and got into the bed and raped a woman
who was in bed with her two children."}, {"time": 1075680, "text": "He raped her while he was
in bed with her two children."}, {"time": 1079280, "text": "Every time I look at a rape victim
that comes into my office,"}, {"time": 1083160, "text": "because their case is being called"}, {"time": 1084840, "text": "or they're being interviewed
by the prosecutor,"}, {"time": 1087055, "text": "they are being prepped for case,"}, {"time": 1088640, "text": "I look into their eyes
and I think to myself,"}, {"time": 1091760, "text": "they didn't have to be
one of the ones that was raped."}, {"time": 1094360, "text": "They didn't have to be
one of those victims."}, {"time": 1096480, "text": "And maybe they would not have been,
if these rape kits had been tested timely."}, {"time": 1103120, "text": "How many more Pamelas are in this world?"}, {"time": 1107360, "text": "How many more Natashas are in this world?"}, {"time": 1110680, "text": "We may never know."}, {"time": 1112160, "text": "But what I do know
is that you have the technology,"}, {"time": 1115440, "text": "you know how to use it"}, {"time": 1116680, "text": "and you can help us solve the problem
of rape kits being stockpiled."}, {"time": 1121560, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 1122880, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: tracie_keesee_how_police_and_the_public_can_create_safer_neighborhoods_together
speaker: Tracie Keesee
title: How police and the public can create safer neighborhoods together
transcript:
[{"time": 921, "text": "You know, my friends,
I look at this photograph"}, {"time": 4198, "text": "and I have to ask myself,"}, {"time": 6667, "text": "you know, I think I've seen this
somewhere before."}, {"time": 9657, "text": "People marching in the street for justice."}, {"time": 12903, "text": "But I know it's not the same photograph
that I would have seen,"}, {"time": 16378, "text": "because I wouldn't take my oath
to be a police officer until 1989."}, {"time": 21315, "text": "And I've been in the business
for over 25 years."}, {"time": 24673, "text": "And identifying
as an African-American woman,"}, {"time": 27069, "text": "I know things have gotten better."}, {"time": 29268, "text": "But even as I learned about public safety,"}, {"time": 31715, "text": "I wondered if what
I was doing on the street"}, {"time": 34684, "text": "was hurting or harming the community."}, {"time": 37323, "text": "And I often wondered if, you know,
how did they perceive me,"}, {"time": 41704, "text": "this woman in uniform?"}, {"time": 44204, "text": "But there is one thing that I knew."}, {"time": 45912, "text": "I knew there was a way that we could
do this, probably, different or better."}, {"time": 49939, "text": "A way that preserved dignity
and guaranteed justice."}, {"time": 54883, "text": "But I also knew that police
could not do it alone."}, {"time": 59267, "text": "It's the coproduction of public safety."}, {"time": 63251, "text": "There is a lot of history with us."}, {"time": 66830, "text": "You know, we know loss."}, {"time": 74049, "text": "The relationship between"}, {"time": 75320, "text": "the African American community
and the police is a painful one."}, {"time": 80005, "text": "Often filled with mistrust."}, {"time": 82847, "text": "It has been studied by social scientists,"}, {"time": 85927, "text": "it has been studied by government,"}, {"time": 89006, "text": "all both promising, you know,
hopeful new ways and long-term fixes."}, {"time": 94593, "text": "But all we want is to be safe."}, {"time": 96899, "text": "And our safety is intertwined."}, {"time": 99590, "text": "And that we know,
in order to have great relationships"}, {"time": 102162, "text": "and relationships built on trust,"}, {"time": 104772, "text": "that we're going to have
to have communication."}, {"time": 107657, "text": "And in this advent and this text
of the world that we've got going on,"}, {"time": 113014, "text": "trying to do this with social media,"}, {"time": 115307, "text": "it's a very difficult thing to do."}, {"time": 118464, "text": "We also have to examine
our current policing practices,"}, {"time": 121761, "text": "and we have to set those things aside
that no longer serve us."}, {"time": 124893, "text": "So, in New York, that meant
"stop, question and frisk.""}, {"time": 127934, "text": "That meant really holding up
the numbers as opposed to relationships."}, {"time": 133673, "text": "And it really didn't allow
the officers the opportunity"}, {"time": 136508, "text": "to get to know the community
in which they serve."}, {"time": 140704, "text": "But you see, there is a better way."}, {"time": 143996, "text": "And we know -- it's called coproduction."}, {"time": 147702, "text": "So in the 1970s, Elinor Ostrom
came up with this theory,"}, {"time": 151583, "text": "really called coproduction,
and this is how it works."}, {"time": 154696, "text": "You bring people into the space
that come with separate expertise,"}, {"time": 158903, "text": "and you also come with new ideas
and lived experience,"}, {"time": 162980, "text": "and you produce a new knowledge."}, {"time": 165391, "text": "And when you produce that new knowledge,"}, {"time": 167575, "text": "and you apply this theory
to public safety,"}, {"time": 170448, "text": "you produce a new type of public safety."}, {"time": 173657, "text": "And so, in New York, it feels like this."}, {"time": 178291, "text": "It is called building relationships,
literally one block at a time."}, {"time": 184293, "text": "And it's "Build the Block.""}, {"time": 185762, "text": "So this is how it works."}, {"time": 187524, "text": "You go to buildtheblock.nyc,
you put in your address."}, {"time": 191974, "text": "And up pops location, date and time
of your neighborhood meeting."}, {"time": 197378, "text": "The important part of this
is you've got to go to the meeting."}, {"time": 200434, "text": "And once you go to that meeting,"}, {"time": 202585, "text": "there, of course, will be NYPD,"}, {"time": 205180, "text": "along with officers
and other community members."}, {"time": 209062, "text": "What's important about bringing, now,
the lived experience into this space"}, {"time": 212560, "text": "to produce new knowledge"}, {"time": 214336, "text": "is that we have to have
a new way of delivering it."}, {"time": 217217, "text": "So the new way of delivering it"}, {"time": 218831, "text": "is through what we call neighborhood
coordinating officers, or NCOs."}, {"time": 223196, "text": "And so, also in this meeting are the NCOs,"}, {"time": 226649, "text": "the what we call 911 response cars,"}, {"time": 229585, "text": "sector cars, detectives,"}, {"time": 232514, "text": "all of us working together
to collaborate in this new way"}, {"time": 235993, "text": "to reduce crime."}, {"time": 238707, "text": "And what's interesting about this
is that we know that it works."}, {"time": 242770, "text": "So, for example, in Washington Heights."}, {"time": 245212, "text": "At a community meeting, there was a bar,
up in Washington Heights,"}, {"time": 248347, "text": "and the neighbors were complaining
about outcry and noises."}, {"time": 251315, "text": "So in their conversations with their NCO,"}, {"time": 254434, "text": "they talked about, you know,
sound barriers,"}, {"time": 256784, "text": "different ways to sort of approach this."}, {"time": 259235, "text": "Is there a different way
we can direct traffic?"}, {"time": 261466, "text": "And of course now they have
relatively quieter bar nights."}, {"time": 265966, "text": "So, another issue that always
comes up in neighborhoods is speeding."}, {"time": 269514, "text": "How many of you in here
have ever had a speeding ticket?"}, {"time": 272187, "text": "Raise your hand."}, {"time": 273363, "text": "Oh, higher, come on!"}, {"time": 274529, "text": "There's more than that, this is New York."}, {"time": 276698, "text": "So those are other issues
that brought to the NCO."}, {"time": 279516, "text": "Speeding -- what the NCOs do"}, {"time": 281304, "text": "is they collaborate
with the Department of Transportation,"}, {"time": 284063, "text": "they look at issues such as speed bumps
and signage and all types of things."}, {"time": 288667, "text": "And when we come together to create
this different type of policing,"}, {"time": 292445, "text": "it also feels different."}, {"time": 295818, "text": "The coproduction
of public safety also means"}, {"time": 298267, "text": "that officers need to understand"}, {"time": 300117, "text": "the history and the power
of their uniforms."}, {"time": 303458, "text": "They're going to have to set aside
old historical narratives"}, {"time": 306290, "text": "that do not serve them well."}, {"time": 308220, "text": "And that means they have to learn
about implicit bias."}, {"time": 311204, "text": "Implicit biases are shortcuts
the brain makes"}, {"time": 314166, "text": "without us really knowing it."}, {"time": 315927, "text": "They're stereotypes
that often influence our decision making."}, {"time": 320434, "text": "And so, you can imagine,"}, {"time": 321695, "text": "for police officers who have to make
split-second decisions"}, {"time": 325085, "text": "can be a very detrimental
decision-making point."}, {"time": 329147, "text": "That's why the NYPD, along with other
departments throughout the United States,"}, {"time": 333909, "text": "are training all of their officers
in implicit bias."}, {"time": 337472, "text": "They have to understand
that learning about their implicit biases,"}, {"time": 342552, "text": "having good training, tactics
and deescalation"}, {"time": 346735, "text": "and understanding how it impacts
your decision making"}, {"time": 349934, "text": "makes us all safer."}, {"time": 352958, "text": "We also know how officers
are treated inside the organization"}, {"time": 356411, "text": "impacts how they're going to behave
with the community at large."}, {"time": 360212, "text": "This is critical."}, {"time": 361839, "text": "Especially if you want to have
a new way forward."}, {"time": 365291, "text": "And we know that we have to care
for those folks that are on the frontline."}, {"time": 369973, "text": "And they have to recognize
their own trauma."}, {"time": 372997, "text": "And in order to do that,
us as leaders have to lift them up"}, {"time": 376779, "text": "and let them know that the narratives
of being strong men and women --"}, {"time": 380097, "text": "you can set those aside,
and it's OK to say you need help."}, {"time": 383652, "text": "And we do that by providing peer support,"}, {"time": 386260, "text": "employee assistance,
mental health services."}, {"time": 389307, "text": "We make sure all
of those things are in place,"}, {"time": 391549, "text": "because without it --"}, {"time": 392966, "text": "it's a critical component
to the coproduction of public safety."}, {"time": 397704, "text": "Equally as important
is that we also have social issues"}, {"time": 400657, "text": "that are often laid at the feet
of law enforcement."}, {"time": 403649, "text": "So, for example,
mental health and education."}, {"time": 407763, "text": "Historically, we've been
pulled into those spaces"}, {"time": 410541, "text": "where we have not necessarily
provided public safety"}, {"time": 414311, "text": "but have enforced long, historical
legislative racial desegregation."}, {"time": 421069, "text": "We have to own our part in history."}, {"time": 424672, "text": "But we also have to have
those folks at the table"}, {"time": 427553, "text": "when we're talking about
how do we move forward with coproduction."}, {"time": 432297, "text": "But understanding this,"}, {"time": 433965, "text": "we also have to understand
that we need to have voices come to us"}, {"time": 438806, "text": "in a different way."}, {"time": 440998, "text": "We also have to recognize"}, {"time": 442666, "text": "that the community
may not be willing or ready"}, {"time": 445950, "text": "to come to the table
to have the conversation."}, {"time": 448982, "text": "And that's OK."}, {"time": 450498, "text": "We have to be able to accept that."}, {"time": 453252, "text": "By acknowledging it, it also means
that we care for the community's health"}, {"time": 456755, "text": "and for their resiliency as well."}, {"time": 458886, "text": "That's another key component."}, {"time": 461633, "text": "We also have to acknowledge"}, {"time": 463007, "text": "that there are those folks
that are in our community that are here --"}, {"time": 466276, "text": "they do want to do us harm."}, {"time": 468419, "text": "We also have to recognize
that we have community members"}, {"time": 471523, "text": "who did not get the benefits
of a long-ago dream."}, {"time": 477180, "text": "We also have to acknowledge"}, {"time": 478895, "text": "that we have put faith in a system
that sometimes is broken,"}, {"time": 482217, "text": "hoping that it would give us
solutions for better."}, {"time": 486486, "text": "But we cannot walk away."}, {"time": 489177, "text": "Because there is a better way."}, {"time": 492101, "text": "And we know this because the NYPD's
neighborhood policing philosophy"}, {"time": 497126, "text": "is grounded in the coproduction
of public safety."}, {"time": 501554, "text": "And in order for us
to move forward together,"}, {"time": 504085, "text": "with our family, our friends
and for our health,"}, {"time": 507927, "text": "we have to make sure
that we focus this way."}, {"time": 511617, "text": "And in order to do that,"}, {"time": 513196, "text": "there are three fundamental ideologies
that we must all agree to."}, {"time": 517950, "text": "Are you ready?"}, {"time": 519679, "text": "Oh, I'm sorry, one more time --
are you ready?"}, {"time": 521871, "text": "Audience: Yes!"}, {"time": 523076, "text": "Tracie Keesee:
Now, that's better, alright."}, {"time": 525109, "text": "The first one: There's no more
wallowing in the why."}, {"time": 528982, "text": "We know why."}, {"time": 532244, "text": "We must move forward together.
There's no more us versus them."}, {"time": 536819, "text": "Number two:"}, {"time": 538811, "text": "We must embrace the lived experience
and our histories,"}, {"time": 543970, "text": "and we must make sure we never go back
to a place where we cannot move forward."}, {"time": 549820, "text": "And number three:"}, {"time": 551955, "text": "We must also make sure"}, {"time": 554304, "text": "that truth and telling facts is painful."}, {"time": 560480, "text": "But we also know that no action
is no longer acceptable."}, {"time": 565274, "text": "And agree?"}, {"time": 566836, "text": "Audience: Yes."}, {"time": 568011, "text": "TK: Oh, I'm sorry, I can't hear you,
do you agree?"}, {"time": 570387, "text": "Audience: Yes!"}, {"time": 571561, "text": "TK: So we do know there is a better way."}, {"time": 573506, "text": "And the better way
is the coproduction of public safety."}, {"time": 577101, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 578291, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: tommy_mccall_the_simple_genius_of_a_good_graphic
speaker: Tommy McCall
title: The simple genius of a good graphic
transcript:
[{"time": 832, "text": "I love infographics."}, {"time": 2473, "text": "As an information designer,"}, {"time": 4211, "text": "I've worked with all sorts of data
over the past 25 years."}, {"time": 7437, "text": "I have a few insights to share,
but first: a little history."}, {"time": 12793, "text": "Communication is the encoding,
transmission and decoding of information."}, {"time": 18125, "text": "Breakthroughs in communication mark
turning points in human culture."}, {"time": 23384, "text": "Oracy, literacy and numeracy
were great developments in communication."}, {"time": 28216, "text": "They allow us to encode ideas into words"}, {"time": 30921, "text": "and quantities into numbers."}, {"time": 33144, "text": "Without communication, we'd still
be stuck in the Stone Ages."}, {"time": 37706, "text": "Although humans have been around
for a quarter million years,"}, {"time": 40636, "text": "it was only 8,000 years ago
that proto-writings began to surface."}, {"time": 44703, "text": "Nearly 3,000 years later, the first
proper writing systems took shape."}, {"time": 51608, "text": "Maps have been around for millennia
and diagrams for hundreds of years,"}, {"time": 56225, "text": "but representing quantities
through graphics"}, {"time": 59083, "text": "is a relatively new development."}, {"time": 61208, "text": "It wasn't until 1786 that William Playfair
invented the first bar chart,"}, {"time": 66090, "text": "giving birth to visual display
of quantitative information."}, {"time": 70980, "text": "Fifteen years later, he introduced
the first pie and area charts."}, {"time": 75225, "text": "His inventions are still the most
commonly used chart forms today."}, {"time": 80698, "text": "Florence Nightingale invented
the coxcomb in 1857"}, {"time": 84920, "text": "for a presentation to Queen Victoria
on troop mortality."}, {"time": 88193, "text": "Highlighted in blue,"}, {"time": 89389, "text": "she showed how most troops' deaths
could have been prevented."}, {"time": 95461, "text": "Shortly after, Charles Minard charted
Napoleon's march on Moscow,"}, {"time": 100138, "text": "illustrating how an army of 422,000
dwindled to just 10,000"}, {"time": 105409, "text": "as battles, geography and freezing
temperatures took their toll."}, {"time": 109885, "text": "He combined a Sankey diagram
with cartography"}, {"time": 113037, "text": "and a line chart for temperature."}, {"time": 117084, "text": "I get excited when I get
lots of data to play with,"}, {"time": 119862, "text": "especially when it yields
an interesting chart form."}, {"time": 125364, "text": "Here, Nightingale's coxcomb
was the inspiration"}, {"time": 129025, "text": "to organize data on thousands
of federal energy subsidies,"}, {"time": 132288, "text": "scrutinizing the lack of investment
in renewables over fossil fuels."}, {"time": 138543, "text": "This Sankey diagram illustrates
the flow of energy through the US economy,"}, {"time": 142779, "text": "emphasizing how nearly half
of the energy used is lost as waste heat."}, {"time": 150598, "text": "I love it when data can be sculpted
into beautiful shapes."}, {"time": 153798, "text": "Here, the personal and professional
connections of the women of Silicon Valley"}, {"time": 158254, "text": "can be woven into arcs,"}, {"time": 162519, "text": "same as the collaboration of inventors
birthing patents across the globe"}, {"time": 166338, "text": "can be mapped."}, {"time": 169385, "text": "I've even made charts for me."}, {"time": 171213, "text": "I'm a numbers person,
so I rarely win at Scrabble."}, {"time": 174250, "text": "I made this diagram to remember
all the two- and three-letter words"}, {"time": 177500, "text": "in the official Scrabble dictionary."}, {"time": 179300, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 180405, "text": "Knowing these 1,168 words
certainly is a game changer."}, {"time": 183283, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 184851, "text": "Sometimes I produce code
to quickly generate graphics"}, {"time": 188464, "text": "from thousands of data points."}, {"time": 191659, "text": "Coding also enables me
to produce interactive graphics."}, {"time": 194778, "text": "Now we can navigate information
on our own terms."}, {"time": 200064, "text": "Exotic chart forms certainly look cool,"}, {"time": 202334, "text": "but something as simple
as a little dot may be all you need"}, {"time": 205235, "text": "to solve a particular thinking task."}, {"time": 209713, "text": "In 2006, the "New York Times"
redesigned their "Markets" section,"}, {"time": 213807, "text": "cutting it down from eight pages
of stock listings"}, {"time": 216278, "text": "to just one and a half pages
of essential market data."}, {"time": 220313, "text": "We listed performance metrics
for the most common stocks,"}, {"time": 223326, "text": "but I wanted to help investors
see how the stocks are doing."}, {"time": 227106, "text": "So I added a simple little dot"}, {"time": 229850, "text": "to show the current price
relative to its one-year range."}, {"time": 234505, "text": "At a glance, value investors can pick out
stocks trading near their lows"}, {"time": 238436, "text": "by looking for dots to the left."}, {"time": 240951, "text": "Momentum investors can find stocks
on an upward trajectory"}, {"time": 244442, "text": "via dots to the right."}, {"time": 246354, "text": "Shortly after, the "Wall Street Journal"
copied the design."}, {"time": 249930, "text": "Simplicity is often the goal
for most graphics,"}, {"time": 252363, "text": "but sometimes we need
to embrace complexity"}, {"time": 255126, "text": "and show large data sets
in their full glory."}, {"time": 260897, "text": "Alec Gallup, the former chairman
of the Gallup Organization,"}, {"time": 264073, "text": "once handed me a very thick book."}, {"time": 266084, "text": "It was his family's legacy:"}, {"time": 267410, "text": "hundreds of pages covering six decades
of presidential approval data."}, {"time": 272170, "text": "I told him the entire book
could be graphed on a single page."}, {"time": 275118, "text": ""Impossible," he said."}, {"time": 278992, "text": "And here it is:"}, {"time": 280180, "text": "25,000 data points on a single page."}, {"time": 283016, "text": "At a glance, one sees that most presidents
start with a high approval rating,"}, {"time": 286806, "text": "but few keep it."}, {"time": 288243, "text": "Events like wars initially boost approval;"}, {"time": 290522, "text": "scandals trigger declines."}, {"time": 293090, "text": "These major events were annotated
in the graphic but not in the book."}, {"time": 297315, "text": "The point is, graphics can transmit data
with incredible efficiency."}, {"time": 304233, "text": "Graphicacy --"}, {"time": 305446, "text": "the ability to read and write graphics --"}, {"time": 307855, "text": "is still in its infancy."}, {"time": 309476, "text": "New chart forms will emerge
and specialized dialects will evolve."}, {"time": 313876, "text": "Graphics that help us think faster"}, {"time": 315594, "text": "or see a book's worth
of information on a single page"}, {"time": 318933, "text": "are the key to unlocking new discoveries."}, {"time": 323134, "text": "Our visual cortex was built
to decode complex information"}, {"time": 326836, "text": "and is a master at pattern recognition."}, {"time": 329440, "text": "Graphicacy enables us
to harness our built-in GPU"}, {"time": 332900, "text": "to process mountains of data"}, {"time": 334584, "text": "and find the veins of gold hiding within."}, {"time": 337204, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 338378, "text": "(Applause and cheers)"}]

name: catherine_mohr_how_i_became_part_sea_urchin
speaker: Catherine Mohr
title: How I became part sea urchin
transcript:
[{"time": 906, "text": "My story starts in the northern
Galapagos Islands,"}, {"time": 4010, "text": "under 50 feet of water
and a big school of sharks."}, {"time": 8148, "text": "I'd been scuba diving with a group
of friends for about a week,"}, {"time": 11143, "text": "and it had been glorious:"}, {"time": 12496, "text": "manta rays, whale sharks,"}, {"time": 15148, "text": "penguins and, of course,
hammerhead sharks."}, {"time": 18675, "text": "Today's dive was particularly tricky."}, {"time": 22101, "text": "The surge was terrible."}, {"time": 23356, "text": "You had to have your camera rig tight in"}, {"time": 25570, "text": "and your arm out,"}, {"time": 26746, "text": "because the surge kept
throwing you into the rocks"}, {"time": 29128, "text": "while you're scanning up
for that beautiful photograph."}, {"time": 31772, "text": "It was going OK, until ..."}, {"time": 34326, "text": "not OK."}, {"time": 35915, "text": "Something was terribly, terribly wrong."}, {"time": 39552, "text": "I pulled my hand back,"}, {"time": 41412, "text": "and I had long, black sea urchin spines"}, {"time": 44078, "text": "all the way through my gloves,"}, {"time": 45702, "text": "which meant all the way through my hand."}, {"time": 48344, "text": "Now, this is bad."}, {"time": 50380, "text": "I mean, obviously when you have something
all the way through your hand,"}, {"time": 53889, "text": "it's kind of bad anyway,"}, {"time": 55127, "text": "but in this case, sea urchins
have a venom on them that,"}, {"time": 59331, "text": "if you've ever tangled with them,"}, {"time": 60948, "text": "you know that a sea urchin spine in you
gives you horrible, painful inflammation."}, {"time": 65619, "text": "But that wasn't even topmost
in my mind at this point."}, {"time": 68340, "text": "This did not look real."}, {"time": 70515, "text": "I could not believe that this was my hand."}, {"time": 73003, "text": "Now, in a crisis, I tend to disassociate
into, like, little scientists,"}, {"time": 77786, "text": "and I start talking very analytically."}, {"time": 80927, "text": "All analysis was gone,
adrenaline brain kicked in,"}, {"time": 83930, "text": "and I just yanked the spines out."}, {"time": 86793, "text": "I don't remember doing it."}, {"time": 89665, "text": "I just remember thinking, "I can't
get my glove off with these in here.""}, {"time": 93546, "text": "I do remember taking the glove off"}, {"time": 95666, "text": "and a big plume of black
coming up in front of my face."}, {"time": 99875, "text": "And biologist brain now shows up
and starts freaking out."}, {"time": 104327, "text": ""How could all that toxin
have gotten into that wound already?""}, {"time": 107520, "text": "Well, physicist brain then shows up
and very calmly explains,"}, {"time": 111665, "text": ""No, no, no, we're at 50 feet,"}, {"time": 113387, "text": "red wavelengths are attenuated."}, {"time": 114888, "text": "That's blood -- not black."}, {"time": 118566, "text": "And sharks."}, {"time": 120793, "text": "So what are you gonna do?""}, {"time": 122965, "text": "Well, I cranked my cummerbund
down really hard over my hand,"}, {"time": 127555, "text": "and I simply swam away."}, {"time": 131078, "text": ""Let's let that big old cloud of blood
dissipate a bit before we have to surface"}, {"time": 136416, "text": "through all of these sharks.""}, {"time": 138248, "text": "So when I did surface,"}, {"time": 139739, "text": "my warm-blooded-mammal brain"}, {"time": 141664, "text": "was in an absolute gibbering panic:"}, {"time": 143740, "text": ""They don't feed when they're schooling.
They don't feed when they're schooling."}, {"time": 147892, "text": "All the way up.""}, {"time": 149243, "text": "And they didn't."}, {"time": 150451, "text": "So apparently, they have read
the same books that I have."}, {"time": 153691, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 155107, "text": "Now, it turns out,"}, {"time": 156559, "text": "when you've been stabbed
with sea urchin spines,"}, {"time": 158895, "text": "and you're two days away
from any medical help,"}, {"time": 161597, "text": "the thing that you've got to do
is, unfortunately, cook your hand."}, {"time": 166621, "text": "So you put it in water
as hot as you can stand,"}, {"time": 169289, "text": "and you keep adding boiling water"}, {"time": 170948, "text": "until you think you will go
absolutely insane."}, {"time": 174286, "text": "Now, it worked --"}, {"time": 176249, "text": "the hand itself did not work so well
for several weeks after that,"}, {"time": 180410, "text": "but eventually,
fine motor skills returned."}, {"time": 183572, "text": "All except for one spot, that stayed
stiff and painful for weeks"}, {"time": 188190, "text": "after the other things had gotten better."}, {"time": 190416, "text": "So it turned out, I'd broken off
a tip of the urchin spine"}, {"time": 194684, "text": "in the joint itself,"}, {"time": 196811, "text": "and that's why it wasn't getting better."}, {"time": 198785, "text": "So the orthopedist says,
"You know, we should get this out."}, {"time": 201768, "text": "Nothing too urgent, not an emergency.""}, {"time": 204438, "text": "So we scheduled a small surgery
for a few weeks out on a Monday."}, {"time": 208476, "text": "And on the Friday before,"}, {"time": 210952, "text": "I broke my pelvis
in a horseback riding accident."}, {"time": 214044, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 215767, "text": "Yeah."}, {"time": 217000, "text": "So we kind of postponed that surgery."}, {"time": 220461, "text": "My broken pelvis and I were now
facing six weeks on the couch,"}, {"time": 225042, "text": "and I would have gone absolutely insane
if it hadn't been for my friends."}, {"time": 230170, "text": "Spontaneous parties broke out
at my house every night for weeks."}, {"time": 233653, "text": "I was fed. I was entertained."}, {"time": 235953, "text": "It was great."}, {"time": 238015, "text": "But that kind of enthusiasm is sort of
hard to sustain over the long term,"}, {"time": 241960, "text": "and eventually it petered down
to just one friend,"}, {"time": 245280, "text": "who would send me jokes during the day"}, {"time": 247296, "text": "and come and keep me company
in the evenings --"}, {"time": 249924, "text": "someone I got to know a whole lot better
during this period of convalescence."}, {"time": 254314, "text": "And when I was finally
pronounced well enough"}, {"time": 256454, "text": "to do weight-bearing activities,"}, {"time": 258168, "text": "we loaded a telescope in the car
and drove up into the mountains"}, {"time": 261231, "text": "to look at the Hale–Bopp comet."}, {"time": 263371, "text": "Yes, we are geeks."}, {"time": 265489, "text": "And got caught in a landslide."}, {"time": 267213, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 269182, "text": "I know -- like, really?"}, {"time": 272051, "text": "No. Just kidding."}, {"time": 273537, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 274743, "text": "No more disasters. No.
Just the opposite, in fact."}, {"time": 277699, "text": "That was 21 years ago,"}, {"time": 279263, "text": "and for 19 of those years,"}, {"time": 281174, "text": "I have been married
to that marvelous introvert"}, {"time": 284798, "text": "who never in a million years
would have approached me"}, {"time": 287334, "text": "under other circumstances."}, {"time": 289049, "text": "We have a wonderful 14-year-old daughter,"}, {"time": 291133, "text": "who did all my illustrations."}, {"time": 292764, "text": "(Cheers and applause)"}, {"time": 294364, "text": "Yeah."}, {"time": 295550, "text": "So, pro tip:"}, {"time": 296912, "text": "apparently, nothing makes you sexier
than needing a walker"}, {"time": 299720, "text": "on your first date."}, {"time": 301393, "text": "So this isn't a story about piercings"}, {"time": 304030, "text": "or sharks or boilings or breakings."}, {"time": 306839, "text": "It's a love story."}, {"time": 308758, "text": "It's a love story with
a funny little epilogue."}, {"time": 312845, "text": "Now I was weight-bearing again,
I could reschedule that surgery,"}, {"time": 316899, "text": "get the spine out."}, {"time": 318219, "text": "But I didn't need it anymore."}, {"time": 320407, "text": "Turns out, when you break a bone,"}, {"time": 322131, "text": "your body scavenges calcium
from all the bones in your body --"}, {"time": 326081, "text": "and from the little sea urchin spine
that you happen to have lodged"}, {"time": 329994, "text": "in the joint of your finger."}, {"time": 332022, "text": "So yes,"}, {"time": 334094, "text": "my pelvis is now part sea urchin."}, {"time": 337506, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 339355, "text": "So to biology brain, physicist brain,"}, {"time": 342469, "text": "adrenaline brain,
warm-blooded-mammal brain,"}, {"time": 344640, "text": "I get to add "urchin brain,""}, {"time": 346672, "text": "with all of the superpowers
that that confers."}, {"time": 350393, "text": "You don't need to worry, though:"}, {"time": 351953, "text": "that I am not fully human
is one of the things"}, {"time": 354136, "text": "that my family loves the most about me."}, {"time": 356153, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 357264, "text": "Thank you very much."}, {"time": 358483, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: luke_sital_singh_afterneath_killing_me
speaker: Luke Sital-Singh
title: "Afterneath" / "Killing Me"
transcript:
[{"time": 1333, "text": "(Piano)"}, {"time": 17939, "text": "(Singing) It was done"}, {"time": 20860, "text": "When the benediction had been sung"}, {"time": 26415, "text": "Firelight gently woke us
