from our golden night"}, {"time": 35111, "text": "My surprise"}, {"time": 37940, "text": "I can turn to see your open eyes"}, {"time": 42681, "text": "And I know
You are alive"}, {"time": 49576, "text": "I know that smile"}, {"time": 53306, "text": "Nothing more"}, {"time": 57718, "text": "In the after"}, {"time": 61197, "text": "There is waking from your sleep"}, {"time": 64998, "text": "And your lover"}, {"time": 68950, "text": "Is the only face you see"}, {"time": 72755, "text": "We are after"}, {"time": 76449, "text": "Ever after"}, {"time": 80178, "text": "There is laughter"}, {"time": 83529, "text": "Afterneath"}, {"time": 104413, "text": "The war"}, {"time": 107131, "text": "Nobody ever even asked what for"}, {"time": 112694, "text": "Up above"}, {"time": 115508, "text": "Nothing matters but the ones you love"}, {"time": 120075, "text": "So get out with me"}, {"time": 122992, "text": "Now you've got enough with me"}, {"time": 126814, "text": "Just the two of us you see"}, {"time": 130805, "text": "And nothing more"}, {"time": 135164, "text": "In the after"}, {"time": 138980, "text": "There is waking from your sleep"}, {"time": 142738, "text": "And your lover"}, {"time": 146409, "text": "Is the only face you see"}, {"time": 150127, "text": "We are after"}, {"time": 153755, "text": "Ever after"}, {"time": 157509, "text": "There is laughter
Afterneath"}, {"time": 164234, "text": "Oh, we after"}, {"time": 168674, "text": "Ever after"}, {"time": 172461, "text": "There is laughter"}, {"time": 175420, "text": "Afterneath"}, {"time": 182062, "text": "Oh"}, {"time": 190571, "text": "Oh"}, {"time": 198914, "text": "Oh"}, {"time": 207482, "text": "Oh"}, {"time": 217944, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 219150, "text": "(Applause)"}, {"time": 223326, "text": "Thank you very much."}, {"time": 224501, "text": "(Applause)"}, {"time": 226401, "text": "Thanks."}, {"time": 228363, "text": "I love a depressing song ..."}, {"time": 230805, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 231830, "text": "you know?"}, {"time": 233005, "text": "I've been writing them for 15 years now,"}, {"time": 235418, "text": "and to be honest, over that time,"}, {"time": 238448, "text": "I've come to kind of believe
that they're not really depressing at all."}, {"time": 242196, "text": "In fact, I think they're kind of the most
important songs we have."}, {"time": 246317, "text": "Songs that sing of sorrow,"}, {"time": 249465, "text": "of grief,"}, {"time": 250640, "text": "of longing,"}, {"time": 252022, "text": "of the darker side of love,"}, {"time": 254210, "text": "the underside of being alive,"}, {"time": 256665, "text": "these are the songs
I just never tire of hearing"}, {"time": 259531, "text": "and I never tire of writing,"}, {"time": 261766, "text": "because they make me feel less alone."}, {"time": 264973, "text": "They speak to a very real
part of being human"}, {"time": 268322, "text": "that can often be hidden in fear and shame"}, {"time": 270967, "text": "and pushed deep down
where it lingers and rots."}, {"time": 274318, "text": "But I think in listening to these songs --"}, {"time": 276521, "text": "really listening --"}, {"time": 278624, "text": "can allow us to refeel
these hard emotions,"}, {"time": 283038, "text": "but in a cathartic and healing way."}, {"time": 285999, "text": "In a way that reminds us, as we listen,
that we're not alone in darkness."}, {"time": 292676, "text": "There's a Japanese phrase
known as "mono no aware,""}, {"time": 297443, "text": "which roughly translates
as "the bittersweet poignancy of things,""}, {"time": 302262, "text": "or the pathos or "ahness" of things."}, {"time": 306428, "text": "It's a valuable awareness of impermanence,"}, {"time": 310324, "text": "both a kind of gentle, transient
sadness as things pass by in life,"}, {"time": 315367, "text": "but also a deeper,
softly lingering sadness"}, {"time": 320055, "text": "about the impermanence of all reality."}, {"time": 322939, "text": ""Mono no aware" can be manifest
in lots of life stories and moments"}, {"time": 327949, "text": "and songs."}, {"time": 329162, "text": "One example in Japanese culture
is the celebration of the cherry blossom."}, {"time": 334262, "text": "The cherry blossom in and of itself
is no more impressive"}, {"time": 337382, "text": "than that of an apple or orange tree,"}, {"time": 340494, "text": "but what sets it apart is its brevity."}, {"time": 343564, "text": "Cherry blossoms fall
within a single week --"}, {"time": 346413, "text": "can be whisked away
on the gentlest breeze --"}, {"time": 349686, "text": "and it's this that makes it
more beautiful."}, {"time": 352536, "text": "It's utterly fragile,"}, {"time": 354377, "text": "and fragility gives life its poignancy."}, {"time": 357918, "text": "Now, being a cheery chap,"}, {"time": 359274, "text": "nothing speaks to me more
than this, and --"}, {"time": 362116, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 363402, "text": "you know, I think it's been the essence
of my songwriting for years,"}, {"time": 367819, "text": "of what moves me to write,"}, {"time": 369655, "text": "what inspires me to sing."}, {"time": 372052, "text": "Because pain and grief and doubt,"}, {"time": 375258, "text": "when it's made manifest
in music, in song --"}, {"time": 378814, "text": "when it's made beautiful
in poetry and painting,"}, {"time": 384097, "text": "it can build a community and a kinship"}, {"time": 386668, "text": "in the knowledge that we are
none of us alone in darkness."}, {"time": 391243, "text": "My next song is one
that I call "Killing Me,""}, {"time": 395544, "text": "and as the name suggests,"}, {"time": 396766, "text": "it's not a dance floor favorite."}, {"time": 398633, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 399658, "text": "But it isn't miserable."}, {"time": 403073, "text": "It's full of love and hope."}, {"time": 405176, "text": "And I think it exemplifies everything
I've been talking about."}, {"time": 408192, "text": "And it's the first song I've written
from the perspective of somebody else,"}, {"time": 412722, "text": "specifically my grandmother,"}, {"time": 415191, "text": "as she lives on without
my late grandfather,"}, {"time": 418412, "text": "as she experiences
new things in her life --"}, {"time": 421510, "text": "her grandchildren getting married,"}, {"time": 424179, "text": "having their own children,"}, {"time": 425804, "text": "speaking at TED --"}, {"time": 428358, "text": "all the while she lives without,"}, {"time": 429910, "text": "and all the while she misses
her soul mate."}, {"time": 432851, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 439495, "text": "(Piano)"}, {"time": 453083, "text": "(Singing) Sweetheart
would you wake up today?"}, {"time": 460120, "text": "I promise you would recognize my faith"}, {"time": 466776, "text": "I want to show you
how I've grown in this place"}, {"time": 473825, "text": "In this place I'm not alone"}, {"time": 477542, "text": "And I know I'll be OK"}, {"time": 481248, "text": "But it's always harder
When the winter comes to stay"}, {"time": 488082, "text": "And I can't help remember
all the words I never said"}, {"time": 498870, "text": "And it's killing me
That you're not here with me"}, {"time": 505409, "text": "I'm living happily"}, {"time": 508862, "text": "But I'm feeling guilty"}, {"time": 513429, "text": "And you won't believe
The wonders I can see"}, {"time": 519899, "text": "This world is changing me"}, {"time": 523689, "text": "But I will love you faithfully."}, {"time": 528571, "text": "(Piano)"}, {"time": 535477, "text": "Oh, everything is taller these days"}, {"time": 542370, "text": "Maybe I feel smaller
and time rushes away"}, {"time": 549560, "text": "So much I could show you"}, {"time": 553006, "text": "How all the great-grandchildren"}, {"time": 556262, "text": "Have been laughing
like we did when we were young"}, {"time": 563360, "text": "I've been laughing like we did
when we were young"}, {"time": 570782, "text": "Oh, it's killing me
that you're not here with me"}, {"time": 577283, "text": "I'm living happily"}, {"time": 580644, "text": "But I'm feeling guilty"}, {"time": 585023, "text": "Oh, you won't believe
The wonders I can see"}, {"time": 591394, "text": "This world is changing me"}, {"time": 594894, "text": "I will love you faithfully"}, {"time": 599992, "text": "Oh"}, {"time": 605283, "text": "Oh"}, {"time": 614190, "text": "Oh"}, {"time": 619440, "text": "Oh"}, {"time": 626472, "text": "Oh, it's killing me"}, {"time": 630272, "text": "That you're not here with me"}, {"time": 633868, "text": "I'm living happily"}, {"time": 637217, "text": "But I'm feeling guilty"}, {"time": 641645, "text": "Oh, you won't believe
The wonders I can see"}, {"time": 647940, "text": "This world is changing me"}, {"time": 651475, "text": "I will love you faithfully"}, {"time": 655956, "text": "Oh, it's killing me"}, {"time": 659007, "text": "That you're not here with me"}, {"time": 662506, "text": "I'm living happily"}, {"time": 665899, "text": "But I'm feeling guilty"}, {"time": 670675, "text": "Oh, you won't believe
The wonders I can see"}, {"time": 677914, "text": "This world is changing me"}, {"time": 681957, "text": "But I will love you faithfully"}, {"time": 689467, "text": "Thank you very much."}, {"time": 690711, "text": "(Applause and cheering)"}]

name: chip_colwell_why_museums_are_returning_cultural_treasures
speaker: Chip Colwell
title: Why museums are returning cultural treasures
transcript:
[{"time": 1992, "text": "A confession:"}, {"time": 3834, "text": "I am an archaeologist
and a museum curator,"}, {"time": 6831, "text": "but a paradoxical one."}, {"time": 9637, "text": "For my museum, I collect things,"}, {"time": 12292, "text": "but I also return things
back to where they came from."}, {"time": 16815, "text": "I love museums because
they're social and educational,"}, {"time": 21395, "text": "but I'm most drawn to them
because of the magic of objects:"}, {"time": 25814, "text": "a one-million-year-old hand axe,"}, {"time": 28316, "text": "a totem pole, an impressionist painting"}, {"time": 31294, "text": "all take us beyond our own imaginations."}, {"time": 35228, "text": "In museums, we pause to muse,
to gaze upon our human empire of things"}, {"time": 41682, "text": "in meditation and wonder."}, {"time": 45315, "text": "I understand why US museums alone"}, {"time": 47573, "text": "host more than 850 million
visits each year."}, {"time": 53390, "text": "Yet, in recent years, museums
have become a battleground."}, {"time": 57564, "text": "Communities around the world
don't want to see their culture"}, {"time": 60452, "text": "in distant institutions
which they have no control over."}, {"time": 64783, "text": "They want to see their cultural treasures"}, {"time": 66948, "text": "repatriated, returned
to their places of origin."}, {"time": 71679, "text": "Greece seeks the return
of the Parthenon Marbles,"}, {"time": 74489, "text": "a collection of classical sculptures
held by the British Museum."}, {"time": 79425, "text": "Egypt demands antiquities from Germany."}, {"time": 83187, "text": "New Zealand's Maori want to see returned"}, {"time": 86007, "text": "ancestral tattooed heads
from museums everywhere."}, {"time": 91197, "text": "Yet these claims pale in comparison
to those made by Native Americans."}, {"time": 96857, "text": "Already, US museums have returned
more than one million artifacts"}, {"time": 100794, "text": "and 50,000 sets
of Native American skeletons."}, {"time": 106891, "text": "To illustrate what's at stake,
let's start with the War Gods."}, {"time": 111461, "text": "This is a wood carving"}, {"time": 113335, "text": "made by members
of the Zuni tribe in New Mexico."}, {"time": 117399, "text": "In the 1880s, anthropologists
began to collect them"}, {"time": 120622, "text": "as evidence of American Indian religion."}, {"time": 124040, "text": "They came to be seen as beautiful,"}, {"time": 127123, "text": "the precursor to the stark sculptures
of Picasso and Paul Klee,"}, {"time": 132120, "text": "helping to usher in
the modern art movement."}, {"time": 136559, "text": "From one viewpoint, the museum
did exactly as it's supposed to"}, {"time": 140830, "text": "with the War God."}, {"time": 142274, "text": "It helped introduce
a little-known art form"}, {"time": 144717, "text": "for the world to appreciate."}, {"time": 148200, "text": "But from another point of view,"}, {"time": 149741, "text": "the museum had committed
a terrible crime of cultural violence."}, {"time": 155589, "text": "For Zunis, the War God
is not a piece of art,"}, {"time": 159644, "text": "it is not even a thing."}, {"time": 161637, "text": "It is a being."}, {"time": 165521, "text": "For Zunis, every year,"}, {"time": 168221, "text": "priests ritually carve new War Gods,"}, {"time": 170467, "text": "the Ahayu:da,"}, {"time": 171983, "text": "breathing life into them
in a long ceremony."}, {"time": 175408, "text": "They are placed on sacred shrines"}, {"time": 177404, "text": "where they live to protect the Zuni people"}, {"time": 180669, "text": "and keep the universe in balance."}, {"time": 183856, "text": "No one can own or sell a War God."}, {"time": 186182, "text": "They belong only to the earth."}, {"time": 189443, "text": "And so Zunis want them back from museums"}, {"time": 192634, "text": "so they can go to their shrine homes"}, {"time": 196531, "text": "to fulfill their spiritual purpose."}, {"time": 200451, "text": "What is a curator to do?"}, {"time": 203461, "text": "I believe that the War Gods
should be returned."}, {"time": 208694, "text": "This might be a startling answer."}, {"time": 210345, "text": "After all, my conclusion
contradicts the refrain"}, {"time": 212948, "text": "of the world's most famous archaeologist:"}, {"time": 216174, "text": ""That belongs in a museum!""}, {"time": 217752, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 220712, "text": "is what Indiana Jones said,
not just to drive movie plots,"}, {"time": 224760, "text": "but to drive home the unquestionable good
of museums for society."}, {"time": 231052, "text": "I did not come to my view easily."}, {"time": 233926, "text": "I grew up in Tucson, Arizona,"}, {"time": 236401, "text": "and fell in love
with the Sonoran Desert's past."}, {"time": 240037, "text": "I was amazed that beneath
the city's bland strip malls"}, {"time": 244042, "text": "was 12,000 years of history
just waiting to be discovered."}, {"time": 248983, "text": "When I was 16 years old,
I started taking archaeology classes"}, {"time": 252274, "text": "and going out on digs."}, {"time": 254896, "text": "A high school teacher of mine
even helped me set up my own laboratory"}, {"time": 258192, "text": "to study animal bones."}, {"time": 261061, "text": "But in college,"}, {"time": 263125, "text": "I came to learn that my future career
had a dark history."}, {"time": 268372, "text": "Starting in the 1860s,"}, {"time": 271127, "text": "Native American skeletons
became a tool for science,"}, {"time": 275278, "text": "collected in the thousands"}, {"time": 277160, "text": "to prove new theories
of social and racial hierarchies."}, {"time": 282735, "text": "Native American human remains
were plundered from graves,"}, {"time": 287267, "text": "even taken fresh from battlefields."}, {"time": 292370, "text": "When archaeologists
came across white graves,"}, {"time": 294847, "text": "the skeleton was often quickly reburied,"}, {"time": 297307, "text": "while Native bones were deposited
as specimens on museum shelves."}, {"time": 303380, "text": "In the wake of war, stolen land,
boarding schools,"}, {"time": 306729, "text": "laws banning religion,"}, {"time": 308540, "text": "anthropologists collected sacred objects"}, {"time": 310666, "text": "in the belief that Native peoples
were on the cusp of extinction."}, {"time": 316162, "text": "You can call it racism or colonialism,
but the labels don't matter"}, {"time": 320569, "text": "as much as the fact
that over the last century,"}, {"time": 323401, "text": "Native American rights and culture
were taken from them."}, {"time": 328039, "text": "In 1990, after years of Native protests,"}, {"time": 331274, "text": "the US government,
through the US Congress,"}, {"time": 333731, "text": "finally passed a law that allowed
Native Americans to reclaim"}, {"time": 338105, "text": "cultural items, sacred objects
and human remains from museums."}, {"time": 342854, "text": "Many archaeologists were panicked."}, {"time": 346713, "text": "For scientists,"}, {"time": 347911, "text": "it can be hard to fully grasp
how a piece of wood can be a living god"}, {"time": 354175, "text": "or how spirits surround bones."}, {"time": 356427, "text": "And they knew that modern science,
especially with DNA,"}, {"time": 360253, "text": "can provide luminous insights
into the past."}, {"time": 365155, "text": "As the anthropologist
Frank Norwick declared,"}, {"time": 367738, "text": ""We are doing important work
that benefits all of mankind."}, {"time": 371893, "text": "We are not returning anything to anyone.""}, {"time": 377381, "text": "As a college student,
all of this was an enigma"}, {"time": 380382, "text": "that was hard to decipher."}, {"time": 383409, "text": "Why did Native Americans
want their heritage back"}, {"time": 386426, "text": "from the very places preserving it?"}, {"time": 389849, "text": "And how could scientists
spend their entire lives"}, {"time": 393095, "text": "studying dead Indians"}, {"time": 394610, "text": "but seem to care so little
about living ones?"}, {"time": 400221, "text": "I graduated but wasn't sure
what to do next,"}, {"time": 403436, "text": "so I traveled."}, {"time": 406897, "text": "One day, in South Africa,"}, {"time": 408620, "text": "I visited Nelson Mandela's
former prison cell on Robben Island."}, {"time": 413160, "text": "I had an epiphany."}, {"time": 415590, "text": "Here was a man who helped
a country bridge vast divides"}, {"time": 419798, "text": "to seek, however imperfectly,
reconciliation."}, {"time": 424120, "text": "I'm no Mandela, but I ask myself:"}, {"time": 426853, "text": "Could I, too, plant seeds of hope
in the ruins of the past?"}, {"time": 431586, "text": "In 2007, I was hired as a curator"}, {"time": 433979, "text": "at the Denver Museum
of Nature and Science."}, {"time": 436801, "text": "Our team agreed that unlike
many other institutions,"}, {"time": 440037, "text": "we needed to proactively confront
the legacy of museum collecting."}, {"time": 445850, "text": "We started with
the skeletons in our closet,"}, {"time": 449089, "text": "100 of them."}, {"time": 451035, "text": "After months and then years,
we met with dozens of tribes"}, {"time": 453806, "text": "to figure out how to get
these remains home."}, {"time": 456840, "text": "And this is hard work."}, {"time": 458222, "text": "It involves negotiating
who will receive the remains,"}, {"time": 462325, "text": "how to respectfully transfer them,"}, {"time": 464277, "text": "where will they go."}, {"time": 466734, "text": "Native American leaders
become undertakers,"}, {"time": 470365, "text": "planning funerals for dead relatives
they had never wanted unearthed."}, {"time": 477106, "text": "A decade later, the Denver Museum
and our Native partners"}, {"time": 479840, "text": "have reburied nearly all
of the human remains in the collection."}, {"time": 484098, "text": "We have returned
hundreds of sacred objects."}, {"time": 487600, "text": "But I've come to see
that these battles are endless."}, {"time": 491837, "text": "Repatriation is now a permanent feature
of the museum world."}, {"time": 497310, "text": "Hundreds of tribes are waiting their turn."}, {"time": 500668, "text": "There are always
more museums with more stuff."}, {"time": 504766, "text": "Every catalogued War God
in an American public museum"}, {"time": 507703, "text": "has now been returned -- 106, so far --"}, {"time": 511957, "text": "but there are more
beyond the reach of US law,"}, {"time": 515021, "text": "in private collections
and outside our borders."}, {"time": 519225, "text": "In 2014, I had the chance to travel
with a respected religious leader"}, {"time": 524353, "text": "from the Zuni tribe
named Octavius Seowtewa"}, {"time": 528219, "text": "to visit five museums
in Europe with War Gods."}, {"time": 531680, "text": "At the Ethnological Museum of Berlin,"}, {"time": 534363, "text": "we saw a War God
with a history of dubious care."}, {"time": 538443, "text": "An overly enthusiastic curator
had added chicken feathers to it."}, {"time": 542922, "text": "Its necklace had once been stolen."}, {"time": 546267, "text": "At the Musée du quai Branly in Paris,"}, {"time": 548340, "text": "an official told us that the War God there
is now state property"}, {"time": 551697, "text": "with no provisions for repatriation."}, {"time": 554554, "text": "He insisted that the War God
no longer served Zunis"}, {"time": 557490, "text": "but museum visitors."}, {"time": 559238, "text": "He said, "We give all
of the objects to the world.""}, {"time": 563487, "text": "At the British Museum,"}, {"time": 564963, "text": "we were warned that the Zuni case
would establish a dangerous precedent"}, {"time": 568995, "text": "for bigger disputes,"}, {"time": 570464, "text": "such as the Parthenon Marbles,
claimed by Greece."}, {"time": 574574, "text": "After visiting the five museums,"}, {"time": 577067, "text": "Octavius returned home
to his people empty-handed."}, {"time": 582284, "text": "He later told me,"}, {"time": 583618, "text": ""It hurts my heart to see
the Ahayu:da so far away."}, {"time": 586943, "text": "They all belong together."}, {"time": 589066, "text": "It's like a family member
that's missing from a family dinner."}, {"time": 594292, "text": "When one is gone,
their strength is broken.""}, {"time": 598848, "text": "I wish that my colleagues
in Europe and beyond"}, {"time": 601686, "text": "could see that the War Gods
do not represent the end of museums"}, {"time": 605187, "text": "but the chance for a new beginning."}, {"time": 608861, "text": "When you walk the halls of a museum,"}, {"time": 611481, "text": "you're likely just seeing
about one percent"}, {"time": 614274, "text": "of the total collections."}, {"time": 615517, "text": "The rest is in storage."}, {"time": 617535, "text": "Even after returning
500 cultural items and skeletons,"}, {"time": 621346, "text": "my museum still retains 99.999 percent
of its total collections."}, {"time": 627987, "text": "Though we no longer have War Gods,"}, {"time": 629671, "text": "we have Zuni traditional pottery,"}, {"time": 632075, "text": "jewelry, tools, clothing and arts."}, {"time": 636461, "text": "And even more precious than these objects"}, {"time": 639312, "text": "are the relationships that we formed
with Native Americans"}, {"time": 642669, "text": "through the process of repatriation."}, {"time": 646673, "text": "Now, we can ask Zunis
to share their culture with us."}, {"time": 652810, "text": "Not long ago, I had the chance
to visit the returned War Gods."}, {"time": 657263, "text": "A shrine sits up high atop a mesa
overlooking beautiful Zuni homeland."}, {"time": 664466, "text": "The shrine is enclosed
by a roofless stone building"}, {"time": 668705, "text": "threaded at the top with barbed wire"}, {"time": 671157, "text": "to ensure that they're not stolen again."}, {"time": 674553, "text": "And there they are, inside,"}, {"time": 676918, "text": "the Ahayu:da,"}, {"time": 678146, "text": "106 War Gods amid offerings
of turquoise, cornmeal, shell,"}, {"time": 683581, "text": "even T-shirts ..."}, {"time": 686149, "text": "a modern gift to ancient beings."}, {"time": 689306, "text": "And standing there,"}, {"time": 691045, "text": "I got a glimpse at the War Gods'
true purpose in the world."}, {"time": 695518, "text": "And it occurred to me then"}, {"time": 697185, "text": "that we do not get to choose
the histories that we inherit."}, {"time": 702043, "text": "Museum curators today
did not pillage ancient graves"}, {"time": 705202, "text": "or steal spiritual objects,"}, {"time": 707012, "text": "but we can accept responsibility
for correcting past mistakes."}, {"time": 712232, "text": "We can help restore dignity,"}, {"time": 714496, "text": "hope and humanity to Native Americans,"}, {"time": 717957, "text": "the very people who were once
the voiceless objects of our curiosity."}, {"time": 722400, "text": "And this doesn't even require us
to fully understand others' beliefs,"}, {"time": 727505, "text": "only that we respect them."}, {"time": 730732, "text": "Museums are temples to things past."}, {"time": 734406, "text": "Now they must also become
places for living cultures."}, {"time": 740466, "text": "As I turned to walk away from the shrine,"}, {"time": 742760, "text": "I drank in the warm summer air,"}, {"time": 745158, "text": "and I watched an eagle
turn lazy circles high above."}, {"time": 749483, "text": "I thought of the Zunis,"}, {"time": 750960, "text": "whose offerings ensure
that their culture is not dead and gone"}, {"time": 755179, "text": "but alive and well,"}, {"time": 757970, "text": "and I could think of no better place
for the War Gods to be."}, {"time": 762069, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 763244, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: kaitlyn_sadtler_how_we_could_teach_our_bodies_to_heal_faster
speaker: Kaitlyn Sadtler
title: How we could teach our bodies to heal faster
transcript:
[{"time": 1404, "text": "What if you could take a pill or a vaccine"}, {"time": 4936, "text": "and, just like getting over a cold,"}, {"time": 6690, "text": "you could heal your wounds faster?"}, {"time": 8809, "text": "Today, if we have
an operation or an accident,"}, {"time": 12355, "text": "we're in the hospital for weeks,"}, {"time": 14000, "text": "and often left with scars
and painful side effects"}, {"time": 16650, "text": "of our inability to regenerate
or regrow healthy, uninjured organs."}, {"time": 22436, "text": "I work to create materials"}, {"time": 24486, "text": "that instruct our immune system to give us
the signals to grow new tissues."}, {"time": 29497, "text": "Just like vaccines instruct
our body to fight disease,"}, {"time": 32595, "text": "we could instead instruct
our immune system"}, {"time": 35347, "text": "to build tissues
and more quickly heal wounds."}, {"time": 38886, "text": "Now, regrowing body parts out of nowhere
might seem like magic,"}, {"time": 42688, "text": "but there are several organisms
that can achieve this feat."}, {"time": 45903, "text": "Some lizards can regrow their tails,"}, {"time": 48370, "text": "the humble salamander
can completely regenerate their arm,"}, {"time": 52339, "text": "and even us mere humans
can regrow our liver"}, {"time": 55252, "text": "after losing more than half
of its original mass."}, {"time": 58615, "text": "To make this magic
a bit closer to reality,"}, {"time": 61274, "text": "I'm investigating how our body
can heal wounds and build tissue"}, {"time": 65393, "text": "through instructions
from the immune system."}, {"time": 68387, "text": "From a scrape on your knee
to that annoying sinus infection,"}, {"time": 71936, "text": "our immune system defends
our body from danger."}, {"time": 75199, "text": "I'm an immunologist,"}, {"time": 76684, "text": "and by using what I know
about our body's defense system,"}, {"time": 79738, "text": "I was able to identify key players"}, {"time": 81938, "text": "in our fight to build back
our cuts and bruises."}, {"time": 85436, "text": "When looking at materials
that are currently being tested"}, {"time": 88129, "text": "for their abilities to help regrow muscle,"}, {"time": 90351, "text": "our team noticed that after treating
an injured muscle with these materials,"}, {"time": 94534, "text": "there was a large number of immune cells"}, {"time": 96881, "text": "in that material
and the surrounding muscle."}, {"time": 100010, "text": "So in this case,"}, {"time": 101192, "text": "instead of the immune cells rushing off
towards infection to fight bacteria,"}, {"time": 105430, "text": "they're rushing toward an injury."}, {"time": 107922, "text": "I discovered a specific
type of immune cell,"}, {"time": 110779, "text": "the helper T cell,"}, {"time": 112097, "text": "was present inside
that material that I implanted"}, {"time": 114850, "text": "and absolutely critical for wound healing."}, {"time": 118325, "text": "Now, just like when you were a kid
and you'd break your pencil"}, {"time": 121791, "text": "and try and tape it back together again,"}, {"time": 124353, "text": "we can heal,"}, {"time": 125531, "text": "but it might not be
in the most functional way,"}, {"time": 127800, "text": "and we'll get a scar."}, {"time": 129515, "text": "So if we don't have these helper T cells,"}, {"time": 132523, "text": "instead of healthy muscle,"}, {"time": 134134, "text": "our muscle develops
fat cells inside of it,"}, {"time": 136769, "text": "and if there's fat in our muscle,
it isn't as strong."}, {"time": 140033, "text": "Now, using our immune system,"}, {"time": 142457, "text": "our body could grow back
without these scars"}, {"time": 144978, "text": "and look like what it was
before we were even injured."}, {"time": 149128, "text": "I'm working to create materials"}, {"time": 151712, "text": "that give us the signals
to build new tissue"}, {"time": 154015, "text": "by changing the immune response."}, {"time": 156840, "text": "We know that any time
a material is implanted in our body,"}, {"time": 161079, "text": "the immune system will respond to it."}, {"time": 163158, "text": "This ranges from pacemakers
to insulin pumps"}, {"time": 167691, "text": "to the materials that engineers are using
to try and build new tissue."}, {"time": 171932, "text": "So when I place that material,
or scaffold, in the body,"}, {"time": 176021, "text": "the immune system creates
a small environment of cells and proteins"}, {"time": 180450, "text": "that can change the way
that our stem cells behave."}, {"time": 183817, "text": "Now, just like the weather
affects our daily activities,"}, {"time": 187739, "text": "like going for a run"}, {"time": 189088, "text": "or staying inside and binge-watching
an entire TV show on Netflix,"}, {"time": 193597, "text": "the immune environment of a scaffold"}, {"time": 195589, "text": "affects the way that
our stem cells grow and develop."}, {"time": 198883, "text": "If we have the wrong signals,"}, {"time": 200923, "text": "say the Netflix signals,"}, {"time": 202622, "text": "we get fat cells instead of muscle."}, {"time": 206790, "text": "These scaffolds are made
of a variety of different things,"}, {"time": 209941, "text": "from plastics to naturally
derived materials,"}, {"time": 213330, "text": "nanofibers of varying thicknesses,"}, {"time": 216105, "text": "sponges that are more or less porous,"}, {"time": 218542, "text": "gels of different stiffnesses."}, {"time": 220685, "text": "And researchers
can even make the materials"}, {"time": 222819, "text": "release different signals over time."}, {"time": 225473, "text": "So in other words, we can orchestrate
this Broadway show of cells"}, {"time": 230743, "text": "by giving them the correct
stage, cues and props"}, {"time": 234625, "text": "that can be changed for different tissues,"}, {"time": 236870, "text": "just like a producer would change the set"}, {"time": 239090, "text": "for "Les Mis" versus
"Little Shop of Horrors.""}, {"time": 242398, "text": "I'm combining specific types of signals"}, {"time": 245106, "text": "that mimic how our body responds to injury
to help us regenerate."}, {"time": 250283, "text": "In the future, we could see
a scar-proof band-aid,"}, {"time": 253835, "text": "a moldable muscle filler
or even a wound-healing vaccine."}, {"time": 257837, "text": "Now, we aren't going to wake up tomorrow
and be able to heal like Wolverine."}, {"time": 261438, "text": "Probably not next Tuesday, either."}, {"time": 263328, "text": "But with these advances,"}, {"time": 264536, "text": "and working with our immune system
to help build tissue and heal wounds,"}, {"time": 268765, "text": "we could begin seeing
products on the market"}, {"time": 271018, "text": "that work with our body's defense system
to help us regenerate,"}, {"time": 274908, "text": "and maybe one day be able
to keep pace with a salamander."}, {"time": 279876, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 281051, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: niels_van_namen_why_the_hospital_of_the_future_will_be_your_own_home
speaker: Niels van Namen
title: Why the hospital of the future will be your own home
transcript:
[{"time": 1600, "text": "Probably not a surprise to you,"}, {"time": 4200, "text": "but I don't like to be in a hospital"}, {"time": 6360, "text": "or go to a hospital."}, {"time": 8039, "text": "Do you?"}, {"time": 9840, "text": "I'm sure many of you
feel the same way, right?"}, {"time": 12320, "text": "But why? Why is it
that we hate hospitals so much?"}, {"time": 16360, "text": "Or is it just a fact of life
we have to live with?"}, {"time": 19680, "text": "Is it the crappy food?"}, {"time": 22480, "text": "Is it the expensive parking?"}, {"time": 24560, "text": "Is it the intense smell?"}, {"time": 26360, "text": "Or is it the fear of the unknown?"}, {"time": 29040, "text": "Well, it's all of that, and it's more."}, {"time": 33160, "text": "Patients often have
to travel long distances"}, {"time": 35680, "text": "to get to their nearest hospital,"}, {"time": 38920, "text": "and access to hospital care
is becoming more and more an issue"}, {"time": 42280, "text": "in rural areas,"}, {"time": 43960, "text": "in the US,"}, {"time": 45280, "text": "but also in sparsely populated
countries like Sweden."}, {"time": 49240, "text": "And even when hospitals are more abundant,"}, {"time": 53040, "text": "typically the poor and the elderly"}, {"time": 55080, "text": "have trouble getting care
because they lack transportation"}, {"time": 58160, "text": "that is convenient and affordable to them."}, {"time": 61840, "text": "And many people are avoiding
hospital care altogether,"}, {"time": 66400, "text": "and they miss getting proper treatment"}, {"time": 68440, "text": "due to cost."}, {"time": 70720, "text": "We see that 64 percent of Americans"}, {"time": 74440, "text": "are avoiding care due to cost."}, {"time": 78760, "text": "And even when you do get treatment,"}, {"time": 81840, "text": "hospitals often make us sicker."}, {"time": 85320, "text": "Medical errors are reported to be
the third cause of death in the US,"}, {"time": 91120, "text": "just behind cancer and heart disease,"}, {"time": 94560, "text": "the third cause of death."}, {"time": 97680, "text": "I'm in health care for over 20 years now,"}, {"time": 99800, "text": "and I witness every day how broken
and how obsolete our hospital system is."}, {"time": 106440, "text": "Let me give you two examples."}, {"time": 108200, "text": "Four in 10 Japanese medical doctors"}, {"time": 111480, "text": "and five in 10 American medical doctors"}, {"time": 114320, "text": "are burnt out."}, {"time": 116520, "text": "In my home country, the Netherlands,"}, {"time": 119000, "text": "only 17 million people live there."}, {"time": 121200, "text": "We are short 125,000 nurses
over the coming years."}, {"time": 127920, "text": "But how did we even end up here,"}, {"time": 129680, "text": "in this idea of placing
all kinds of sick people"}, {"time": 132520, "text": "together in one big building?"}, {"time": 135680, "text": "Well, we have to go back
to the Ancient Greeks."}, {"time": 139200, "text": "In 400 BC, temples for cure were erected"}, {"time": 142360, "text": "where people could go
to get their diagnosis,"}, {"time": 144880, "text": "their treatment and their healing."}, {"time": 147360, "text": "And then really for about 2,000 years,"}, {"time": 150800, "text": "we've seen religious care centers"}, {"time": 153320, "text": "all the way up
to the Industrial Revolution,"}, {"time": 156920, "text": "where we've seen hospitals
being set up as assembly lines"}, {"time": 164000, "text": "based on the principles
of the Industrial Revolution,"}, {"time": 166520, "text": "to produce efficiently"}, {"time": 168000, "text": "and get the products,
the patients in this case,"}, {"time": 170760, "text": "out of the hospital as soon as possible."}, {"time": 174520, "text": "Over the last century, we've seen
lots of interesting innovations."}, {"time": 178840, "text": "We figured out how to make insulin."}, {"time": 181320, "text": "We invented pacemakers and X-ray,"}, {"time": 184120, "text": "and we even came into this wonderful
new era of cell and gene therapies."}, {"time": 189800, "text": "But the biggest change
to fix our hospital system altogether"}, {"time": 194320, "text": "is still ahead of us."}, {"time": 196360, "text": "And I believe it's time now,
we have the opportunity,"}, {"time": 199240, "text": "to revolutionize the system altogether"}, {"time": 202320, "text": "and forget about
our current hospital system."}, {"time": 205120, "text": "I believe it's time to create a new system"}, {"time": 207360, "text": "that revolves around health care at home."}, {"time": 211840, "text": "Recent research has shown"}, {"time": 214440, "text": "that 46 percent of hospital care"}, {"time": 217720, "text": "can move to the patient's home."}, {"time": 220400, "text": "That's a lot."}, {"time": 222200, "text": "And that's mainly for those patients
who suffer from chronic diseases."}, {"time": 226560, "text": "With that, hospitals can and should"}, {"time": 229560, "text": "reduce to smaller,
agile and mobile care centers"}, {"time": 233520, "text": "focused on acute care."}, {"time": 235840, "text": "So things like neonatology,
intensive care, surgery and imaging"}, {"time": 241960, "text": "will still remain at the hospitals,"}, {"time": 244040, "text": "at least I believe
for the foreseeable future."}, {"time": 248600, "text": "A few weeks ago, I met a colleague"}, {"time": 250600, "text": "whose mom was diagnosed
with incurable cancer,"}, {"time": 253880, "text": "and she said, "Niels, it's hard."}, {"time": 255720, "text": "It's so hard when we know
that she's got only months to live."}, {"time": 260560, "text": "Instead of playing with the grandchildren,"}, {"time": 262640, "text": "she now has to travel three times a week"}, {"time": 266160, "text": "two hours up and down to Amsterdam"}, {"time": 268160, "text": "just to get her treatment and tests.""}, {"time": 271160, "text": "And that really breaks my heart,"}, {"time": 273600, "text": "because we all know
that a professional nurse"}, {"time": 277120, "text": "could draw her blood
at home as well, right?"}, {"time": 279720, "text": "And if she could get her tests
and treatment at home as well,"}, {"time": 283360, "text": "she could do the things
that are really important to her"}, {"time": 286760, "text": "in her last months."}, {"time": 289160, "text": "My own mom, 82 years old now --
God bless her --"}, {"time": 294720, "text": "she's avoiding to go to the hospital"}, {"time": 296600, "text": "because she finds it difficult
to plan and manage the journey."}, {"time": 300560, "text": "So my sisters and I, we help her out."}, {"time": 303560, "text": "But there's many elderly people
who are avoiding care"}, {"time": 306800, "text": "and are waiting that long
that it becomes life-threatening,"}, {"time": 310240, "text": "and it's straight
to the costly, intensive care."}, {"time": 314240, "text": "Dr. Covinsky, a clinical researcher
at the University of California,"}, {"time": 318120, "text": "he concludes that a third
of patients over 70"}, {"time": 321680, "text": "and more than half of patients over 85,"}, {"time": 324800, "text": "leave the hospital more disabled
than when they came in."}, {"time": 329360, "text": "And a very practical problem"}, {"time": 332920, "text": "that many patients face
when they have to go to a hospital is:"}, {"time": 336400, "text": "Where do I go with my main
companion in life,"}, {"time": 340960, "text": "where do I go with my dog?"}, {"time": 345240, "text": "That's our dog, by the way.
Isn't she cute?"}, {"time": 347320, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 350880, "text": "But it's not only about convenience."}, {"time": 352880, "text": "It's also about unnecessary
health care stays and costs."}, {"time": 357800, "text": "A friend of mine, Art,"}, {"time": 359280, "text": "he recently needed to be hospitalized
for just a minor surgery,"}, {"time": 363120, "text": "and he had to stay in the hospital
for over two weeks,"}, {"time": 365880, "text": "just because he needed
a specific kind of IV antibiotics."}, {"time": 369840, "text": "So he occupied a bed for two weeks"}, {"time": 373040, "text": "that cost over a thousand euros a day."}, {"time": 375840, "text": "It's just ridiculous."}, {"time": 377840, "text": "And these costs are really
at the heart of the issue."}, {"time": 380880, "text": "So we've seen over many
of our global economies,"}, {"time": 383160, "text": "health care expense grow
as a percentage of GDP"}, {"time": 386360, "text": "over the last years."}, {"time": 388080, "text": "So here we see
that over the last 50 years,"}, {"time": 391040, "text": "health care expense has grown
from about five percent in Germany"}, {"time": 395080, "text": "to about 11 percent now."}, {"time": 398000, "text": "In the US, we've seen growth
from six percent to over 17 percent now."}, {"time": 404160, "text": "And a large portion of these costs
are driven by investments"}, {"time": 408160, "text": "in large, shiny hospital buildings."}, {"time": 411720, "text": "And these buildings are not flexible,"}, {"time": 413560, "text": "and they maintain a system
where hospital beds need to be filled"}, {"time": 416720, "text": "for a hospital to run efficiently."}, {"time": 419480, "text": "There's no incentive
for a hospital to run with less beds."}, {"time": 423880, "text": "Just the thought of that
makes you sick, right?"}, {"time": 426960, "text": "And here's the thing: the cost
for treating my buddy Art at home"}, {"time": 430720, "text": "can be up to 10 times cheaper
than hospital care."}, {"time": 435240, "text": "And that is where we're headed."}, {"time": 437640, "text": "The hospital bed of the future
will be in our own homes."}, {"time": 442240, "text": "And it's already starting."}, {"time": 443600, "text": "Global home care is growing
10 percent year over year."}, {"time": 447640, "text": "And from my own experience,
I see that logistics and technology"}, {"time": 452240, "text": "are making these home
health care solutions work."}, {"time": 456240, "text": "Technology is already
allowing us to do things"}, {"time": 458560, "text": "that were once exclusive to hospitals."}, {"time": 461720, "text": "Diagnosis tests like blood,"}, {"time": 464400, "text": "glucose tests, urine tests, can now
be taken in the comfort of our homes."}, {"time": 469080, "text": "And more and more connected devices"}, {"time": 473400, "text": "we see like pacemakers and insulin pumps"}, {"time": 476120, "text": "that will proactively signal
if help is needed soon."}, {"time": 480840, "text": "And all that technology is coming together"}, {"time": 482920, "text": "in much more insights
into the patients' health,"}, {"time": 486240, "text": "and that insight and all of
the information leads to better control"}, {"time": 490280, "text": "and to less medical errors --"}, {"time": 492360, "text": "remember, the third cause of death"}, {"time": 495160, "text": "in the US."}, {"time": 497600, "text": "And I see it every day at work."}, {"time": 499360, "text": "I work in logistics"}, {"time": 501080, "text": "and for me, home health care works."}, {"time": 506040, "text": "So we see a delivery driver
deliver the medicine"}, {"time": 510200, "text": "to the patient's home."}, {"time": 512480, "text": "A nurse joins him
and actually administers the drug"}, {"time": 515960, "text": "at the patient's home."}, {"time": 518679, "text": "It's that simple."}, {"time": 520400, "text": "Remember my buddy, Art?"}, {"time": 522039, "text": "He can now get the IV antibiotics
in the comfort of his home:"}, {"time": 525840, "text": "no hospital pajamas, no crappy food"}, {"time": 529600, "text": "and no risk of these
antibiotic-resistant superbugs"}, {"time": 534480, "text": "that only bite you in these hospitals."}, {"time": 536880, "text": "And it goes further."}, {"time": 538160, "text": "So now the elderly people
can get the treatment that they need"}, {"time": 542680, "text": "in the comfort of their own home"}, {"time": 544680, "text": "while with their best companion in life."}, {"time": 547200, "text": "And there's no need anymore
to drive hours and hours"}, {"time": 550560, "text": "just to get your treatment and tests."}, {"time": 553560, "text": "In the Netherlands and in Denmark,"}, {"time": 555240, "text": "we've seen very good successes
in cancer clinics"}, {"time": 557960, "text": "organizing chemotherapies
at the patient's homes,"}, {"time": 562360, "text": "sometimes even together
with fellow patients."}, {"time": 566080, "text": "The best improvements for these patients"}, {"time": 568640, "text": "have been improvements
in reduction in stress,"}, {"time": 572160, "text": "anxiety disorders and depression."}, {"time": 575920, "text": "Home health care also helped them
to get back a sense of normality"}, {"time": 579600, "text": "and freedom in their lives,"}, {"time": 581960, "text": "and they've actually helped them
to forget about their disease."}, {"time": 587600, "text": "But home health care, Niels --"}, {"time": 590240, "text": "what if I don't even have a home,
when I'm homeless,"}, {"time": 594160, "text": "or when I do have a home
but there's no one to take care of me"}, {"time": 597560, "text": "or even open up the door?"}, {"time": 600040, "text": "Well, in comes our sharing economy,"}, {"time": 603440, "text": "or, as I like to call it,
the Airbnb for home care."}, {"time": 607360, "text": "In the Netherlands,
we see churches and care organizations"}, {"time": 610720, "text": "match people in need of care and company"}, {"time": 613600, "text": "with people who actually
have a home for them"}, {"time": 615760, "text": "and can provide care and company to them."}, {"time": 618520, "text": "Home health care is cheaper,"}, {"time": 620440, "text": "it's easier to facilitate,
and it's quick to set up --"}, {"time": 624080, "text": "in these rural areas we talked about,
but also in humanitarian crisis situations"}, {"time": 628680, "text": "where it's often safer, quicker
and cheaper to set things up at home."}, {"time": 636080, "text": "Home health care is very applicable
in prosperous areas"}, {"time": 640320, "text": "but also very much
in underserved communities."}, {"time": 643920, "text": "Home health care
works in developed countries"}, {"time": 646080, "text": "as well as in developing countries."}, {"time": 648760, "text": "So I'm passionate to help facilitate
improvements in patients' lives"}, {"time": 654600, "text": "due to home health care."}, {"time": 656560, "text": "I'm passionate to help facilitate"}, {"time": 659000, "text": "that the elderly people
get the treatment that they need"}, {"time": 661760, "text": "in the comfort of their own homes,"}, {"time": 663520, "text": "together with their
best companion in life."}, {"time": 666640, "text": "I'm passionate to make the change"}, {"time": 669160, "text": "and help ensure that patients,
and not their disease,"}, {"time": 672760, "text": "are in control of their lives."}, {"time": 675080, "text": "To me, that is health care
delivered at home."}, {"time": 678000, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 679240, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: kate_stone_the_press_trampled_on_my_privacy_here_s_how_i_took_back_my_story
speaker: Kate Stone
title: The press trampled on my privacy. Here's how I took back my story
transcript:
[{"time": 1349, "text": "Five years ago, I stood on the TED stage,
and I spoke about my work."}, {"time": 5373, "text": "But one year later,"}, {"time": 6700, "text": "I had a terrible accident as I left a pub
one dark night with friends,"}, {"time": 10417, "text": "in Scotland."}, {"time": 11870, "text": "As we followed the path through a forest,
I suddenly felt a massive thud,"}, {"time": 16592, "text": "then a second thud,"}, {"time": 17996, "text": "and I fell to the ground."}, {"time": 19687, "text": "I had no idea what had hit me."}, {"time": 22211, "text": "I later found out that when
the gate was opened on a garden,"}, {"time": 26657, "text": "a wild stag stampeded along the path
and ran straight into me."}, {"time": 32054, "text": "Its antler penetrated my trachea
and my esophagus"}, {"time": 35471, "text": "and stopped at my spinal cord
and fractured my neck."}, {"time": 39502, "text": "My best friend found me
lying on the floor,"}, {"time": 41775, "text": "gurgling for help
through a hole in my neck."}, {"time": 44641, "text": "And we locked eyes,
and although I couldn't speak,"}, {"time": 47347, "text": "she could understand what I was thinking."}, {"time": 49387, "text": "And she told me, "Just breathe.""}, {"time": 52659, "text": "And so, whilst focusing on my breath,
I had a strong sense of calmness,"}, {"time": 56744, "text": "but I was certain that I was going to die."}, {"time": 59137, "text": "Somehow, I was content with this,"}, {"time": 60805, "text": "because I've always tried
to do my best in life whenever I can."}, {"time": 63942, "text": "So I just continued to enjoy each breath
as one more moment --"}, {"time": 67165, "text": "one breath in and one breath out."}, {"time": 69813, "text": "An ambulance came,
I was still fully conscious,"}, {"time": 72186, "text": "and I analyzed everything on the journey,
because I'm a scientist:"}, {"time": 75439, "text": "the sound of the tires on the road,
the frequency of the street lights"}, {"time": 78812, "text": "and eventually, the city street lights."}, {"time": 80775, "text": "And I thought, "Maybe I will survive.""}, {"time": 83054, "text": "And then I passed out."}, {"time": 86046, "text": "I was stabilized at a local hospital
and then airlifted to Glasgow,"}, {"time": 90292, "text": "where they reconstructed my throat
and put me in a coma."}, {"time": 94761, "text": "And while I was in the coma,
I had many alternate realities."}, {"time": 97984, "text": "It was like a crazy mix
of "Westworld" and "Black Mirror.""}, {"time": 101641, "text": "But that's a whole other story."}, {"time": 104165, "text": "My local TV station reported live
from outside the hospital"}, {"time": 107843, "text": "of a Cambridge scientist
who was in a coma,"}, {"time": 111312, "text": "and they didn't know
if she would live or die or walk or talk."}, {"time": 115855, "text": "And a week later,
I woke up from that coma."}, {"time": 120163, "text": "And that was the first gift."}, {"time": 122093, "text": "Then I had the gift to think,
the gift to move,"}, {"time": 125268, "text": "the gift to breathe"}, {"time": 127334, "text": "and the gift to eat and to drink."}, {"time": 129481, "text": "That took three and a half months."}, {"time": 132339, "text": "But there was one thing
that I never got back, though,"}, {"time": 134911, "text": "and that was my privacy."}, {"time": 136664, "text": "The tabloid press
made the story about gender."}, {"time": 139498, "text": "Look -- I'm transgender,
it's not that big a deal."}, {"time": 142641, "text": "Like, my hair color or my shoe size
is way more interesting."}, {"time": 147393, "text": "When I last spoke here --"}, {"time": 148871, "text": "(Applause)"}, {"time": 150046, "text": "When I last spoke here --"}, {"time": 151269, "text": "(Applause)"}, {"time": 152458, "text": "at TED, I didn't talk about it,
because it's boring."}, {"time": 155727, "text": "And one Scottish newspaper
ran with the headline:"}, {"time": 158830, "text": ""Sex Swap Scientist Gored by Stag.""}, {"time": 161417, "text": "And five others did similar things."}, {"time": 163664, "text": "And for a minute, I was angry."}, {"time": 165442, "text": "But then I found my calm place."}, {"time": 167673, "text": "And what ran through my head was,
"They've crossed the wrong woman,"}, {"time": 170863, "text": "and they're not going to know
what's hit them.""}, {"time": 173156, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 174922, "text": "I'm a kindness ninja."}, {"time": 176153, "text": "I don't really know what a ninja does,"}, {"time": 178022, "text": "but to me, they slip through the shadows,
crawl through the sewers,"}, {"time": 181230, "text": "skip across the rooftops,"}, {"time": 182684, "text": "and before you know it,
they're behind you."}, {"time": 184720, "text": "They don't turn up
with an army or complain,"}, {"time": 186995, "text": "and they're laser-focused on a plan."}, {"time": 188781, "text": "So when I lay in my hospital bed,"}, {"time": 190608, "text": "I thought of my plan
to help reduce the chances"}, {"time": 193657, "text": "of them doing this to somebody else,"}, {"time": 195530, "text": "by using the system as is, and paying
the price of sacrificing my privacy."}, {"time": 200616, "text": "What they told one million people,
I will tell 10 million people."}, {"time": 204887, "text": "Because when you're angry,
people defend themselves."}, {"time": 207385, "text": "So I didn't attack them,"}, {"time": 208769, "text": "and they were defenseless."}, {"time": 210297, "text": "I wrote kind and calm letters
to these newspapers."}, {"time": 214282, "text": "And The Sun newspaper,
the kind of "Fox News" of the UK,"}, {"time": 217560, "text": "thanked me for my "reasoned approach.""}, {"time": 220696, "text": "I asked for no apology,
no retraction, no money,"}, {"time": 224593, "text": "just an acknowledgment
that they broke their own rules,"}, {"time": 227196, "text": "and what they did was just wrong."}, {"time": 231022, "text": "And on this journey,
I started to learn who they are,"}, {"time": 234670, "text": "and they began to learn who I am."}, {"time": 236963, "text": "And we actually became friends."}, {"time": 238797, "text": "I've even had a few glasses of wine
with Philippa from The Sun since then."}, {"time": 243273, "text": "And after three months, they all agreed,"}, {"time": 245661, "text": "and the statements
were published on a Friday,"}, {"time": 247837, "text": "and that was the end of that."}, {"time": 249249, "text": "Or so they thought."}, {"time": 250520, "text": "On the Saturday,
I went on the evening news,"}, {"time": 253621, "text": "with the headline "Six National
Newspapers Admit They Were Wrong.""}, {"time": 257882, "text": "And the anchor said to me,"}, {"time": 259410, "text": ""But don't you think
it's our job as journalists"}, {"time": 261805, "text": "to sensationalize a story?""}, {"time": 263619, "text": "And I said, "I was laying
on a forest floor, gored by a stag."}, {"time": 268413, "text": "Is that not sensational enough?""}, {"time": 270000, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 272746, "text": "And I was now writing the headlines."}, {"time": 274538, "text": "My favorite one was,"}, {"time": 276188, "text": ""The stag trampled on my throat,
and the press trampled on my privacy.""}, {"time": 280442, "text": "It was the most read piece
of BBC News online that day."}, {"time": 283736, "text": "And I was kind of having fun."}, {"time": 286379, "text": "And by the end of my week of media,"}, {"time": 288181, "text": "I started to use my newfound
voice and platform"}, {"time": 291085, "text": "to spread a message of love and kindness."}, {"time": 293608, "text": "And when I had the minute
of anger and hatred"}, {"time": 296696, "text": "towards those press and journalists,"}, {"time": 298546, "text": "I had to identify my inner
bigotry towards them."}, {"time": 303188, "text": "And I had to meet and speak
with these people"}, {"time": 305672, "text": "without judgment."}, {"time": 307482, "text": "I had to let myself understand them,"}, {"time": 309649, "text": "and in return, they began
to understand me."}, {"time": 312919, "text": "Well, six months later, they asked me
to join the committee"}, {"time": 315847, "text": "that regulates the press."}, {"time": 318679, "text": "And a few times a year,
I sip tea and dip biscuits"}, {"time": 322234, "text": "with the likes of Daily Mail editor
Paul Dacre, who says to me,"}, {"time": 325677, "text": ""So, Kate, how have
your last few months been?""}, {"time": 328863, "text": "And I respect them."}, {"time": 330490, "text": "And I'm now one of three
members of the public"}, {"time": 332697, "text": "who has a seat at the table --"}, {"time": 334300, "text": "not because I'm different,"}, {"time": 335911, "text": "but because my voice counts,
just like anybody else."}, {"time": 339521, "text": "And the irony is,"}, {"time": 341045, "text": "every now and again, I'm asked
to visit those printing presses"}, {"time": 344029, "text": "of this declining industry,"}, {"time": 345919, "text": "because some people think"}, {"time": 347475, "text": "that the technology I spoke about here,
last time at TED, my interactive print,"}, {"time": 352702, "text": "might actually help save them."}, {"time": 355053, "text": "So beware of your inner bigot,"}, {"time": 357771, "text": "and make friends from your enemies."}, {"time": 360246, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 361429, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: sian_leah_beilock_why_we_choke_under_pressure_and_how_to_avoid_it
speaker: Sian Leah Beilock
title: Why we choke under pressure — and how to avoid it
transcript:
[{"time": 760, "text": "One of the most humiliating things"}, {"time": 3160, "text": "that you can say about someone
is "they choked.""}, {"time": 7640, "text": "And boy, do I know that feeling."}, {"time": 10720, "text": "Growing up, I was an avid athlete."}, {"time": 13120, "text": "My main sport was soccer,
and I was a goalkeeper,"}, {"time": 16920, "text": "which is both the best
and the worst position on the field."}, {"time": 22640, "text": "You see, when you're a goalie,
you get this special uniform,"}, {"time": 25880, "text": "you get all the glory
for a great shot saved,"}, {"time": 29720, "text": "but you also get the grief
when you land a shot in the goal."}, {"time": 35080, "text": "When you're a goalie,"}, {"time": 36320, "text": "all eyes are on you,"}, {"time": 37960, "text": "and with that comes the pressure."}, {"time": 41360, "text": "I distinctly remember
one game in high school."}, {"time": 44280, "text": "I was playing for
the California state team"}, {"time": 46560, "text": "which is part of the Olympic
Development Program."}, {"time": 49760, "text": "I was having a great game ..."}, {"time": 52200, "text": "until I realized that the national coach
was standing right behind me."}, {"time": 59240, "text": "That's when everything changed."}, {"time": 62400, "text": "In a matter of seconds,"}, {"time": 64200, "text": "I went from playing at the top
to the bottom of my ability."}, {"time": 70040, "text": "Just knowing that I was being evaluated
changed my performance"}, {"time": 75400, "text": "and forever how I thought about
the mental aspect of how we perform."}, {"time": 82320, "text": "All of a sudden the ball
seemed to go in slow motion,"}, {"time": 86120, "text": "and I was fixated on my every move."}, {"time": 90120, "text": "The next shot that came I bobbled,"}, {"time": 92200, "text": "but thankfully it didn't land in the goal."}, {"time": 95080, "text": "The shot after that,"}, {"time": 96720, "text": "I wasn't so lucky:"}, {"time": 98520, "text": "I tipped it right into the net."}, {"time": 102160, "text": "My team lost;"}, {"time": 104040, "text": "the national coach walked away."}, {"time": 107160, "text": "I choked under the pressure
of those evaluative eyes on me."}, {"time": 113840, "text": "Just about everyone
does it from time to time --"}, {"time": 116600, "text": "there are so many opportunities,"}, {"time": 119080, "text": "whether it's taking a test,"}, {"time": 121120, "text": "giving a talk,"}, {"time": 122680, "text": "pitching to a client"}, {"time": 124600, "text": "or that special form of torture
I like to call the job interview."}, {"time": 129600, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 131120, "text": "But the question is why."}, {"time": 133000, "text": "Why do we sometimes fail to perform
up to our potential under pressure?"}, {"time": 137880, "text": "It's especially bewildering
in the case of athletes"}, {"time": 141280, "text": "who spend so much time
physically honing their craft."}, {"time": 145880, "text": "But what about their minds?"}, {"time": 148360, "text": "Not as much."}, {"time": 150160, "text": "This is true off
the playing field as well."}, {"time": 153120, "text": "Whether we're taking a test
of giving a talk,"}, {"time": 156600, "text": "it's easy to feel like we're ready --"}, {"time": 158480, "text": "at the top of our game --"}, {"time": 160160, "text": "and then perform at our worst
when it matters most."}, {"time": 164880, "text": "It turns out that rarely do we practice"}, {"time": 167400, "text": "under the types of conditions
we're actually going to perform under,"}, {"time": 171240, "text": "and as a result,"}, {"time": 172520, "text": "when all eyes are on us,"}, {"time": 174640, "text": "we sometimes flub our performance."}, {"time": 178440, "text": "Of course, the question is,
why is this the case?"}, {"time": 182560, "text": "And my experience on the playing field --"}, {"time": 185600, "text": "and in other important
facets of my life --"}, {"time": 188280, "text": "really pushed me into the field
of cognitive science."}, {"time": 191440, "text": "I wanted to know how we could reach
our limitless potential."}, {"time": 196440, "text": "I wanted to understand
how we could use our knowledge"}, {"time": 199600, "text": "of the mind and the brain"}, {"time": 201560, "text": "to come up with psychological tools
that would help us perform at our best."}, {"time": 207960, "text": "So why does it happen?"}, {"time": 209760, "text": "Why do we sometimes fail
to perform up to what we're capable of"}, {"time": 214080, "text": "when the pressure is on?"}, {"time": 216960, "text": "It may not be so surprising to hear
that in stressful situations, we worry."}, {"time": 221760, "text": "We worry about the situation,"}, {"time": 224000, "text": "the consequences,"}, {"time": 225520, "text": "what others will think of us."}, {"time": 227960, "text": "But what is surprising
is that we often get in our own way"}, {"time": 232400, "text": "precisely because our worries
prompt us to concentrate too much."}, {"time": 237960, "text": "That's right --"}, {"time": 239200, "text": "we pay too much attention
to what we're doing."}, {"time": 242920, "text": "When we're concerned
about performing our best,"}, {"time": 245600, "text": "we often try and control
aspects of what we're doing"}, {"time": 249320, "text": "that are best left on autopilot,"}, {"time": 251720, "text": "outside conscious awareness,"}, {"time": 253880, "text": "and as a result,"}, {"time": 255520, "text": "we mess up."}, {"time": 257839, "text": "Think about a situation
where you're shuffling down the stairs."}, {"time": 261560, "text": "What would happen if I asked you"}, {"time": 263240, "text": "to think about what
you're doing with your knee"}, {"time": 265480, "text": "while you're doing that?"}, {"time": 266760, "text": "There's a good chance
you'd fall on your face."}, {"time": 269600, "text": "We as humans only have the ability
to pay attention to so much at once,"}, {"time": 274440, "text": "which is why, by the way,"}, {"time": 275720, "text": "it's not a good idea
to drive and talk on the cell phone."}, {"time": 279280, "text": "And under pressure,"}, {"time": 280560, "text": "when we're concerned
about performing at our best,"}, {"time": 283080, "text": "we can try and control
aspects of what we're doing"}, {"time": 286720, "text": "that should be left
outside conscious control."}, {"time": 290560, "text": "The end result is that we mess up."}, {"time": 293720, "text": "My research team and I have studied
this phenomenon of overattention,"}, {"time": 298040, "text": "and we call it paralysis by analysis."}, {"time": 302160, "text": "In one study, we asked college
soccer players to dribble a soccer ball"}, {"time": 306080, "text": "and to pay attention
to an aspect of their performance"}, {"time": 309520, "text": "that they would not otherwise attend to."}, {"time": 312707, "text": "We asked them to pay attention"}, {"time": 314160, "text": "to what side of the foot
was contacting the ball."}, {"time": 318040, "text": "We showed that performance
was slower and more error-prone"}, {"time": 322160, "text": "when we drew their attention
to the step-by-step details"}, {"time": 325720, "text": "of what they were doing."}, {"time": 327560, "text": "When the pressure is on,"}, {"time": 329080, "text": "we're often concerned
with performing at our best,"}, {"time": 332240, "text": "and as a result we try and control
what we're doing"}, {"time": 335720, "text": "to force the best performance."}, {"time": 338120, "text": "The end result
is that we actually screw up."}, {"time": 342120, "text": "In basketball,"}, {"time": 343400, "text": "the term "unconscious" is used
to describe a shooter who can't miss."}, {"time": 349000, "text": "And San Antonio Spurs star
Tim Duncan has said,"}, {"time": 353040, "text": ""When you have to stop and think,
that's when you mess up.""}, {"time": 356920, "text": "In dance, the great choreographer,
George Balanchine,"}, {"time": 360680, "text": "used to urge his dancers,"}, {"time": 362520, "text": ""Don't think, just do.""}, {"time": 365800, "text": "When the pressure's on,"}, {"time": 367320, "text": "when we want to put our best foot forward,"}, {"time": 369880, "text": "somewhat ironically,"}, {"time": 371120, "text": "we often try and control what we're doing
in a way that leads to worse performance."}, {"time": 378240, "text": "So what do we do?"}, {"time": 379680, "text": "Knowing that we have
this overactive attention,"}, {"time": 383360, "text": "how do we ensure
that we perform at our best?"}, {"time": 387720, "text": "A lot of it comes down
to the prefrontal cortex,"}, {"time": 390240, "text": "that front part of our brain
that sits over our eyes"}, {"time": 393320, "text": "and usually helps us
focus in positive ways."}, {"time": 396320, "text": "It often gets hooked on the wrong things."}, {"time": 399240, "text": "So how do we unhook it?"}, {"time": 401760, "text": "Something as simple as singing a song,"}, {"time": 405160, "text": "or paying attention to one's pinky toe,"}, {"time": 407360, "text": "as pro golfer Jack Nicklaus
was rumored to do,"}, {"time": 410600, "text": "can help us take our mind
off those pesky details."}, {"time": 415640, "text": "It's also true that practicing
under conditions"}, {"time": 419000, "text": "that we're going to perform under --"}, {"time": 421200, "text": "closing the gap between
training and competition"}, {"time": 424360, "text": "can help us get used
to that feeling of all eyes on us."}, {"time": 428800, "text": "This is true off
the playing field as well."}, {"time": 431800, "text": "Whether it's getting ready for an exam"}, {"time": 434880, "text": "or preparing for a big talk --"}, {"time": 437280, "text": "one that might have
a little pressure associated with it --"}, {"time": 440160, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 441280, "text": "getting used to the types of situations
you're going to perform under"}, {"time": 444560, "text": "really matters."}, {"time": 446040, "text": "When you're taking a test, close the book,"}, {"time": 448560, "text": "practice retrieving the answer
from memory under timed situations,"}, {"time": 452520, "text": "and when you're giving a talk,"}, {"time": 454040, "text": "practice in front of others."}, {"time": 455560, "text": "And if you can't find anyone
who will listen,"}, {"time": 458080, "text": "practice in front of a video camera
or even a mirror."}, {"time": 461280, "text": "The ability to get used to what it will
feel like can make the difference"}, {"time": 466440, "text": "in whether we choke or thrive."}, {"time": 469600, "text": "We've also figured out some ways
to get rid of those pesky worries"}, {"time": 472760, "text": "and self-doubts that tend to creep up
in the stressful situations."}, {"time": 477240, "text": "Researchers have shown that simply
jotting down your thoughts and worries"}, {"time": 480720, "text": "before a stressful event"}, {"time": 482520, "text": "can help to download them from mind --"}, {"time": 485160, "text": "make them less likely
to pop up in the moment."}, {"time": 488800, "text": "It's kind of like when you wake up
in the middle of the night"}, {"time": 491720, "text": "and you're really worried
about what you have to do the next day,"}, {"time": 494840, "text": "you're trying to think about
everything you have to accomplish,"}, {"time": 497840, "text": "and you write it down
and then you can go back to sleep."}, {"time": 500520, "text": "Journaling, or getting
those thoughts down on paper,"}, {"time": 503080, "text": "makes it less likely they'll pop up
and distract you in the moment."}, {"time": 507080, "text": "The end result is that you can
perform your best when it matters most."}, {"time": 513120, "text": "So up until now,"}, {"time": 514640, "text": "I've talked about what happens
when we put limits on ourselves"}, {"time": 518679, "text": "and some tips we can use
to help perform up to our potential."}, {"time": 523159, "text": "But it's important to remember"}, {"time": 524640, "text": "that it's not just
our own individual being"}, {"time": 528760, "text": "that can put limits
and that can perform poorly;"}, {"time": 531720, "text": "our environment has an effect
on whether we choke or thrive."}, {"time": 535760, "text": "Our parents, our teachers,
our coaches, our bosses all influence"}, {"time": 540720, "text": "whether or not we can put our best
foot forward when it matters most."}, {"time": 546280, "text": "Take math as an example."}, {"time": 549240, "text": "That's right, I said it:"}, {"time": 550760, "text": "math."}, {"time": 552200, "text": "Lots of people profess to choke
or are anxious about doing math,"}, {"time": 556920, "text": "whether it's taking a test or even
calculating the tip on a dinner bill"}, {"time": 561040, "text": "as our smart friends look on."}, {"time": 565080, "text": "And it's quite socially acceptable"}, {"time": 567040, "text": "to talk about choking
or performing poorly in math."}, {"time": 570640, "text": "You don't hear highly educated people
walking around talking about the fact"}, {"time": 574680, "text": "or bragging about the fact
that they're not good readers,"}, {"time": 577600, "text": "but you hear people all the time bragging
about how they're not math people."}, {"time": 582720, "text": "And unfortunately,"}, {"time": 583960, "text": "in the US, this tends to be
more so among girls and women"}, {"time": 588120, "text": "than boys and men."}, {"time": 591040, "text": "My research team and I
have tried to understand"}, {"time": 595120, "text": "where this fear of math comes from,"}, {"time": 597520, "text": "and we've actually peered
inside the brains"}, {"time": 599680, "text": "using functional magnetic
resonance imaging,"}, {"time": 602440, "text": "of people who are worried about math."}, {"time": 605040, "text": "We've shown that math phobia correlates
with a concrete visceral sensation"}, {"time": 610560, "text": "such as pain,"}, {"time": 611920, "text": "of which we have
every right to feel anxious."}, {"time": 615200, "text": "In fact, when people
who are worried about math"}, {"time": 617920, "text": "are just getting ready
to take a math test --"}, {"time": 620680, "text": "they're not even taking it,
they're just getting ready --"}, {"time": 623400, "text": "areas of the brain known the be involved
in our neural pain response are active."}, {"time": 629880, "text": "When we say math is painful,"}, {"time": 631400, "text": "there's some truth to it for some people."}, {"time": 635960, "text": "But where does this
math anxiety come from?"}, {"time": 638880, "text": "It turns out that math
anxiety is contagious."}, {"time": 643560, "text": "When adults are worried about math,"}, {"time": 646000, "text": "the children around them
start worrying, too."}, {"time": 649040, "text": "As young as first grade,"}, {"time": 651360, "text": "when kids are in classrooms"}, {"time": 652880, "text": "with teachers who are anxious
about their own math ability,"}, {"time": 656440, "text": "these kids learn less
across the school year."}, {"time": 659680, "text": "And it turns out that this
is more prevalent in girls than boys."}, {"time": 664560, "text": "At this young age,"}, {"time": 665800, "text": "kids tend to mimic same-sex adults,"}, {"time": 669120, "text": "and at least in the US,"}, {"time": 670680, "text": "over 90 percent of our elementary
school teachers are women."}, {"time": 676320, "text": "Of course, it's not just
what happens in the classroom."}, {"time": 679720, "text": "Social media plays a big role here, too."}, {"time": 682760, "text": "It wasn't so long ago"}, {"time": 684560, "text": "that you could purchase a Teen Talk Barbie"}, {"time": 687600, "text": "that when the cord was pulled,"}, {"time": 689080, "text": "it would say things like,"}, {"time": 690800, "text": ""Will we ever have enough clothes?""}, {"time": 693360, "text": "and "Math class is tough.""}, {"time": 696240, "text": "And just a few years ago,"}, {"time": 697640, "text": "major retailers were marketing
T-shirts at our young girls"}, {"time": 701560, "text": "that read things like,
"I'm too pretty to do math,""}, {"time": 706040, "text": "or, "I'm too pretty to do my homework
so my brother does it for me.""}, {"time": 711560, "text": "And let's not forget about the parents."}, {"time": 714120, "text": "Oh, the parents."}, {"time": 716480, "text": "It turns out that when parents are worried
about their own math ability"}, {"time": 720440, "text": "and they help their kids a lot
with math homework,"}, {"time": 723960, "text": "their kids learn less math
across the school year."}, {"time": 728760, "text": "As one parent put it,"}, {"time": 730800, "text": ""I judge my first grader's math homework"}, {"time": 733080, "text": "by whether it's a one-glass assignment
or a three-glass night.""}, {"time": 736760, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 740960, "text": "When adults are anxious
about their own math ability,"}, {"time": 743960, "text": "it rubs off on their kids"}, {"time": 745560, "text": "and it affects whether
they choke or thrive."}, {"time": 748960, "text": "But just as we can put limits on others,"}, {"time": 751240, "text": "we can take them off."}, {"time": 753200, "text": "My research team and I have shown"}, {"time": 754880, "text": "that when we help parents
do fun math activities with their kids --"}, {"time": 759120, "text": "rather than, say, just doing
bedtime stories or bedtime reading,"}, {"time": 763280, "text": "they do bedtime math,"}, {"time": 765280, "text": "which are fun story problems
to do with your kids at night,"}, {"time": 769320, "text": "not only do children's attitudes
about math improve,"}, {"time": 772360, "text": "but their math performance
across the school year improves as well."}, {"time": 777440, "text": "Our environment matters."}, {"time": 779840, "text": "From the classroom to parents to media,"}, {"time": 784000, "text": "and it can really make a difference
in terms of whether we choke or thrive."}, {"time": 791480, "text": "Fast-forward from
my high school soccer game"}, {"time": 796160, "text": "to my freshman year in college."}, {"time": 798720, "text": "I was in the chemistry sequence
for science majors,"}, {"time": 802200, "text": "and boy did I not belong."}, {"time": 805480, "text": "Even though I studied
for my first midterm exam --"}, {"time": 810320, "text": "I thought I was ready to go --"}, {"time": 812920, "text": "I bombed it."}, {"time": 814920, "text": "I literally got the worst grade
in a class of 400 students."}, {"time": 820800, "text": "I was convinced I wasn't going
to be a science major,"}, {"time": 823320, "text": "that maybe I was dropping
out of college altogether."}, {"time": 826680, "text": "But then I changed how I studied."}, {"time": 829760, "text": "Instead of studying alone,"}, {"time": 831400, "text": "I started studying with a group of friends"}, {"time": 833680, "text": "who at the end of the study session
would close their book"}, {"time": 837000, "text": "and compete for the right answer."}, {"time": 840120, "text": "We learned to practice under stress."}, {"time": 843280, "text": "If you could've looked inside my brain
during that first midterm exam,"}, {"time": 847200, "text": "you likely would've seen
a neural pain response"}, {"time": 850000, "text": "a lot like the math-anxious
individuals I study."}, {"time": 853680, "text": "It was probably there during
the stressful study situation as well."}, {"time": 858480, "text": "But when I walked into the final,"}, {"time": 860600, "text": "my mind was quiet,"}, {"time": 862360, "text": "and I actually got one of the highest
grades in the entire class."}, {"time": 868480, "text": "It wasn't just
about learning the material;"}, {"time": 871640, "text": "it was about learning how to overcome
my limits when it mattered most."}, {"time": 877960, "text": "What happens in our heads really matters,"}, {"time": 880880, "text": "and knowing this,"}, {"time": 883360, "text": "we can learn how to prepare ourselves
and others for success,"}, {"time": 888800, "text": "not just on the playing field
but in the boardroom"}, {"time": 891880, "text": "and in the classroom as well."}, {"time": 893920, "text": "Thank you."}, {"time": 895160, "text": "(Applause)"}]

name: simona_francese_your_fingerprints_reveal_more_than_you_think
speaker: Simona Francese
title: Your fingerprints reveal more than you think
transcript:
[{"time": 972, "text": "Do you ever stop and think,
during a romantic dinner,"}, {"time": 5882, "text": ""I've just left my fingerprints
all over my wine glass.""}, {"time": 8798, "text": "(Laughter)"}, {"time": 9823, "text": "Or do you ever worry,
when you visit a friend,"}, {"time": 12692, "text": "about leaving a little piece of you behind
on every surface that you touch?"}, {"time": 18009, "text": "And even this evening,"}, {"time": 19367, "text": "have you paid any attention
to sit without touching anything?"}, {"time": 24148, "text": "Well, you're not alone."}, {"time": 25759, "text": "Thankfully, criminals underestimate
the power of fingerprints, too."}, {"time": 30792, "text": "And I'm not just talking about
the twisted parting of lines"}, {"time": 34145, "text": "that make our fingerprint unique."}, {"time": 37277, "text": "I'm talking about
an entire world of information"}, {"time": 41596, "text": "hiding in a small, often invisible thing."}, {"time": 45718, "text": "In fact, fingerprints
are made up of molecules"}, {"time": 48428, "text": "that belong to three classes:"}, {"time": 50195, "text": "sweat molecules that we all produce
in very different amounts ..."}, {"time": 55021, "text": "molecules that we introduce into our body
and then we sweat out"}, {"time": 59476, "text": "and molecules that we may contaminate
our fingertips with"}, {"time": 63064, "text": "when we come across substances
like blood, paint, grease,"}, {"time": 66779, "text": "but also invisible substances."}, {"time": 69326, "text": "And molecules are
the storytellers of who we are"}, {"time": 74263, "text": "and what we've been up to."}, {"time": 76492, "text": "We just need to have
